title: Senior Media Buyer
description:
Senior Media Buyer Responsibilities:

Plan, launch, and optimize Meta ad campaigns across
 and Instagram

Manage ad budgets efficiently with a focus on cost-per-lead and ROAS

Develop and test audience targeting strategies (interest-based, lookalikes, retargeting)

Analyze campaign performance and make data-driven optimization decisions

Conduct A/B testing on creatives, copy, audiences, and placements

Communicate creative needs and feedback to design team to improve ad performance

Monitor ad account health and troubleshoot delivery issues

Stay current with Meta platform changes, algorithm updates, and best practices

Provide performance reports and insights to internal team



Required Experience



Proven track record managing Meta ad campaigns with measurable results

Experience managing at least $10,000/month in ad spend

Strong understanding of the full Meta ads ecosystem (campaign objectives, bidding strategies, pixel setup, conversions API)

Ability to analyze data and translate it into actionable optimizations

Experience with creative testing frameworks and knowing what makes ads convert

Excellent written English communication



Preferred Experience



Google Ads experience (Search, Display, Performance Max)

TikTok Ads experience

Healthcare, medical spa, aesthetics, or local service business experience

Experience with lead generation campaigns (not just e-commerce)

Familiarity with GoHighLevel or other CRM/marketing platforms





Who You Are

You're obsessed with performance. You check your campaigns like other people check social media.

You let data drive decisions. Gut feelings are fine—but you back them up with numbers.

You know how to spend money to make money. You understand that the goal is profitable growth, not just cheap leads.

You communicate clearly. When you need new creatives, you can articulate exactly what you need and why.

You stay ahead of the curve. Platform changes don't catch you off guard because you're always learning.

You own your results. No excuses, no finger-pointing. When something isn't working, you figure out why and fix it.



Do not
 me. All communication must happen within OnlineJobs.ph messaging.

You application must include "cheese potatoes" and use 2 AP (apply points)

Include a link to your resume and portfolio showing campaign results you've achieved (screenshots of ad manager, CPL, ROAS, etc.)

Include a brief Loom video (under 3 minutes) walking through one campaign you managed—show me the setup, the results, and what you learned

Tell me about a campaign that flopped and what you did to turn it around (or what you learned from it)



Applications without all of the above will not be considered.

title: Operation Manager/ Virtual Assistant
description:
OPERATIONS & SALES VIRTUAL ASSISTANT (COLD CALLING, CANVA, SOCIAL MEDIA)



Companies: DFW RideShare Rentals & Her Empire Vending

Location: Remote (DFW preferred for RideShare coordination)

Schedule: Full-Time (Monday–Friday; occasional weekends as needed)



ABOUT THE ROLE



We are hiring a highly organized, proactive, and results-driven Operations & Sales Virtual Assistant to support two fast-growing businesses: DFW RideShare Rentals and Her Empire Vending.



This role combines operations, administration, sales, cold calling, social media, and client support. This is NOT a passive assistant role. The ideal candidate is confident on the phone, detail-oriented, creative, and understands that follow-up and execution drive revenue.



RESPONSIBILITIES — DFW RIDESHARE RENTALS



Rental Operations & Administration

- Send weekly updated rental agreements

- Send payment reminders, late payment notices, and late fee notifications

- Track and apply late fees and administrative charges

- Upload and maintain current rental agreements

- Confirm payments via screenshots or receipts

- Maintain accurate renter files and documentation



Vehicle & Fleet Management

- Maintain an up-to-date tracker for:

  - Oil changes

  - Registration renewals

  - Insurance expirations

  - Routine maintenance

- Proactively flag upcoming service needs



Lead Follow-Up & Booking

- Call inbound RideShare rental leads

- Screen applicants and place qualified renters into available vehicles

- Maintain real-time vehicle availability records

- Update CRM or tracking systems with lead notes and statuses



RESPONSIBILITIES — HER EMPIRE VENDING



Vending Location Acquisition (Cold Calling Required)

- Make outbound cold calls to businesses to secure vending locations for clients

- Pitch vending placement opportunities professionally

- Follow up with decision-makers until placements are confirmed

- Track outreach efforts and placement approvals

- Coordinate approved locations for machine placement





Social Media & Brand Management

- Create original, high-quality Canva graphics and videos

- Post a minimum of:

  - 2 Reels per day

  - 2 Posts per day

- Upload and manage content across all social platforms

- Ensure consistent branding and messaging



Product Manuals & Client Resources

- Create professional, print-ready product manuals for vending machines

- Ensure manuals are branded, clear, and easy to follow

- Update and maintain coaching manuals and training resources

- Prepare materials for both digital delivery and physical printing



State Compliance & Coaching Manual Updates

- Research and update coaching materials to reflect:

  - State-specific vending laws and regulations

  - Licensing and permit requirements

  - Sales tax guidelines

  - Location compliance standards

- Customize coaching manuals by state when required

title: Executive Assistant
description:
I’m looking for a high-level Personal Executive Assistant to work directly with me as my right hand. Someone who can be all in and give their all! This is not a basic admin role. You will operate closely with me day-to-day, helping manage my calendar, priorities, communication, projects, and personal logistics as we continue scaling a fast-growing company.



I am the co-founder of BookDrop, a rapidly growing bulk book logistics and resale company. We operate high-volume warehouse systems, advanced data tracking, and fast-moving operational workflows. As we scale, I need someone who can think ahead, stay organized under pressure, and help me execute at a higher level across both business and personal responsibilities.



You will work extremely closely with me. Expect fast communication, changing priorities, and high standards. The right person will grow with the company and become deeply integrated into how I operate. I need someone who is all in!



This is a full-time remote role based in the Philippines, working Arizona hours (7:00 AM to 4:00 PM).



What You’ll Be Responsible For



You will help manage both executive operations and personal execution, including:

Acting as my right-hand assistant in daily decision support and execution

Managing my calendar, scheduling, reminders, and priority alignment

Handling administrative coordination across business and personal tasks

Supporting special projects tied to operations, growth, and leadership

Organizing communication, follow-ups, and task tracking

Building and maintaining structured systems in Excel and other tools

Performing data analysis and helping translate numbers into clear insights

Assisting with website updates, automation, or tech workflows when needed

Helping me stay focused by reducing noise and managing logistics behind the scenes

This role requires someone proactive. You don’t wait to be told every step. You anticipate problems and bring solutions.



Required Skills and Experience



Advanced Google Sheet skills (complex formulas, pivots, data organization)

Strong English communication skills, written and verbal

Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities

Tech-savvy and comfortable learning new tools quickly

Reliable internet connection and ability to work USA hours

Comfortable using TimeDoctor for time tracking

Ability to work closely with a fast-moving executive environment



Preferred Experience





Experience supporting a founder, COO, or C-level leader

Project management tools or workflow systems

Automation tools, light coding, or systems thinking

Graphic design or website management experience



Who Will Thrive in This Role



The ideal candidate is:



Extremely organized but also adaptable

Calm under pressure and comfortable with high expectations

Detail-oriented without losing sight of the big picture

Direct communicator who can think independently

Motivated by growth and long-term opportunity

Someone who wants to become deeply trusted and integrated into an executive’s workflow

You are not just completing tasks. You are helping build structure around a growing company and the person helping lead it.







How to Apply



To be considered, you must:

Send your resume to 

Include a ~2-minute video explaining:

Why you believe you are a strong fit

A complex problem you solved and how you approached it

Your level of Google Sheet and Google Calendar expertise and past relevant experience



Applications without both the resume and video will not be reviewed.

title: Psychology Expert 1 Hour Consultation
description:
Job Overview:





This is a one time gig for help with planning and answering questions, with potential for long-term collaboration for building an actual psychology mini curriculum in the future. This collaboration is only “checkpoint feedbacks”, where we have a 1 hour consultation 5 times after this initial one as I’m making the curriculum alone.



For this 1 hour gig I’ll only be asking questions such as what subtopics you recommended I include in a mini curriculum (using textbooks or videos or E courses or other sources) to get as close to 100% equivalency of a college degree in material/content covered. I’ll also be showing you my recommendations and ask for your opinions and advice. I’m building a small mini curriculum in Psychology to educate my friends, family and I. I’ll be working with a curriculum designer and I need help from a Psychology degree holder for d
 what should go on the curriculum and which resources (textbooks, online courses, or others) I should use and in what order.



Skills Needed:



- Degree in Psychology - 4 or 6 year degree preferred.

- Experience in educating on Psychology - Preferred, not required.

- Quick access to resources or an understanding that could help in determining how to structure a Psychology curriculum. No full content required but at least a roadmap of the titles of the subtopics in order I’d need to learn.

title: Executive Virtual Assistant / GoHighLevel, AI & Social Media Specialist
description:
Executive Virtual Assistant / GoHighLevel & AI Specialist (Full-Time, Remote)



Philippines-Based | Long-Term Role



About the Company



We are a luxury, U.S.-based portrait studio seeking a high-level Executive Virtual Assistant to work directly with the Owner/CEO as her right-hand support.



This is a long-term, full-time role for someone who excels at systems, communication, AI tools, and social media support, and who takes ownership of keeping a business running smoothly behind the scenes.



If you are proactive, detail-oriented, and confident managing executive-level tasks using tools like GoHighLevel, ChatGPT, and Google Sheets, this role is for you.



You will work directly with the Owner/CEO and Principal Portrait Artist, acting as her personal Executive Virtual Assistant, and helping to manage communication, systems, and internal coordination.



This is not a basic VA role.



Our studio is an all-women team built on professionalism, clarity, kindness, and ownership. We value long-term relationships, trust, and people who take pride in doing excellent work behind the scenes.



You will help ensure:



* No client or internal message is missed

* The CEO’s time is protected

* Tasks are clearly assigned and followed through

* Systems remain clean, efficient, and scalable



Hours:  Full-time (40 hours/week)

Schedule: Flexible, with partial overlap with U.S. Central Time

Location: Philippines (remote)



Key Responsibilities



Executive & Client Communication



* Serve as personal VA to the Owner/CEO

* Manage client communication across inboxes and systems

* Ensure no message, follow-up, or request is missed

* Draft responses using brand-aligned language and professional tone

* Flag urgent matters and proactively manage priorities



Studio Operations & Team Support



* Help assign, track, and follow up on tasks for studio staff

* Support internal task systems and operational workflows

* Assist with scheduling, coordination, and follow-through

* Conduct research (vendors, tools, partnerships, travel, opportunities)



GoHighLevel (GHL) & Automation



* Build and optimize workflows and automations

* Manage calendars, pipelines, tags, and CRM organization

* Improve
 deliverability and system health

* Build and customize landing pages inside GoHighLevel



Data, Reporting & Finance



* Track booking metrics, KPIs, and studio performance

* Build and maintain Google Sheets dashboards (formulas, charts, clean data)

* Categorize expenses and support financial organization (QuickBooks)



AI, ChatGPT & Efficiency Tools



Use ChatGPT and AI tools daily to:



* Draft
s and internal documentation

* Improve workflows and systems

* Summarize information and research efficiently

* Assist with copy, SOPs, and problem-solving

* Write effective prompts and know how to iterate to get strong results

* Proactively suggest ways AI can save time and improve operations



Content & Creative Support



* Edit videos for marketing or internal use (CapCut, Premiere Pro, etc.)

* Create graphic designs in Canva, Photoshop, or InDesign

* Write and schedule social media posts



Required Skills & Experience



Please do not apply if you do not meet these requirements.



* 1–2+ years hands-on GoHighLevel experience

* Strong Google Sheets skills (formulas, dashboards, data visualization)

* Experience with QuickBooks (expense categorization)

* Advanced experience using ChatGPT / AI tools for work

* Excellent written English communication using proper grammar

* Highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented

* Comfortable managing executive-level communication

* Able to work independently and anticipate needs

* Based in the Philippines with: Stable internet, Quiet workspace, Dual monitors preferred

* Available for partial overlap with U.S. Central Time



???? This Role Is NOT For You If:



* You are looking for short-term or part-time work

* You need constant step-by-step instructions

* You do not regularly use ChatGPT or AI in your daily work

* You are uncomfortable supporting a CEO directly

* You prefer repetitive, task-only VA work

* You frequently miss details, deadlines, or follow-ups

* You are juggling multiple full-time clients and cannot prioritize this role



We are looking for someone who wants to own this role, not just complete tasks.



Compensation & Benefits



* Hourly Rate: $7–$10 USD/hour (based on experience)

* Long-term, stable role

* Performance-based bonuses

* Flexible remote work environment

* Full access to required software: GoHighLevel, Google Workspace, QuickBooks, Canva, AI tools as needed



How to Apply



Please
 the following to 



1. Resume

2. Short cover letter explaining:



   * Your experience as an Executive or Senior VA

   * Your GoHighLevel experience

   * How you use ChatGPT or AI in your work

   * Why, in your opinion, are portraits important for families and children



3. Examples (if available): GHL workflows, dashboards, AI-generated workflows, videos, or designs

· Supervise a team of debt collectors (typically 5–15 agents)

· Provide daily guidance, coaching, and performance feedback

· Conduct regular one-on-one meetings and team huddles

· Support onboarding and training of new collectors

· Motivate the team to achieve individual and team targets



2. Collections Operations

· Oversee outbound and inbound collection activities

· Assist with complex, high-balance, or escalated accounts

· Review and approve payment arrangements and settlements

· Monitor call quality, negotiation techniques, and tone

· Ensure accurate documentation of all collection activities



3. Performance Management

· Track KPIs such as:

o Recovery rate

o Promise-to-Pay kept ratio

o Call productivity

o Aging reduction



· Identify performance gaps and implement corrective actions

· Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly performance reports



4. Compliance & Risk Management

· Ensure full compliance with:

o Provincial/State collection laws

o Consumer protection regulations

o FDCPA (US) / Provincial Collection Acts (Canada)



· Enforce adherence to internal policies and scripts

· Handle consumer complaints and regulatory escalations

· Maintain confidentiality and data-privacy standards



5. Collaboration & Continuous Improvement

· Work closely with the leadership team in Montreal (Canada)

· Provide feedback on processes, scripts, and system improvements

· Participate in strategy sessions to improve recovery outcomes

---

Qualifications & Experience

Required

· 3–5 years of experience in debt collection or credit operations

· Minimum 1–2 years in a supervisory or senior collector role

· Strong knowledge of collection laws and compliance standards

· Proven ability to lead and motivate a team

· Excellent negotiation and communication skills



Preferred

· Experience in:

o Consumer lending

o Micro-loans / installment loans

o Financial services or call center environment

· Experience with collection systems (LendSuite, Experian, FICO, etc.)

· English speaking and writing

---

Skills & Competencies

· Leadership and people management

· Performance coaching and accountability

· Conflict resolution and negotiation

· Analytical and KPI-driven mindset

· Strong written and verbal communication

· High ethical standards and professionalism

---

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

· Portfolio recovery rate

· Reduction in delinquency buckets

· Agent productivity and quality scores

· Compliance audit results

· Employee retention and engagement





HOW TO APPLY:

Include code 0116 along with your cover letter explaining your relevant experience. Do not give me a ChatGPT application. It will be automatically deleted. Attach the link of your latest CV.

title: Short-Form Video Editor (Raw Travel Vlogs, Shorts, Reels, TikTok)
description:
Short-Form Video Editor (Raw Travel Vlogs, Shorts, Reels, TikTok)



We are looking for an experienced short-form video editor to turn long-form travel vlogs into high-retention, raw-style short videos.



This is not a beginner role. We are looking for someone who already understands short-form retention, pacing, and storytelling. Please do not apply if you do not have prior experience editing short-form content.



This is not a flashy edit role.

No music, no color grading, no heavy effects.

This role is about judgment, pacing, hooks, and storytelling.



Editing style (very important)

Our content follows the raw travel vlogger style. Think Luke Damant, Harry Jaggard, Bald and Bankrupt, Kurt Caz, and similar creators.



-No background music

-No cinematic effects

-No color grading

-No fancy editing

-Clean cuts

-Natural pacing

-Strong hooks

-Subtitles that feel human, not spammy

-Letting 
nts breathe when needed

-Think real, immersive, curiosity-driven travel 
nts.



What you will do

-Watch long-form travel videos and identify strong short-form 
nts

-Cut short videos optimized for retention

-Create clean subtitles

-Write engaging titles and short descriptions

-Stitch clips together to tell a clear micro-story

-Deliver finished, ready-to-post videos



What you will NOT do

-No social media uploading or scheduling

-No social media account management

-No social media analytics or reporting

-This role is editing only.



Requirements

-Proven experience editing short-form content for creators

-Strong understanding of hooks, pacing, and viewer curiosity

-Ability to find 
nts without being given timestamps

-Comfortable working from long-form footage

-Fluent in English

-Reliable turnaround times

-Experience with travel or vlog content is a big plus

-High speed internet for downloading and uploading video files

-Laptop or desktop with sufficient storage space



Pay structure (per short, not hourly)

We pay per finished short, based on monthly volume ranges.

Monthly volume is agreed in advance and locked for that month.



Per month rates:

30 to 40 shorts: $8 per short

41 to 60 shorts: $7.50 per short

61 to 80 shorts: $7 per short

81 to 100 shorts: $6.50 per short



This may seem like a lot at first but once you understand our style of editing makes it easy to create a short and it's not bad.



Rates are not recalculated mid-month.

Tier can change month to month if volume changes.



Revisions

One revision included per short for timing or subtitle tweaks

Major reworks count as a new short



Paid trial (required)

Shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete a paid trial:

3 to 5 shorts

Paid at full rate

No timestamps given

This helps us evaluate pacing, judgment, and storytelling.



How to apply:

My
 address: iamtylerfox at gmail


 written this way to avoid it being blocked)



Please send the following to my
:



-A short video introduction

-Links to short-form videos you personally edited with proof of authorship

-Your experience with similar content

-Applications without examples will not be considered.



This is long-term, consistent work for the right editor.

If you understand raw storytelling, pacing, and retention, we would love to see your work.

Build and monitor backlink profiles and develop link acquisition strategies

Create SEO content briefs and optimize existing content for search performance

Track rankings, traffic, and conversions; deliver monthly performance reports

Stay current with Google algorithm updates and adjust strategies accordingly

Collaborate with internal team via project management tools (ClickUp)



Required Experience

Demonstrable experience using AI tools for SEO (content optimization, keyword clustering, automation)

Strong technical SEO foundation (site speed, schema, crawlability, indexation)

Local SEO experience including Google Business Profile optimization

Experience with WordPress and common SEO plugins

Google Analytics 4 and Google Search Console proficiency

Excellent written English communication



Preferred Experience



Agency experience managing multiple client accounts

Healthcare, medical spa, or aesthetics industry experience

Familiarity with GoHighLevel, 
, n8n, or marketing automation platforms

Experience with Surfer SEO, Screaming Frog, or similar tools



Work Schedule

This is a full-time position. You must be available to work US business hours (Eastern Time Zone). We need real-time collaboration, not someone working while we sleep.



Who You Are

You get results. You can show rankings you've improved, traffic you've grown, leads you've generated.

You're self-directed. You don't need hand-holding. You identify problems and fix them.

You're detail-obsessed. SEO is a game of precision. Sloppy work doesn't cut it.

You stay sharp. You're constantly learning—algorithm updates, new tools, AI capabilities.

You communicate clearly. No excuses, no disappearing. You keep the team informed.



Compensation

Competitive salary based on experience. This is a long-term position with growth potential for the right person.

Instructions When Applying



Do not
 me. All communication must happen within OnlineJobs.ph messaging.

You must include "apple cheese sticks" in your application

You must use 3 AP (apply points)

Include a link to your resume and portfolio showing SEO results you've achieved (rankings, traffic growth, etc.)

Include a brief Loom video (under 3 minutes) walking through one SEO win you're proud of—show me the data

Tell me what AI SEO tools you've used and how you've used them to get better results



Applications without all of the above will not be considered.

title: Virtual Medical Administrative Assistant (Patient Coordination & EMR Support)
description:
Virtual Medical Administrative Assistant (Patient Coordination & EMR Support)



About Our Clinic



We are a Toronto-based integrative healthcare clinic providing professional medical and wellness services through a multidisciplinary team that includes nurse practitioners, naturopathic doctors, and other licensed healthcare professionals. Our clinic delivers patient-centered, evidence-informed care with a strong emphasis on clinical quality, privacy, and professionalism.



As our practice continues to grow, we are seeking a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Medical Administrative Assistant to support clinical operations remotely. This role is well suited to an individual with prior medical administrative experience who understands the importance of confidentiality, accuracy, and clear patient communication in a healthcare setting.



Primary Responsibilities



As part of our administrative team, you will support both patients and clinicians by ensuring smooth, compliant, and professional day-to-day operations. Key responsibilities include:



Responding to patient inquiries and coordinating appointment scheduling, follow-ups, reminders, and general communications via phone and
 in a professional and empathetic manner



Clearly explaining clinic services, integrative care programs, and diagnostic or testing options, and guiding patients through the booking process with confidence and clarity



Uploading, organizing, and maintaining laboratory results and patient documentation within the clinic’s Electronic Medical Record (EMR) system



Ensuring all electronic medical records are accurate, complete, up to date, and consistently organized



Completing daily administrative and operational checklists in accordance with clinic policies, privacy standards, and healthcare best practices



Preparing and sending invoices and receipts using Jane App or other approved medical billing platforms



Assisting with inventory tracking and coordinating with suppliers when required



Managing virtual front-desk duties, including monitoring and responding to the clinic’s primary
 inbox



Ideal Candidate Profile



We are seeking a candidate who is dependable, professional, and comfortable working within a confidential medical environment.



Required qualifications:



Minimum 3 years of experience as a virtual medical administrative assistant or medical virtual assistant

(experience as a medical office assistant or clinical administrator is a strong asset)



Fluent written and spoken English with excellent professional communication skills



Demonstrated experience working with EMR systems and electronic medical documentation



Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple tasks accurately



High level of professionalism, discretion, and respect for patient confidentiality (HIPAA/PIPEDA-aligned mindset)



Reliable high-speed internet and a quiet, dedicated home workspace



Ability to work independently while following established clinical workflows and protocols



Additional Details



Minimum commitment of 40 hours per week, with potential for additional hours based on performance and clinic needs



Flexible schedule, with availability required during Eastern Standard Time (EST) business hours



Structured onboarding and training provided to ensure full familiarity with clinic systems, workflows, and expectations



How to Apply



Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter through OnlineJobs.ph messaging.

We look forward to connecting with qualified candidates who are passionate about supporting high-quality, professional healthcare delivery and contributing to a growing clinical team.

 Reels, and YouTube Shorts with consistent, punchy content that generates leads and brand awareness.

 Reels, and YouTube Shorts, optimized for hooks, retention, and calls-to-action.

Requirements

title: Real Estate Wholesaling Acquisitions Killer (Closer + Team Lead)
description:
Compensation:



Base salary $1,000+/month USD + 2.5% net profit share per deal (paid per closing)



Long-term role with upside to run acquisitions end-to-end



Read This First (Very Important)



You are a fit only if:





You’ve closed real wholesaling deals (not just cold calling)

You’ve trained and managed setters before

You understand motivation, pain, timelines, and price anchoring

You think like an operator, not an employee

You’re comfortable being judged on profit per deal



Who This Is NOT For:



Beginners

Script-readers

“Appointment setters”

People who need daily direction

Anyone afraid of performance-based pay



This role is for someone who has already run real estate wholesaling acquisitions and knows how to:



- Close distressed sellers

- Build and manage a PH-based setter team

- Create scripts, KPIs, and follow-ups

- Take ownership of deal flow without supervision

- If you have not personally closed wholesale deals and managed setters, do not apply.



What You’ll Own (End-to-End)



You will be responsible for the entire seller acquisition machine:



1) Closing



Take inbound seller leads

Run full acquisition calls

Negotiate price and terms

Get agreements signed



2) Building & Managing Setters



Recruit PH setters

Train them

Create scripts and objection handling

Set KPIs (speed to lead, qualification rate, booking rate)

Hold daily accountability



3) Deal Ownership



You care about profit, not just contracts

You understand assignment fees, spreads, and deal quality

You kill bad deals early instead of wasting time



What We Provide



High-intent inbound seller leads

CRM, dialer, DocuSign

Lawyer-approved contracts

Dispositions handled on our side (you focus on acquisitions)



How to Apply (Required)

When applying, answer all questions clearly:



How many wholesale deals have you personally closed?



What markets were they in?



Have you built or managed setter teams? How many people?



What is your average assignment fee?



Describe your acquisition call flow (briefly).



What KPIs do you track daily for setters?



Applications without real answers will be ignored.



Final Note:



This role is long-term. If you perform, you will effectively run acquisitions and earn serious money without micromanagement. We’re looking for one killer, not a team of average people.

title: Director of Media and Content (Gaming): AI Image/Video Creation & Social Media Management
description:
This role runs the company’s day-to-day content engine across social media and YouTube. You are responsible for ensuring content is produced and published consistently, looks premium, and feels authentic to gamers. You will manage the Social Media Manager’s daily output, but you will also be hands-on creating content yourself—especially YouTube compilations and reusable video clips that can be repurposed across platforms.



A major part of the job is serving as the internal point person for visual assets. If anyone in the company needs product images, thumbnails, banners, short videos, or new creative variations, you will produce them quickly and consistently. You should be highly skilled in AI-assisted content workflows and understand how to iterate fast without sacrificing quality or brand consistency.



Because the business operates in the gaming space, the ideal candidate has strong video game knowledge and understands gaming culture, terminology, and trends so content feels native to the audience.



What You’ll Do Every Day (Plain Language)

1) Run the daily content operation



Ensure content goes out every day across all required platforms.



Own the content calendar and daily posting priorities.



Maintain a consistent “gaming voice” that feels natural in gamer communities.



2) Lead the Social Media Manager and enforce quality



Assign tasks, set expectations, and review output to maintain a high quality bar.



Improve performance over time through feedback and clearer standards.



Keep everything organized: schedule, queue, asset folders, and handoffs.



3) Own multi-platform social execution



You are responsible for how the company shows up on
 Pages, Instagram, TikTok, and X/Twitter, including:



Planning, scheduling, publishing, and formatting content appropriately per platform.



Making sure captions, hashtags, and creative formats are platform-native rather than copy-pasted.



Coordinating light community management and ensuring messages/comments are handled correctly.



4) Produce YouTube content consistently (core output)



A primary daily/regular deliverable is creating YouTube video compilations and related assets:



Source, organize, and edit compilation-style videos with strong pacing and retention-friendly structure.



Repurpose clips into Shorts/Reels/TikTok when possible.



Create strong thumbnails and titles aligned with channel style and performance goals.



5) Use AI tools to create product images and video assets quickly



You should be comfortable using AI tools to produce and iterate:



Product/listing images, thumbnails, banners, and promotional creatives.



Short promo clips and variations for testing.



Background assets and visual enhancements, while keeping output clean and consistent.



6) Serve as the internal creative hub



Be the main point of contact for teams needing image or video assets for products, promotions, or campaigns.



Create assets quickly, keep versions organized, and reduce bottlenecks.



Maintain clear internal standards so visual output stays consistent across the company.



7) Keep content authentic to gamers



Apply real gaming knowledge so content reflects community norms and expectations.



Catch and fix anything that feels out of touch, generic, or inconsistent before it goes live.



What This Role Is (and Is Not)



This is a leadership plus production role. You manage a direct report while also creating content yourself. It is fast-paced, requires consistent daily execution, and rewards someone who can build a repeatable system rather than relying on ad-hoc work.



What Great Performance Looks Like



Daily social output is reliable, on-brand, and improving in quality and engagement over time.



YouTube output becomes consistent, scalable, and performance-driven.



Product and marketing visuals are produced quickly with fewer internal bottlenecks.



Creative output remains premium, consistent, and authentically aligned with gaming audiences.

title: SEO & Google Ads Specialist — Australian Digital Marketing Agency (Philippine Time Zone)
description:
Rate: $800 to $1200 USD /m depending on experience

Type: Full-time, Remote

Timezone: Must overlap with Australian Western Standard Time (Same as PHP)



About Us



We're PlumbElec Marketing — a small, fast-moving digital marketing agency that helps plumbing and electrical businesses get more jobs through Google Ads, SEO, and high-converting websites.



There's no middle management, no pointless meetings, and no one looking over your shoulder. We care about results and we trust our team to deliver them. You'll work directly with the founder and a tight crew that has each other's backs.



We have documented SOPs for our core processes, so you won't be guessing how things should be done. When something isn't documented yet, we'll build it together.



About the Role



We're hiring one person to own the technical execution across 10–20 client accounts. You'll work alongside our Account Managers and Strategists — they set the direction, you make it happen.



Your job is to make sure campaigns are running, tracking is accurate, profiles are optimised, and nothing falls through the cracks. If you're the kind of person who notices a conversion tag is broken before anyone else does, and actually fixes it — keep reading.



What You'll Be Doing



Google Ads



- Monitor campaign performance daily/weekly and flag issues early

- Implement changes and optimisations as directed by the strategist

- Clear negative keywords weekly

- Review and action Google Ads Recommendations weekly



SEO



- Research content topics for our content writer

- Run comprehensive audits: technical, local, content, backlink

- Order backlinks from our providers

- Flag underperforming pages for re-optimisation

- Manage citation indexing and consistency

- Identify new local citation opportunities

- Assist with schema updates and internal link checks



Analytics & Tracking



- Set up and maintain conversion tracking across all client accounts

- Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, WildJar (call tracking), form submissions

- Maintain and quality-check AgencyAnalytics dashboards

- Regularly review tracking accuracy and flag issues before they become problems



Google Business Profile



- Keep profiles fresh — update services, upload images, complete optimisation tasks as needed



 & Instagram Ads



- Update and maintain campaigns based on the strategist's instructions

- Ensure tracking, structure, and execution are correct



Who You Are



- 2+ years working in digital marketing, agency experience preferred

- Hands-on experience with Google Ads and SEO — not just theory

- Comfortable working across multiple platforms without hand-holding

- You do what you say you're going to do

- You take ownership when something is missed — no excuses, just fixes

- You follow documented processes and maintain a high standard across every account



What You Get

- Remote & flexible — work from anywhere

- Direct access to leadership — no layers between you and decision-makers

- Documented SOPs — clear processes so you can hit the ground running

- Training & growth — access to courses, mentorship, and a path into senior or strategic roles as we scale

- Real impact — you'll directly influence client results and agency growth

- A team that backs you — small, high-performing crew that genuinely supports each other



How to Apply



To apply, please include the following in your application:



- A brief summary of your experience with Google Ads and SEO — tools you've used, types of campaigns or clients you've worked on

- How many client accounts have you've managed or supported at one time

- Your expected monthly rate in PHP

- Applications without these details won't be reviewed.

title: Community Moderator
description:
[Caution]

If you are a naturally empathetic and observant person who thrives on fostering positive online spaces, this role is a perfect fit.

This position requires high emotional intelligence, excellent communication skills, a genuine desire to help others, and the ability to be the eyes, ears, and heart of our online community. You will be a guardian of our culture, nurturing a safe and welcoming environment for all members.

If you view moderation as simply deleting posts and banning users without understanding the context or human element, this role may be a challenge for you.

So only read further if you’re passionate about building vibrant online communities, resolving conflicts with tact, and making every user feel heard and valued (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Community Moderator VA (Community Health & Engagement)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$800(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to community health and engagement. Metrics could include positive sentiment scores, user engagement rates, and response time targets. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the supportive and vigilant heart of our online community and social media channels (YouTube, Instagram,
,
, etc.). You will be responsible for creating a thriving environment where our members feel safe, supported, and engaged. Your main tasks will include:



a) Proactive Community Monitoring: Actively scan our community platforms and social media for all posts and comments to ensure they adhere to our guidelines. You'll be responsible for identifying and encouraging positive contributions to nurture a healthy culture.



b) Reactive Moderation & Conflict Resolution: Promptly and fairly deal with flagged content, user reports, and disputes according to our rule-book. You will step in with diplomacy to de-escalate tensions and guide conversations toward a constructive resolution.



c) Managing User Messaging & Chat Support: Handle direct inquiries, concerns, and support requests that come through private messages and chat, maintaining a prompt, helpful, and on-brand tone.



d) Handling
 Support Inquiries: Manage our support inbox by categorizing, prioritizing, and responding to user questions. You will be responsible for escalating technical issues to the appropriate tea
mber when necessary.



e) Developing and Maintaining a Knowledge Base: Based on recurring questions from the community, you will create, update, and maintain a clear and simple FAQ/Knowledge Base section to help users find answers quickly.



f) Gathering and Reporting Community Feedback: Identify trends, common feature requests, and the overall sentiment of the community. You will provide concise, actionable reports that distinguish constructive feedback from general noise.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to build a vibrant, safe, and supportive online community. By championing our guidelines, fostering positive engagement, and providing outstanding support, you will ensure our members feel valued, respected, and eager to participate. You will be the engine of our positive and welcoming community culture.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Proven Community Moderation Experience: You have a strong track record of managing or moderating online communities (e.g., on 
,
 Groups, forums, or social media), with examples or references that speak to your skills.



b) Possesses High Emotional Intelligence: You are empathetic, patient, and skilled at navigating social dynamics online. You can de-escalate conflict, communicate with tact, and understand different user perspectives.



c) Is an Organized and Proactive Communicator: You are meticulous in tracking user inquiries and clear in your written communication. You don't just wait for problems; you actively monitor for potential issues.



d) Has a "Guardian of the Community" Mentality: You see your role as a protector of the community culture and a champion for its members, not just an enforcer of rules.



e) Is Proficient with Social Media & Community Platforms: You are skilled in using platforms such as 
,
, Instagram,
, etc., and are comfortable with helpdesk or ticketing software.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can articulate your thoughts in a clear, logical manner.



Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays.

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.



The opportunity to be the voice and heart of a growing, people-first online community.



Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.



A supportive environment where your communication skills and emotional intelligence are highly valued.



[About Us]

We are a growing team that believes our community is the cornerstone of our success. We are dedicated to creating an online space that is not only informative and engaging but also genuinely supportive and welcoming. Your role is absolutely critical to making that belief a reality.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with "Community Guardian", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Work History: Share your resume, focusing on your experience in community moderation, customer support, or social media management.



2) Moderation Challenge: What were the 3 most common or serious issues your previous community held, and how did you or your team resolve it. What was the lesson you learned? I'd like to hear the back-end story.



3) All moderation work has its emotional toll. Describe the specific type of user behavior or community conflict that you personally find the most emotionally draining to handle, and be honest about why it gets to you. More importantly, what specific, practical strategies have you developed to protect your own mental well-being and maintain objectivity when you have to deal with that exact situation?



4) Handling a Delicate Situation: You notice a long-time, valuable community member has started making passive-aggressive comments that are discouraging new members but don't explicitly break any major rules. How would you handle this situation privately and publicly to protect the community's welcoming atmosphere without alienating the long-time member?



5) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to tools for social media management, community monitoring, or customer support? Please mention why you prefer them.



6) AI in Your Workflow: Explain where and how you might use AI to improve your productivity, and where you believe a human touch is required while using AI tools in community management.



7) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



8) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



9) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Virtual Bookkeeper ( Part-time | Long-term)
description:
I’m looking for an experienced virtual bookkeeper based in the Philippines to support an Australian business.



This is a part-time role, Monday to Friday, 8:00 am – 12:00 pm Sydney time. Long-term position for the right person.



What I’m looking for



You must have:



Strong experience using Xero



Previous experience working with Australian businesses



Good understanding of Australian GST, invoices, and payment terms



Confidence juggling multiple software systems (Xero, servicem8,  job management systems, CRMs, spreadsheets, etc.)



Clear written English and the confidence to follow up clients for payment (polite but firm)



Reliable internet, consistent availability, and attention to detail



Key responsibilities



You’ll be responsible for the full day-to-day bookkeeping function, including:



Accounts Receivable



Issuing invoices accurately and on time



Reconciling customer payments in Xero



Following up overdue invoices via



Maintaining clean debtor records



Flagging long-outstanding accounts



Accounts Payable



Entering supplier bills and expenses into Xero



Reconciling supplier statements



Preparing payment runs for approval



Ensuring bills are coded correctly (GST, categories, etc.)



General bookkeeping



Daily bank and credit card reconciliations



GST accuracy and BAS support (preparation, not lodgement)



Managing receipts and expense allocations



Keeping Xero tidy and up to date



Liaising with the business owner and accountant when needed



Nice to have (but not essential)



Experience with Australian trades, property, or service-based businesses



Familiarity with job management software (ServiceM8, simPRO, similar)



Previous experience chasing payments for Australian clients- min of 5 years with reference



Hours & pay



20 hours per week (8 am – 12 pm Sydney time)



Pay based on experience



Ongoing, stable role — not a short-term gig



How to apply



Please include:



A short intro about your bookkeeping experience



Your experience with Xero and Australian businesses



Your expected hourly rate



Confirmation you can work Sydney time, 8 am–12 pm



Application strictly through this platform.

title: AI Response Evaluator (Technical Reading & Analysis)
description:
AI Response Evaluator – Technical Reading & Analysis

Remote | Contract / Freelance | $15 per accepted task



ABOUT THE ROLE



We’re seeking detail-oriented engineers or IT professionals to assess and evaluate AI-generated responses.

This position is not coding-intensive, but it does require strong analytical thinking, careful reading, and clear written explanations.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Review detailed AI system instructions



Compare two AI-generated responses



Determine which response better follows the requirements



Clearly justify your decision in writing



Flag missed instructions, inconsistencies, or errors



REQUIREMENTS



Strong English reading and writing skills



Technical background (IT, engineering, computer science, DevOps, etc.)



Basic familiarity with CSV and JSON files



Ability to write clear, human explanations



Comfortable working with long, detailed instructions



NICE TO HAVE



Experience working with AI systems or prompt-based tools



Background in QA, analysis, or technical review roles



IMPORTANT NOTES



AI tools may be used for analysis only



Final responses must be written in your own words



Obvious AI-generated submissions will be rejected



Accuracy and quality matter more than speed



WHO THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR



Anyone who dislikes reading



Anyone who rushes through tasks



Anyone who relies entirely on AI without understanding the work



???? HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



Send a link to your resume (ensure viewing access is set to “anyone with the link”)



Submit a 30–60 second video explaining your technical background and why you’re a good fit

title: REMOTE — Insurance Agency Digital Marketing Manager / Marketing Automation & Lead Generation Specialist (Full-Time VA/Ph
description:
REMOTE — Insurance Agency Digital Marketing Manager / Marketing Automation & Lead Generation Specialist (Full-Time VA/Philippines Only)

We are a growing U.S. insurance brokerage expanding rapidly in personal and commercial lines.

We are not looking for a general VA.

We are hiring a high-level Digital Marketing & Automation Specialist who can own our lead generation system from strategy ? build ? optimize ? report.

This is NOT a social media posting job. We are hiring a marketing operator who understands performance marketing and ROI.

You will be directly responsible for building predictable inbound leads and nurturing them into booked appointments.

Compensation

• Based on proven experience

• Full-time (40 hrs/week) US Central Time overlap required

• Long-term role (we promote internally)

• Performance bonuses for booked appointments & lead volume growth

Your Mission

Design, implement, and optimize a complete marketing funnel that produces qualified insurance leads consistently.

You are not just executing tasks — you are managing outcomes.

Traffic ? Leads ? Appointments ? Policies Written

Core Responsibilities

Lead Generation

• Build and manage all social media ad campaigns

• Google Search & Local Service Ads (very important)

• Retargeting campaigns

• Landing page conversion optimization

• A/B testing creatives and copy

• Cost per lead reduction strategy



Marketing Automation

• Build automations;
 & SMS inside CRM (AgencyZoom)

• SMS/email drip campaigns

• Pipeline workflows

• Lead scoring & tagging

• Automated follow-ups and reminders

• Appointment booking flows

Funnel & Conversion Optimization

• Create landing pages

• Improve conversion rates

• Form optimization

• Tracking pixels & attribution setup

• Heatmap behavior analysis (Hotjar or similar)

Data & Reporting

• Weekly performance reports

• CPL tracking

• Campaign profitability analysis

• Channel comparison

• Recommendations (not just numbers)

SEO & Local Presence

• Google Business Profile optimization

• Review generation systems

• Local SEO improvements

• Citation management

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (Do not apply without these)

You must have REAL hands-on experience doing ALL of the following:

• All digital marketing platforms such as
 Ads Manager (lead generation campaigns)

• Google Ads (search campaigns — not just display)

• CRM automation building

• Funnel creation & landing pages

• Lead nurturing workflows

• Tracking pixels & conversion tracking

• Marketing analytics reporting

Insurance experience is a major advantage



Tools You Should Already Know

(You don’t need all — but most)

• Meta Ads Manager

• Google Ads

• GoHighLevel / HubSpot / ActiveCampaign / AgencyZoom

• Zapier / Make

• Google Tag Manager

• GA4

• ClickFunnels / Webflow / WordPress

• Canva or basic creative editing

What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)

• Functional automation pipeline built

• Consistent lead flow

• Reduced cost per lead

• Appointment booking system running without manual work

HOW TO APPLY (REQUIRED OR YOU WILL BE IGNORED)

Send the following:

1. A short video introducing yourself (2–4 minutes)

2. What platforms are you strongest in?

3. Screenshots of campaigns you personally managed

4. Your typical cost per lead results

5. CRM automations you built

6. Write the word “PIPELINE” at the top of your application so we know you read this

We are hiring someone who wants to grow with a company long-term, not freelancers juggling 10 clients.

If you are a builder, optimizer, and problem solver, apply.

We hire quickly.

title: Executive Virtual Assistant
description:
We run a used couch business in the United States called The Found Sofa.



We get constant leads for free and cheap couches through our software, and we need a detail-obsessed VA whose main job is very simple:



Monitor a live feed



See a good couch pop up.



Message the seller in under 15 seconds.



Schedule a pickup time 



Log everything correctly.



If you can stare at a feed and react instantly without getting bored, keep reading. VA can be based anywhere globally but must be able to work during the provided shifts below.



The job in simple terms



You will:



• Watch our couch lead feed during your shift



• Message sellers fast using our scripts



• Log each lead in Google Sheets in real time



• Help coordinate pickups once we d
 to take a couch



• After you prove yourself, help create
 Marketplace listings and respond to buyers who want to purchase couches



This is not a “work whenever you feel like it” role.



This is a seat-on-chair, eyes-on-screen job during specific hours.



Schedule and hours



We are building coverage for about 60 hours per week total, split across 2 VAs.



You should be able to commit to about 30 hours per week, with most of your shifts in these windows (US Eastern time):



• Weekdays: roughly 3 pm – 9 pm



• Weekends: roughly 9 am – 9 pm



Exact schedule will be finalized with you, but the core rule is:



When you are on shift, you are glued to the feed. If a lead pops and you answer 4 minutes later, you lose most deals.



Pay



• Base pay: $4 USD per hour, paid bi weekly in USD



What success looks like



In your first 60–90 days, a strong VA will:



• Respond to qualifying couch leads in under 15 seconds on average



• Help us acquire at least 8 good couches per week



• Once trained on selling, help us sell at least 5 couches per week through our listings



• Keep our tracking sheet fully updated, in real time, without missing leads



Requirements



Must have:



• Very good written and spoken English



• Strong and stable internet



• Your own laptop or desktop (no phones)



• Ability to follow detailed SOPs and stick to a routine



• No other job during your assigned shifts (you can’t do this and another job at the same time)



• Comfortable using:



• Google Sheets



• Basic time tracking (like Toggl / Clockify)



• Slack or similar chat tools



Nice to have:



• Experience as a VA or in customer service / chat roles



• Experience with
 Marketplace or any online selling



We’re looking for people who want to stay long-term and eventually take on more responsibility, not someone disappearing after two months.



If you are interested please contact with resume along with answers to the following questions:



During your assigned shift, you are expected to respond to new leads in under 15 seconds. What would you do during your shifts to make sure you beat all the competition and consistently respond in under 15 seconds?



What is one skills outside of work that you consider yourself to be elite at?

title: Looking for Youtube Video Editor/ Compilations to Compile Visuals/ Minor Animations
description:
Summary

Category= Video Editing/ Post-production



Description:

Videos will MUST be 8 - 20 minutes UNLESS otherwise indicated.



I'm looking for a long term article video editor who can compile clips and images to match a script that we provide related to the following topics:

Luxury lifestyle



Video editor should be able to do the following:

* Speak fluent English

* Communicate effectively

* Turn around time in 3 days or less

* Be creative and humorous

* MUST be able to edit a MINIMUM of at least 2 videos a week.



If you have read the middle of this job descp., please type your favorite animal at the beginning or end of your proposal.



As you can tell, I am looking for the long term video editor and do have high expectations, but keep in mind, this will be consistent daily work if you are able to provide and this will be compensated quite well. We have been working with 4 video editors already for 3+ months but we need more to join our team!



Again, we will be providing the script and voiceover, we will simply need visuals for it and for it to be put together nicely and creatively with some slight animations (i.e. for the title screens)



TAKE NOTE how it has the following:

-THE BEGINNING OF THE VIDEO- Show a clip that is EXTREMELY relevant to the title, essentially a clip with audio (OPTIONAL: only do this if you understand the niche)

-Show the numbers with appeal and emphasis; if it’s not a countdown script, show the subheadings

-Video editor will need to find 3 types of visuals: clips w/ audio, clips w/o audio, and images

-All visuals can be ripped but should never last longer than 6 seconds

-Entire video should be greater than 15 minutes unless otherwise indicated

-Background music should be copyright free

-Show AT LEAST 1 clip with audio every minute afterwards



This is our GUIDELINE that we follow across all our videos.



Potential contractors will be interviewed through phone.





Additional Questions:

How many videos can you handle per week?

To the best of your understanding, can you rephrase what kind of video I am seeking?

You will be instantly hired if you created a top 10 or faceless youtube videos before. Have you created one?

title: Senior Marketing Project Manager PH $9-$12 USD/hour + Bonuses
description:
Fill out this application form to apply:







Work Hours: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM Pacific (non-negotiable)



Challenge weekends: Monitor Slack, acknowledge critical (P1) and important (P2) issues, coordinate fixes.

Enrollment Event Ops (Virtual Sales Floor): 6-day block (includes weekend), 8 AM – 7 PM Pacific, about once every four months.



Rate: $9–$12/hour USD (DOE)



Performance Bonuses:

Up to $500 per challenge based on conversion targets (only when quality gates pass).

Up to $1,000 per enrollment event based on conversion targets (only when quality gates pass).



Company: Thrive Academy





Start Date: ASAP

Remote: Yes



Help us run a world-class marketing machine that brings our campaigns to life with precision and flow. You’ll keep every challenge, partner, and speaking-driven campaign launching on time, running clean, and converting strong, so the founders can stay focused on vision and impact.



This is a systems-driven leadership role. You’ll refine the checklists, dashboards, and rhythms that make our marketing engine hum. You’ll guide the people and processes that keep results visible, measurable, and consistently excellent.



What we do:

We help coaches and holistic practitioners reach $10k–$30k months with training, templates, AI wizards, coaching, and challenges.



We’ve taught our Heartselling™ system to more than 150,000 coaches and holistic practitioners through live speaking events, and over 14,000 people have attended our signature Client Attraction Summit event.



Our members have changed millions of lives collectively through their healing and empowerment work.



We’ve built a high-performing, values-driven marketing engine that runs with precision, so our founders and creative team can stay focused on vision, innovation, and impact.



Outcomes (What “Great” Looks Like):

Launches run clean and on schedule with clear visibility across the team.

Challenge to event conversion returns to approximately 4.0 percent or higher.

Dashboards and checklists make performance transparent and repeatable.

Founder and CMO updated proactively, not reactively.



KPIs (You Own These):

Per-challenge conversion targets met (we provide targets; you drive cadence and proof).

Misfires or irrelevant sends under 2 percent per challenge.

At least 95 percent of milestones on time and under 1 percent critical post-launch errors.

Daily dashboard by 1 PM PT and weekly summary with owners, actions, and risks.

Correct CEO escalations limited to one to two per month, with clear decision rules.



What you’ll do (Builder–Driver):



Build and Improve Systems

Rapidly create or refine systems such as Launch Greenlight Checks (T-24h and T-2h), coverage and response rules for P1 (critical) and P2 (important), UTM tracking standards, and the Proof Drops pipeline (capture, store, handoff).



Orchestrate Projects

Coordinate multiple projects including challenges, partner or JV promos, speaking gig prep and follow-ups, weekly nurture content, and asset refreshes.

Maintain a master marketing calendar and 
 board with owners, dependencies, risk status, greenlight approval, and QA checkpoints.



Lead the Marketing Team

Provide clear direction to the
 and Social VA, Sell-By-Chat VA, Marketing Tech VA, Designer, and Marketing Admin.

Hold weekly one-on-ones, coach on KPIs, and review SOPs.

Manage vendors such as copywriters and ads agencies with briefs, deadlines, and definitions of done.



Quality Assurance and Reporting

Serve as the QA gatekeeper for links, payments, tracking, and audience segmentation.

Keep a QA log and update SOPs after root-cause reviews.

Prepare daily executive summaries during live events.



Event Enrollment Operations (Virtual Sales Floor)

Maintain live leaderboards, triage issues quickly, and update proof in real time.

Virtual Sales Floor (online event model): live leaderboard updated hourly, rapid triage, real-time proof updates, and end-of-day executive summaries.



Not in Scope:

Offer, hook, price, budget, or media mix decisions (CMO).

Final copy and brand voice (Copy Lead and CMO).



Must-Have Experience:

Three or more years as a marketing project manager or operations lead running multi-channel launches (ads,
, landing pages, DM or SBC, social).

Proven record of creating and enforcing QA checklists and dashboards.

Experience supervising VAs and managing vendors.



Tools:

Required: Slack, Google Drive, Looker Studio or equivalent.

Preferred: 
, GoHighLevel and or Keap, Hyros, Zapier or Make.



Our Values (How We Work Each Day):

Excellence: We do what we say we’ll do. Launches pass greenlight checks before they ship, and when issues arise, we fix the root cause and update the SOP.

Delightful Service: We communicate early, clearly, and kindly. P1 issues are acknowledged within 15 minutes and resolved within two hours or rolled back. We make problems disappear.

Possibility Consciousness: We continually ask, “What’s the next 1 percent we can improve?”

Full Engagement: We are all in for the mission. We show up present, responsive, and collaborative through each launch cycle.



Fill out this application form to apply:
