title: Project Manager
description:
[Caution]

If you are a natural leader who thrives on empowering others and turning a group of individual VAs into a cohesive, motivated team, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires high emotional intelligence, exceptional communication skills, a genuine interest in the well-being of others, and the ability to manage projects not just by delegating, but by inspiring and supporting your team.

If you view project management as simply assigning tasks and tracking deadlines, this role may be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about cultivating a positive virtual work environment, fostering individual growth, and leading with empathy and care (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Project Management VA (Team Well-being & Performance)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$1,000(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to team health and project success. Metrics could include team morale, retention rates, and the consistent achievement of project milestones. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the supportive and organizational heart of our virtual team. You will be responsible for creating a thriving work environment where every VA can perform at their best. Your main tasks will include:



a) Intelligent & Empathetic Task Delegation: Go beyond simple assignments by understanding each VA's unique skills and current workload. You will align tasks with individual strengths to boost job satisfaction and proactively balance workloads to prevent burnout.



b) Proactive Communication & Culture Building: Establish and maintain clear communication channels, fostering an environment of psychological safety where tea
mbers feel comfortable sharing ideas and concerns. You will actively promote team cohesion through virtual activities and celebrate both individual and team successes.



c) Holistic Well-being & Performance Monitoring: Conduct regular, informal check-ins to gauge team morale and individual well-being, not just project status. You'll be responsible for observing early signs of stress or disengagement and proactively offering support.



d) Constructive Feedback & Development: Provide regular, growth-oriented feedback designed to build skills and confidence. You will identify learning opportunities that align with each VA's career goals, acting as a champion for their professional development.



e) Effective Conflict Resolution: Serve as a neutral and fair mediator in the event of misunderstandings or disagreements. Your emotional intelligence will be key to identifying potential issues before they escalate and guiding the team toward positive resolutions.



f) Resource & Support Management: Ensure all tea
mbers have the tools, information, and resources they need to excel. You will act as their primary advocate and a reliable point of contact for any challenges they may face.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to build a high-performing, resilient, and motivated virtual team. By creating a foundation of trust, clear communication, and genuine support, you will ensure our projects are not only completed successfully but that our tea
mbers feel valued, respected, and empowered to do their best work. You will be the engine of our positive and productive team culture.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Proven Team Leadership Experience: You have a strong track record of managing or leading small teams, preferably in a remote setting, with references who can speak to your interpersonal skills.



b) Possesses High Emotional Intelligence: You are empathetic, self-aware, and skilled at navigating interpersonal dynamics. You can motivate, mediate, and communicate with tact and understanding.



c) Is an Organized and Proactive Communicator: You are meticulous in your planning and clear in your communication. You don't wait for problems to arise; you anticipate needs and facilitate smooth workflows.



d) Has a "Player-Coach" Mentality: You see your role as a leader who is invested in the success and well-being of your team, not just a manager who directs. You genuinely enjoy helping others grow.



e) Is Proficient with Modern PM Tools: You are skilled in using project management and communication platforms (e.g., Asana, Trello, Slack, etc.) to foster collaboration and clarity.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can articulate your thoughts in a clear, logical manner.



Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays.

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.



The opportunity to be a foundational leader in a people-first company culture.



Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.



A supportive environment where your leadership and emotional intelligence are highly valued.



[About Us]

We are a growing team dedicated to achieving our goals through a culture of collaboration and mutual support. We believe that our success is a direct result of our team's well-being and that a positive environment is essential for creating outstanding work. Your role is absolutely critical to making that belief a reality.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with either "Project Manager", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Work History: Share your resume, focusing on your experience leading, managing, or coordinating teams.



2) Subtle Observation & Action: Imagine you notice one of your most reliable VAs has suddenly become very brief in their communications—using one-word answers and no emojis, which is highly unusual for them. Their work quality is still excellent, but they seem disengaged. Describe your internal thought process and the specific, subtle actions you would take over the next 48 hours before escalating to a formal meeting.



3) Leadership Challenge & Dialogue: One of your VAs is a talented writer who is fantastic at executing assigned tasks, but they rarely contribute original ideas in team brainstorming sessions. Your goal is to help them develop the confidence to become a more proactive contributor. What are the first three open-ended questions you would ask them in a private check-in to understand their perspective before you offer any advice?



4) Creative Solution: If you had a 'magic wand' to instantly create one new tool, system, or a specific team ritual that doesn't exist yet, what would you create to solve the single biggest challenge you believe? Give it a name and explain how it would specifically foster both productivity and well-being.



5) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to tools for project management, task tracking, and team communication? Please mention why you prefer them.



6) AI in Your Workflow: Explain where and how you use AI to improve your productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI in a team management context. (Wish you aren't using AI for answering these questions, because they will be further discussed in the interview later.)



7) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



8) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with us. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



9) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
[Caution]

If you are a meticulous developer who is passionate about building robust, scalable web applications and takes pride in writing clean, efficient code for both the front-end and back-end, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires a deep understanding of the entire development lifecycle, from database design and API architecture to creating intuitive and responsive user interfaces.

If you view development as simply connecting pre-built components or relying heavily on AI without a deep consideration for security, performance, and the end-user experience, this role may be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about building the entire foundation for a thriving online community from the ground up (ideally with a self-assessed programming ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Full-Stack Developer (Community Platform)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Project



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $700–$1,400(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to key project milestones, such as a successful platform launch and achieving performance metrics. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the technical architect and builder of our community website. You will be responsible for creating a high-quality, full-featured platform that provides a seamless and engaging experience for our users. 

Your main tasks will include ONE or MULTIPLE of:



a) Full-Stack Platform Architecture & Development: You will design and build the entire community website from the ground up, creating a scalable database schema (e.g., with PostgreSQL/MongoDB) and developing a responsive front-end architecture using a modern framework (e.g., React, Vue).



b) Community Feature Implementation: You will develop the core features that bring our community to life, including dynamic user profiles, personalized content feeds, and the systems for creating, sharing, and commenting on posts.



c) User & Admin Communication Systems: You will build a secure, real-time messaging interface for users to contact our support team and integrate third-party
 services (e.g., SendGrid) for automated notifications and contact form submissions.



d) Security & User Authentication: You will implement a robust user authentication system with secure login/registration flows, password hashing, and session management. You'll apply security best practices throughout the stack to protect against common vulnerabilities (XSS, SQL injection).



e) End-to-End Testing & Quality Assurance: You will be responsible for the entire testing process, from writing unit and integration tests to debugging issues across the full stack to ensure a stable and bug-free user experience.



f) Deployment & Maintenance: You will manage the deployment pipeline (CI/CD) to a cloud environment (e.g., AWS, Vercel), monitor application performance, and perform ongoing maintenance to keep the platform fast and reliable as it grows.



[A Typical Week May Look Like This]



During Development: Architecting database models. Building out REST API endpoints. Writing clean, scalable code for new front-end and back-end features. Debugging and testing functionality across various browsers. Committing code to our Git repository.



Post-Launch: Monitoring server performance and error logs. Planning and developing new features based on community feedback. Optimizing database queries and code to improve speed and efficiency.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to create a fast, secure, and intuitive web platform that serves as the central hub for our online community. By building a high-quality website, you will empower our members to connect, share, and engage in a meaningful way, making our community an essential part of their online experience.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has a Strong Portfolio: You have verifiable experience building and launching full-stack web applications. You can show us live examples of projects you have built.



b) Is Technically Proficient: You are an expert in your chosen full-stack technologies (e.g., MERN, LAMP, Django/Python, Ruby on Rails) and have deep experience designing and consuming REST APIs. You follow best practices and write clean, maintainable code.



c) Is a Natural Problem-Solver: When faced with a technical challenge like a slow database query or a complex front-end state issue, you have a logical process for diagnosing the root cause and implementing an effective solution.



d) Is a Clear & Proactive Communicator: You can explain complex technical concepts simply to non-technical tea
mbers.



e) Is Product-Minded: You care about the end-user experience. You think critically about features and can offer valuable insights to help make the product better from both a technical and user perspective.



f) Communicates Effectively and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and understand the importance of clear communication within a remote team.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean? Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



-Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.

-The opportunity to own a project and build an exciting product from the ground up.

-Long-term growth opportunities as our community and platform scale.

-A supportive environment where your technical expertise is valued and your impact is visible.



[About Us]

We are building a vibrant online community for content creators. Our mission is to provide a space where members can connect, learn, and grow. Your role in building our web platform is the critical foundation for that mission.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “Full-Stack Developer”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Please indicate which items (a–f) from the [What You’ll Be Doing] section above you can handle professionally and confidently.



2) Work History: Based on your response to Question 1, please describe your experience for each item (a–f).



3) Portfolio: Include direct links to your two best live web applications you’ve built. Briefly describe your specific role and the tech stack used in those two projects.



4) Technical Challenge: Imagine our users are reporting that the website's main content feed is slow to load and feels "laggy" when they scroll. What are the first five steps you would take to diagnose and fix this performance issue, considering both the front-end and back-end?



5) Architectural Scenario: You are tasked with building the user-to-admin private messaging feature. Briefly describe the high-level architecture you would choose to ensure messages are delivered in real-time and that the system is both reliable and secure. Mention key front-end, back-end, and database considerations.



6) Describe the most challenging or poorly-documented piece of legacy code you were tasked with modifying. What made it so difficult to understand? Walk me through your methodical process for safely making your required change without breaking anything.



7) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to languages, frameworks, databases, and tools for full-stack web development? Please mention why you prefer them.



8) AI in Your Workflow: Although AI-generated code can save time, it may include subtle bugs or security issues that less experienced developers might miss. Explain where and how you use AI to improve your development productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI. (We expect you aren't using AI to answer these questions, as they will be discussed in the interview.)



9) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ..., in Philippines time").



10) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer a long-term collaboration.



11) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: EXPERIENCED PARALEGAL
description:
Join Our Compassionate & Collaborative Team: Full-Time Virtual ParalegalThe Paraclete Law Center, LLC.



Life is too short to start your day with dread. At The Paraclete Law Center, we understand that legal issues can be overwhelming and often create significant stress for our clients. Our firm is committed to easing our client’s  burdens: we thoroughly analyze the complexities of their matters and develop sound, comprehensive strategies to pursue the favorable outcome they deserve so they can move forward with confidence. 



 We guide clients through a transitional time of remarkable growth and transformation, supporting them in a manner consistent with their values using non-adversarial techniques when possible. We are committed to a firm culture where every tea
mber is valued and invested in, working collaboratively, strategically, and creatively to bring cases toward resolution.



We are seeking a highly motivated, dedicated, and experienced Virtual Paralegal to join our growing legal team. This is a full-time, 40-hour per week remote position where you will manage a caseload from inception to closure. This role requires a self-starter with exceptional organizational and communication skills, ready to take initiative with minimal hand-holding. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in Family Law and Probate Litigation.-----Key Responsibilities

Legal Document Preparation: Draft, proofread, and meticulously format a wide range of legal documents and correspondence, including pleadings, motions, discovery requests, affidavits, and agreements, ensuring grammatical accuracy and legal precision.

Case Management & Organization: Manage case files, ensuring all documents are properly filed, and all deadlines are met with 100% accuracy. Maintain and update the firm’s case management system.

Client & Stakeholder Communication: Serve as a primary point of contact for clients, providing regular case updates and ensuring they feel valued and supported. Coordinate with opposing counsel and court personnel as needed.

Research & Case Development: Conduct basic legal research using various databases to compile relevant information. Initiate and follow up on requests for medical/employment records and perform thorough background checks.

Time Management & Billing: LOG ALL TIME CONTEMPORANEOUSLY, providing a clear and precise record of hours spent on each task and case. Log a minimum of 25 hours per week dedicated to paralegal duties.

Administrative Support: Assist with filing, scanning, and organizing legal documents electronically and handle virtual mail and courier deliveries.

Compensation & Benefits





We offer a highly competitive compensation package commensurate with experience, as well as opportunities for ongoing professional development and training. Our tea
mbers also enjoy generous paid time off to ensure a healthy work-life balance.

Qualifications

Experience: Prior experience as a paralegal is required, preferably in family law and probate litigation.

Communication: Fluent in English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Skills: Strong organizational skills, impeccable attention to detail, and the ability to multitask and manage time effectively in a fast-paced, remote environment.

Mindset: A positive attitude, commitment to exceptional customer service, and the proven ability to work independently and take initiative.

Technical Proficiency: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and comfortable learning new case management software.

Virtual Setup: Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace.

How to Apply



We are excited to learn more about your qualifications and experience. To help us better understand your suitability for this role, we kindly request that you provide the following two items as part of your application:

Writing Sample: Please submit a recent writing sample (memo, brief, or other document) that showcases your legal research, drafting, and communication skills.

Video Introduction (2-3 minutes): Create a brief video introducing yourself and explaining why you believe you would be an excellent fit for our firm. We are particularly interested in hearing about your:

Motivation: Why you are interested in this position and what attracts you to working in family law and probate litigation.

Relevant Experience: Examples of your organizational skills and how you have managed tasks and deadlines.

Skills & Strengths: Focus on your customer service abilities, time management, and self-motivation.

Problem-Solving: Share an example of a challenging situation you faced professionally and how you resolved it.

Professionalism: Explain how you maintain professionalism and ensure high-quality work in a virtual setting.

We look forward to welcoming a new member to our team who shares our passion for helping families and providing outstanding legal services.

title: Research Assistant
description:
[Caution]



This position requires strong analytical skills, a high degree of healthy skepticism, impeccable judgment, and the ability to synthesize complex information into actionable intelligence. We are looking for a professional who takes pride in the quality and integrity of their work.



So, only read further if you’re passionate about deep investigative research, are comfortable spending significant time validating sources, and believe in forming well-reasoned conclusions based on evidence rather than shortcuts.



[Job Title]

Investigative Research VA (Due Diligence & Partner Vetting)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$1,000(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to the quality, depth, and actionable impact of your analysis. This could be triggered by identifying a critical red flag that prevents a poor partnership or uncovering an insight that leads to a significant business advantage. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be our intelligence frontline, conducting comprehensive investigations to determine if potential partner companies are legitimate, ethical, and trustworthy. Your main tasks will include:



a) Deep Media & Public Record Analysis: Go beyond surface-level news to uncover a company’s true public standing. This includes distinguishing genuine earned media from paid propaganda and verifying complex corporate structures, including parent companies, shell companies, and any history of name changes.



b) Digital Footprint & Online Presence Assessment: Dissect a company's complete online presence. You will analyze their website and SEO history to understand their strategic narrative and dig deep into forums, niche blogs, and comment sections to find candid, non-obvious online mentions.



c) Social Network & Engagement Audit: Evaluate the authenticity of a company’s online community. You will assess the quality of engagement (not just the quantity) to identify bot activity and evaluate how the company professionally and transparently handles critical questions or negative feedback.



d) Thorough Vetting of Key Personnel: A company is only as reputable as its leaders. You will cross-reference the professional histories of key executives, looking for inconsistencies, unexplained career gaps, or past associations with fraudulent or failed enterprises.



e) Customer & Client Feedback Analysis: Synthesize the true customer experience. This involves identifying recurring patterns in negative reviews that could signal systemic issues and validating the authenticity of positive reviews to screen for purchased or incentivized testimonials.



f) Direct Company Engagement (The Human Test): You will directly
 and call target companies with provided questions to gauge their operational integrity. You’ll analyze their response times, professionalism, transparency, and overall willingness to engage in good faith.



g) Synthesis & Evidence-Based Reporting: Your final and most critical task is to transform raw data into actionable intelligence. You will deliver a clear, concise report where every conclusion is backed by cited evidence and provide a definitive recommendation on whether to proceed with a partnership.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to protect our business by providing the clear, fact-based, and trustworthy assessments we need to make sound partnership decisions. By conducting diligent, uncompromising research, you will ensure we only align with legitimate and ethical partners, safeguarding our reputation and resources.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has a Proven Track Record in Investigative Research: You have direct experience in roles requiring deep investigation, such as journalism, academia, paralegal work, or market research. You have a portfolio of past research reports that you can share.



b) Possesses a High Degree of Skepticism & Analytical Rigor: You are naturally inquisitive and question everything. You excel at identifying inconsistencies, weighing conflicting sources, and distinguishing between correlation and causation.



c) Is a Clear and Nuanced Communicator: You are meticulous and precise in your written communication. You are comfortable using nuanced language ("evidence suggests," "high degree of confidence") rather than making absolute claims you cannot prove.



d) Is a Master of Digital Research Tools: You are highly proficient with advanced search engine operators, social media analysis tools, website archive tools (e.g., Wayback Machine), and methods for searching public records.



e) Demonstrates Exceptional Human Judgment: You understand that not all data is equal and can apply common sense and critical thinking to interpret the subtleties of human behavior online and in direct communication.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can articulate your thoughts in a clear, logical manner.



Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean? Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let us know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.



The opportunity to play a critical role in our strategic decision-making process.



Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.



A supportive environment where your diligence, intellect, and analytical skills are highly valued.



[About Us]

We are a growing team dedicated to achieving our goals through smart strategy and diligent execution. We believe that our success is built on a foundation of sound, data-driven decisions and that vetting our partners with the utmost care is essential. Your role is absolutely critical to upholding this standard.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with "Investigative Researcher", or your application cannot be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Work History / Portfolio: Share your resume and, more importantly, 1-2 examples of past research reports that showcase your analytical and reporting skills.



2) Research Open-end Scenario: Imagine you are investigating a private company with a very limited digital footprint and have hit a wall with standard search methods. Walk me through how you would approach the research process, preferably in 3-5 steps. This is open-ended question. Explain the strategic reason for your specific sequence. 



3) Source Credibility Challenge: You uncover two pieces of information about a potential partner. The first is a glowing, sponsored article on a well-known business blog. The second is an anonymous but highly detailed negative review from a former employee on a niche industry forum. How do you weigh these two sources in your final report, and what are your next steps?



4) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to tools for deep research beyond a standard Google search? Please mention specific tools for website analysis, social media investigation, or public record searches and why you prefer them.



5) AI in Your Workflow: Explain where and how you use AI to assist in your research process and, critically, where you believe relying on AI is a liability that compromises research integrity. (We hope you aren't using AI to answer these questions, as we will discuss them in detail during the interview.)



6) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 9 AM - 5 PM EST").



7) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with us. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



8) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for briefing and reporting.



I will respond to all applications within 7-15 days.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: WordPress Developer (Website Admin)
description:
[Caution]

If you are a technical problem-solver at heart who thrives on building robust, secure, and efficient web solutions, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires deep proficiency in the WordPress ecosystem, a high degree of analytical skill for debugging, meticulous attention to detail in your code, and the ability to take ownership of a website's technical health. You will be responsible for the core infrastructure that powers our online presence.

If these values don't align with yours, this job can be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about writing clean code, optimizing performance, and building the stable, secure foundation that allows a website to scale (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Back-end WordPress Developer (Website Admin)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$1,000(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to the quality and impact of your work, such as meeting project deadlines and achieving key performance metrics (e.g., uptime, page speed improvements, security). We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the technical guardian and engine of our WordPress website. You will be responsible for all back-end aspects of the site, ensuring it is secure, fast, and scalable. Your main tasks will include:



a) Custom Plugin & Theme Development: You will extend our website's functionality by developing custom plugins and theme features. This requires writing clean, well-documented code that adheres strictly to WordPress coding standards to ensure long-term maintainability and compatibility.



b) Database Management & Optimization: You will be responsible for the health of our WordPress database. This includes writing efficient database queries to ensure fast page loads and implementing robust security and backup protocols to protect our data.



c) Server-Side Scripting & PHP Logic: You will build and manage the core logic that powers our website's dynamic features. A deep understanding of PHP and WordPress Hooks (Actions and Filters) is essential to customize functionality without compromising the core structure.



d) API Integration & Management: You will connect our website with third-party services and applications. This involves leveraging the WordPress REST API and ensuring all data exchange is handled securely and efficiently.



e) Proactive Security & Maintenance: You will own our website's security posture. This involves implementing proactive security measures against common vulnerabilities (like XSS), performing regular malware scans, and diligently managing all updates for the WordPress core, themes, and plugins.



f) Website Performance Optimization: You will be tasked with making our website as fast as possible. Your responsibilities will include implementing effective caching strategies, optimizing database queries, and minifying code and resources to improve user experience and SEO rankings.



g) Advanced Troubleshooting & Debugging: When technical issues arise, you will be the expert responsible for diagnosing and resolving them. You must have strong problem-solving skills and be proficient with debugging tools to efficiently identify the root cause of any plugin conflict or server error.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to provide our business with a rock-solid, secure, and high-performing website. By transforming technical requirements into robust back-end solutions, you will ensure our digital platform is reliable, scalable, and provides a seamless experience for our users. You will be the engine of stability for our entire online operation.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Verifiable WordPress Development Experience: You have a strong portfolio showcasing custom plugins, themes, or complex back-end solutions you have built for WordPress.



b) Is a Master Problem-Solver: You can connect disparate symptoms to identify the root cause of a technical issue and can architect elegant, long-term solutions.



c) Is Meticulous and Security-Focused: You have a passion for writing clean, efficient code and a methodical approach to website security and maintenance.



d) Has a Proactive and Ownership Mindset: You don’t just fix problems as they appear; you anticipate future needs and continuously work to improve the website's performance and security.



e) Is Proficient with the Modern WordPress Stack: You are highly skilled in PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, and the WordPress REST API, and are comfortable using modern development and debugging tools.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can explain complex technical issues in a clear, logical manner.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays.

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.

-The opportunity to be the foundational technical owner of a growing digital platform.

-Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.

-A supportive environment where your technical expertise is valued and your impact is visible.



[About Us]

We are a growing team dedicated to providing an exceptional online experience in our industry. Our mission is to build a digital platform our audience can rely on. Your role is absolutely essential in building and maintaining the technical integrity that will make that mission a reality.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with either "Back-End WordPress Pro", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Portfolio & Code Samples: Share your resume, links to just your best 1~2 works(preferably your previous client's websites, stating your specific role). Do not share a link to everything you've done. Time is very limited.



2) Imagine this: It's Monday morning, and you get an urgent message. A client's website is intermittently showing a blank white screen (the WordPress White Screen of Death). They say they haven't changed anything. You have FTP and database access. Tell me the first five steps you would take, in the exact order you would take them, and narrate your reasoning for each action.



3) Troubleshooting Challenge: Your client's WordPress site has suddenly become very slow. Describe your process for diagnosing the issue. What are the first five things you would investigate and why?



4) Security Challenge: You suspect a WordPress site has been compromised. Briefly outline the key steps you would take to identify the breach, clean the site, and harden it against future attacks.



5) Beyond the obvious answers, what is one specific part of the WordPress core API or architecture that you genuinely admire for its design, and why? Conversely, what is one part that you find consistently frustrating or poorly designed, and how do you typically work around its limitations in your projects?



6) Preferred Tool Stack: What is your go-to development environment? Please list any specific debugging tools, IDEs, and version control systems you prefer to use.



7) Explain where and how you use AI to improve your productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI. (Wish you aren't using AI for answering these questions, because they will be further discussed in the interview later.)



8) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



9) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with us. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



10) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you

title: Web Design Lead (Long-Term Role, WordPress, Growth Opportunity)
description:
About the Company

We are a U.S.-based marketing agency serving local service businesses. We are expanding into website creation as a core service and are looking for a long-term tea
mber to help build and lead this division as it grows.



This is not a short-term freelance role. We are looking for someone who wants stability, growth, and increasing responsibility over time.



Role Overview

You will be responsible for building small business websites and helping us systemize and scale this service. As volume increases, this role can grow into a leadership position managing additional designers or developers.



Responsibilities

 • Build small business websites (WordPress)

 • Deliver sites from start to launch

 • Use and help standardize templates and workflows

 • Handle revisions within defined scope

 • Communicate clearly on timelines and progress

 • Help prepare this service for scale



Required Skills

 • Strong WordPress experience

 • Mobile-responsive design

 • Experience building small business websites

 • Basic on-page SEO setup

 • Reliable communication and deadline management



Nice to Have

 • Leadership or mentoring experience

title: Recruiter and Onboarding Specialist (with US Healthcare Experience)
description:
Join Our Team :)



About the Role:

We are seeking a dynamic and organized Recruiter and Onboarding Specialist to join our growing team. In this dual-function role, you will be responsible for sourcing and hiring top talent while ensuring new hires have a smooth and engaging onboarding experience. You’ll play a key role in shaping a positive candidate journey from first contact through their successful integration into the company.



Key Responsibilities:

Recruitment (Talent Acquisition)

Write and post job descriptions on internal and external job boards.

Source candidates through databases, LinkedIn, job boards, and referrals.

Screen resumes and conduct initial interviews to assess qualifications and cultural fit.

Coordinate interview schedules and facilitate communication between candidates and hiring teams.

Maintain and update applicant tracking systems (e.g., Zoho Recruit, Greenhouse).

Manage the offer process, including negotiation and documentation.



Onboarding

Own the onboarding lifecycle from offer acceptance through Day 1 and beyond.

Prepare and send onboarding documents, equipment requests, and welcome kits.

Facilitate new hire orientation sessions and ensure timely completion of compliance documentation (e.g., I-9, W-4).

Coordinate with IT, Facilities, and other departments for system and workspace readiness.

Monitor and support employee integration during their first 30/60/90 days.

Solicit feedback from new hires to continuously improve the onboarding experience.



Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business, or related field preferred.

2+ years of experience in recruiting and/or onboarding with remote client EXPERIENCE

Familiarity with ATS and HRIS systems (e.g., Justworks, Zoho, BambooHR).

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational and time management abilities.

Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

A passion for delivering an outstanding candidate and new hire experience.



Preferred Skills:

Experience recruiting in healthcare, tech, or a high-growth environment.

Knowledge of employment laws and onboarding best practices.

Comfortable working cross-functionally with hiring managers and HR teams.



Technology Requirement:

Minimum 80 mbps Internet Speed

Minimum intel i5 8th gen with 8GB of RAM

Webcam and Headset

Designated Office Space in your home



Perks of the Job:

Very competitive salary

Fully Remote WFH Setup

Paid Time Off 10 days

Opportunity for professional growth and development

A supportive and inclusive work environment where your voice is heard and your ideas are valued



Ready to Join the Team?

s and logging everything 



Career potential

title: Remote Sales & Customer Support Coordinator (Technical Products)
description:
HOURS: Monday - Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Sydney Time (AEDT).



ABOUT THE ROLE: KF Plastics is a leading plastic fabrication company in Sydney. We are looking for the "Voice" of our company. You will manage our digital front desk, handling an even split of inbound calls and
 enquiries. We do NOT want a silent data entry clerk. We need a confident, fast learner who can quote standard products instantly and act as a "Technical Gatekeeper" for complex engineering jobs.



YOUR MISSION:



1. Phone & Technical Support (50% of your day):



Answer Inbound Calls: You are the first person customers speak to. You must sound professional, friendly, and Australian-business-ready.



Technical Triage: You will handle questions about material availability and standard cuts. For complex engineering questions, you act as the gatekeeper—gathering the specs and passing them to our Engineering Team.



Close the Sale: Use our internal "Calculator" to quote Cut-to-Size jobs instantly and take payment over the phone.



2.
 & Operations (50% of your day):



Inbox Zero: Reply to
s within minutes, not hours.



Quoting: Process standard quote requests from our website using our pricing tools.



Follow-Up: Call customers 48 hours after a quote is sent to check if they are ready to proceed.



Logistics: Book couriers (Shippit) and ensure customers get their tracking numbers.



REQUIREMENTS:



Excellent Spoken English: You must have a clear, neutral accent and be confident speaking on the phone with Australian tradespeople and engineers.



Technical Aptitude: You don't need to be an engineer, but you must be able to learn the difference between "Acrylic" and "Polycarbonate" quickly. If you have sold technical or industrial products before, tell us!



"Closer" Mindset: You are comfortable asking: "Would you like to pay for that now so we can start production?"



Tech Savvy: Fast learner on HubSpot, Xero, Google Sheets, and VoIP tools.



HOW TO APPLY: To prove you have the attention to detail we need, please do the following:



Record a 60-second voice message (use 
) introducing yourself. Tell us about a time you had to learn a technical product or explain something complex to a customer.



Send your Resume and the Link to your voice recording.



Important: In your
, please confirm your "Preferred English Name" that you would use on the phone with clients.



Set your
 subject line to: "I am your new Front Counter Coordinator - [Your Name]"

title: Full Stack Sales Rep/Closer
description:
Clinicly Inc. is a distributor of innovative wellness technology in North America. Our flagship product, the NovaPod 2.0, is a futuristic wellness capsule combining six therapies in one device. It helps medspas, gyms, and wellness centers generate new recurring revenue while giving clients life-changing results.



We’re looking for a motivated Account Executive based in the Philippines to join our remote sales team. You’ll manage warm inbound leads from first contact through to closed sale.





What You’ll Do

- Handle SMS & send info
s

- Follow up by phone, SMS, and
 until the buyer is ready

- Guide the client to complete their purchase (send invoice/payment link)

- Hit monthly sales targets (4–8+ sales/month)

- Track all activity in CRM and maintain timely follow-ups





What We Offer



- Pay Structure: $1,500 USD/month + $325 commission per sale (full-time, remote)

- ?Expected On Target Earnings - $4,100/month

- Bonuses: Monthly performance bonuses for hitting sales targets

- Warm Leads Only: All leads come from our ad campaigns — no cold prospecting

- Training & Scripts Provided: You’ll be fully equipped to succeed

- Stable Long-Term Role: We want someone to grow with us

- Work From Home: Flexible remote work with set U.S./Canada hours





What We’re Looking For



- Excellent spoken and written English (neutral accent preferred)

- Very good at natural communication in English

- Driven and motivated to meet sales targets

- Highly organized with consistent follow-up discipline

- 2+ years sales experience (call center, inbound/outbound, or account management)





Why Join Us?



This role gives you the chance to represent a premium, in-demand product with strong support behind you. You’ll receive warm leads, base pay, bonuses, and long-term stability, with the opportunity to grow into senior roles as we expand.

title: Video Editor for Online Medical Education Course — Ongoing Work
description:
WHO WE ARE:

Prepping Partner is a growing online education business founded by an emergency medicine physician. We teach medical professionals and families how to prepare for emergencies through courses, webinars, and social media content. Our audience is doctors, veterinarians, dentists, and other professionals — so our content needs to be polished, credible, and calm (not flashy or hype-driven).

WHAT WE NEED RIGHT NOW:

A skilled video editor to polish recorded lecture-style presentations. These are slide-based talks with the instructor speaking on camera. They've been partially edited in Descript (filler words and dead air removed). Your job is to take them the rest of the way:



Make the slides look sharper and more visually engaging

Improve pacing, transitions, and flow

Clean up audio (levels, clarity, any remaining issues)

Remove any off-topic tangents or side conversations to create evergreen content

Add simple intro/outro (templates will be provided)

Export in correct formats for YouTube and course hosting



THE IMMEDIATE PROJECT:



4 lecture videos (~2 hours each after initial edit) ready NOW

12 more lectures coming over the next 3-4 months

1 hour of taste-test footage to cut into short promotional clips and b-roll

Potential course intro video



ONGOING WORK (after initial project):



Monthly webinar recordings to edit

Short-form clips for
, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

Promotional videos and b-roll creation

Potential for growing into additional VA tasks (affiliate link management, uploading, etc.)



THIS ROLE IS A GREAT FIT IF YOU:



Have experience editing talking-head or educational content (not just music videos or gaming)

Know how to make a speaker and slides look professional WITHOUT overdoing effects

Can work independently once you understand the style

Communicate clearly and respond within 24 hours

Can handle feedback and revisions without taking it personally

Want a long-term relationship with one client, not a one-off gig



REQUIRED SKILLS:



Video editing: Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or similar professional tool

Descript experience (strongly preferred — we use it for initial editing)

title: Experienced Pre-Press/Printing Graphic Design Person
description:
Howdy y'all!  We are New York based marketing agency that is looking for assistance with graphic design specifically pertaining to pre-press and printing.  If you believe you qualify, you must review all the requirements below.  If you do not have specific experience in pre-press and printing, it is not likely you should apply for this position, so please read the post completely and thoroughly, and, respond accordingly.



We currently work with Adobe InDesign but are willing consider a move to Canva Pro.  We currently use Adobe Creative Suite, but you would need to provide your own Canva Pro account.  We like Canva Pro but haven't yet fully committed to it.  Therefore, our work is initially in Adobe InDesign (which is the standard still for American pre-press work).



Here are the requirements to apply; when you respond to this post, just please make it very clear that you can meet each requirement:



*  Robust experience using either Adobe Creative Suite or Canva Pro.  (Note: having only an unlicensed version of Canva would be insufficient for this position).



*  Depth of commercially produced and commercially viable pre-press and printed work; such designs would be for printed postcards, or brochures, or magazines, or envelopes, or letterhead, or annual reports, or similar.  In other words, you must be able to demonstrate that you have significant pre-press experience.



*  Online portfolio (such as 
) that would be easy for us to review your past efforts. Unfortunately, we will not comb through anyone's online digital image repositories to glean design talents and abilities (e.g. we will not be going through images on GoogleDrive, Dropbox, etc.).



*  Abidance of pre-press "best practices" in graphic design.  Examples of standard pre-press best practices are:  use of layers (images/text) in InDesign, version control, packaged subfolders (InDesign), proper use of white space (and reverse white space), knowledge of design effects, controlled use of fonts that are either common or packaged with your design, and perhaps most of all, crops-for-bleeds (crop marks). [Note: if you are not familiar with these terms, it is not likely that this position is for you.]



*  Availability such that your hours coi
 with our hours here in New York (New York time = GMT-5 or Eastern Standard Time [EST]).  It is not necessary that you work an overnight, but you will need to have overlap at least our time zone for a minimum of 3 hours.  Further, you must be available to respond within 12 hours if we need assistance.  While it is, of course, unreasonable that your availability would be "on demand", we nonetheless must establish some sort of minimum and agreed upon response time protocols.



*  Consciousness that the design work for our clients is time sensitive and budget sensitive.  Example: on the U.S. Eastern Seaboard, one side of a 5 1/2" x 8 1/2" postcard would take no more than one (1) hour; working on a two-sided card would therefore take no more than one and a half (1.5) to two (2) hours.  The turn-around would need to be within 24 hours.  We would pay by the hour.  



Good news:  we can train for U.S. Postal Service regulations regarding physical mailpiece standards and layout out.  Further, we also know that you cannot read minds so our job ticket descriptions are usually very detailed.  However, we are unable to train for carefulness of effort and awareness of reading job tickets properly.  Once completed, your files would be re-uploaded to our cloud server or otherwise accessible to us online to our digital network.  Finally, your use of the English language would need to be solid and there is an expectation that your attitude would be positive and of good cheer.



When you apply, please (a) respond here and (b) also send an
 to 
 wherein your will state "Hey HR Manager, I really read the WHOLE post!".  In this way, we'll know that - yes, you guessed it - actually read the whole post.  Questions?  First, respond positive to the requirements above, and then we are happy to answer any questions!



Thank you!

title: SEO Publisher & On-Page SEO Specialist (Part-Time VA)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are a photography-based service business with consistent daily content production.

We already have writers creating blog posts.



We are looking for a detail-oriented SEO VA whose responsibility is to take finished blog posts and turn them into clean, search-optimized pages that get indexed, earn impressions, and drive long-term traffic.



This role is focused on execution, structure, and consistency - not blog writing and not SEO theory.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



You will take completed content and turn it into properly optimized SEO assets.



Publish blog posts to WordPress



Optimize on-page SEO:



SEO titles and meta descriptions



Correct H1, H2, H3 structure



Add relevant internal links to service and pillar pages



Optimize images (compression, correct sizing, WebP when possible)



Write clean, accurate alt text (no keyword stuffing)



Ensure formatting is clean and readable



Create related Google Business Profile posts when appropriate



Monitor Google Search Console (indexing, impressions, clicks, CTR)



Improve underperforming posts when needed



Deliver a simple weekly SEO report (numbers + brief notes)



HOW WE MEASURE SUCCESS (IMPORTANT)



We do not measure SEO by “rankings.”



We measure success by:



Proper indexing in Google Search Console



Growth in impressions over time



Clicks and CTR trends



Clean on-page structure and internal linking



Clear explanations of SEO decisions



If you cannot explain why you made an SEO change, this role is not a fit.



REQUIRED SKILLS



WordPress CMS experience



Strong understanding of on-page SEO



Experience with Yoast, RankMath, or SEOPress



Google Search Console familiarity



Image optimization knowledge



Internal linking best practices



High attention to detail



Clear written English



Ability to explain decisions in simple language



NICE TO HAVE (NOT REQUIRED)



Local SEO experience



Google Business Profile management



GA4 familiarity



Basic schema knowledge



Clean citation or directory submission experience



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT



This role is NOT:



? A blog writing position



? A backlink-spamming role



? An “SEO guru” or strategy consultant



? Black-hat SEO, PBNs, or comment spam



We want clean, long-term, sustainable SEO execution.



REQUIRED TO APPLY (SCREENING FILTER)



To apply, please answer ALL of the following:



How do you d
 which keyword to target for a blog post?



What do you check in Google Search Console after publishing?



What do you do with blog posts that are not performing?



Applications without clear answers will not be reviewed.



PAID TEST TASK (FINALISTS ONLY)



Shortlisted candidates will complete a paid test task:



Optimize one existing blog post



Provide SEO title, meta description, headers, internal links



Briefly explain your decisions



We are evaluating clarity, cleanliness, and reasoning — not speed.



HOURS & PAY



8–10 hours per week to start



Flexible schedule



Pay range: $3–5 USD per hour, depending on experience



Pay is based on role responsibility and execution quality, not generic AI estimates.



WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS



Content that isn’t optimized doesn’t perform.



Your job is to turn published content into search-visible, traffic-generating assets through consistent, careful execution.



If you enjoy structured work, clean systems, and improving performance over time, this role will be a good fit.



FINAL NOTE



We value clarity, consistency, and long-term thinking over buzzwords.



If you can explain what you’re doing and why, you’ll do well here.

title: Instagram & Social Media Manager-Strategy & Growth for Service Businesses
description:
We are looking for an experienced Social Media Manager with strong Instagram experience to help manage and grow social media presence for several local service businesses.



This role is focused on building visibility, trust, and generating real business inquiries — not just posting graphics.



You will initially work with:



CPA / Tax & Advisory Services



Residential Cleaning Business



Landscaping Business



These are local service businesses where customers choose providers based on trust, professionalism, and consistency. The goal is to create content that positions each business as a reliable local expert.



What We Are Trying to Achieve



Our approach is similar to how professional marketing agencies manage campaigns:



01 — Social Media Strategy & Optimization



Establish consistent messaging and content themes that educate customers and build trust. Improve engagement quality and encourage inquiries from local customers.



02 — Content & Profile Optimization



Improve profiles, captions, and content structure so potential customers clearly understand services and can easily take action (call, message, or request a quote).



03 — Engagement & Growth Systems



Develop repeatable processes for content planning, posting schedules, and engagement that steadily improve reach and visibility over time.



Follower count alone is not the goal. Quality engagement and inquiries are the priority.



Responsibilities



Develop monthly Instagram content plans



Create and schedule posts, reels, and stories



Write professional captions aligned with each brand



Recommend improvements to profiles and messaging



Monitor engagement and suggest adjustments



Track performance and explain what is working and why



Repurpose content across platforms when appropriate



Required Experience



Proven experience managing Instagram accounts



Experience with service-based or local businesses preferred



Strong English writing and communication skills



Canva or Adobe design experience



Familiarity with scheduling tools (Meta Business Suite, Later, Buffer, etc.)



Ability to maintain consistent branding and tone



What We Are NOT Looking For



Someone who only creates graphics without strategy



Artificial follower growth or engagement tactics



Generic or recycled content



Someone who requires daily step-by-step direction



Compensation



Starting with a paid trial project



Opportunity for long-term monthly work if successful



Please include your monthly rate for managing one Instagram account



Application Requirements (Important)



To help us identify candidates who think strategically and not just execute tasks, please include the following in your application:



Links to two Instagram accounts you currently manage or have managed.



Briefly explain one specific improvement you would make to each account today and why.



In 3–5 sentences, explain how you would use Instagram to generate inquiries for a local service business (CPA, cleaning, or landscaping).



Applications that do not include these items will not be reviewed.



.

title: Technical Operations Manager (Virtual)
description:
Role Overview



We are seeking a high-agency Technical Operations Manager to serve as the "right hand" to leadership. This is not a traditional administrative role; it is a hybrid position requiring a blend of executive support, sales development, multimedia production, and software automation.



The AI Philosophy: We expect you to be an "AI-First" professional. You should be proficient in leveraging LLMs and automation tools to 10x your output. However, AI is your assistant, not your replacement. You must possess the fundamental skills to audit, edit, and improve everything the AI produces to ensure 100% quality and brand alignment.

Key Responsibilities

1. Executive & Operations Support



    Gatekeeping: Manage complex calendars and high-volume
 inboxes with discretion and precision.

    Vendor & Talent Management: Oversee external vendors and qualify applicants for open roles using our established internal processes.

    Process Documentation: Build and maintain "Standard Operating Procedures" (SOPs) to ensure the business scales efficiently.



2. Sales, CRM & Lead Management



    Lead Pipeline: Add, qualify, and segment leads within the CRM.

    Active Outreach: Initiate contact and execute rigorous follow-up sequences to move leads through the funnel.

    Data Integrity: Ensure all communications are logged and the CRM remains the "single source of truth."



3. Multimedia & Content Production



    Podcast Management: Edit raw audio/video recordings into polished episodes (including intro/outros, noise reduction, and flow).

    Publishing: Manage the end-to-end distribution process across hosting platforms and social media.

    Social Content: Slicing long-form content into high-engagement clips for various social channels.



4. Automation & Technical Projects



    No-Code/Low-Code Dev: Build and maintain automations (Zapier, Make, or similar) to connect our tech stack.

    Coding: Assist with software-based coding projects (Python, JavaScript, or similar) to solve specific business problems.

    AI Implementation: Identify opportunities to integrate AI into existing workflows to increase efficiency.



Qualifications & Skills



    The Fundamentals: Exceptional written and verbal communication. You must be able to write a professional
 and a technical brief without relying on "Generic AI-speak."

    Technical Stack: Proficiency in CRM software (HubSpot, Salesforce, or Pipedrive), Podcast Editing software (Descript, Adobe Audition, or similar), and project management tools (ClickUp, Notion, or Asana).

    Coding Literacy: Ability to read, write, and debug code for business automation and software projects.

    AI Mastery: Expert-level prompting skills and experience with AI-assisted coding and content generation.

    The "Vibe": You are a self-starter who solves problems before they reach the CEO's desk.



The Hiring Process (Our "Standard of Excellence")



We value your time and ours. Our vetting process is rigorous:



    Initial Screen: Review of portfolio and technical experience.

    The "Quality Test": A paid work sample involving a complex automation task and a communication scenario where you must audit an AI-generated response for quality.

    Video Interview: A deep dive into your logic, technical stack, and cultural fit.



Why This Role?



You will have the autonomy to build systems from the ground up and work at the bleeding edge of AI and business operations. You won't just be "checking boxes"—you will be driving the engine.



Application Process



To be considered for this position, please visit: 



This position requires candidates to successfully complete our comprehensive evaluation process, which includes technical assessments and multiple interview stages to ensure the best fit for both the role and our organizational culture.

title: GoHighLevel Campaign & Funnel Builder (Part-Time, 20hrs/wk, Long-Term)
description:
WHY THIS ROLE IS DIFFERENT



Most GHL job posts are one-off projects. This isn't that.



I'm hiring one person to become my go-to GoHighLevel builder for the long haul. Consistent hours. Consistent pay. Room to grow your skills and your income over time. I don't want to hire and re-hire. I want to find the right person once and build together for years.



You'll be working directly with a US-based digital marketing company (California) that runs multiple campaigns, funnels, and automations inside GoHighLevel every month. There is no shortage of work.



IMMEDIATE PROJECT



12 funnels need to be rebuilt from Kartra into GoHighLevel. This is your Day 1 assignment. From there, you'll continue building new campaigns on an ongoing basis.



COMPENSATION



Rate: $10/hr USD (approximately ?586/hr PHP)

Hours: 20 hours per week

Monthly: $800 USD (approximately ?46,800 PHP)

Schedule: Flexible hours. Must have some overlap with US Pacific Time (California) for check-ins and communication.

Payment: Reliable. On time. Every time.

Growth: Hours and rate increase as you prove yourself.





WHAT YOU'LL BUILD



Lead magnet opt-in funnels. Webinar registration and replay funnels. Low-ticket offer funnels. Appointment booking funnels.
 nurture sequences. Complete end-to-end campaigns with proper tagging, tracking, and integrations tied together correctly.



You'll also work with landing pages, registration pages, sales pages, webinar pages, thank you pages, membership site pages, affiliate pages, and general website pages.



REQUIRED GHL EXPERIENCE (all four, non-negotiable)

You must have recent, hands-on GoHighLevel experience with every one of these:



Workflows, Automations & Tags. Multi-step sequences, conditional logic, proper tagging architecture.

Landing Pages, Forms &
s. Building and customizing pages, embedding forms, designing
 templates inside GHL.

Integrations & Tracking. Pixel placement, API integrations, affiliate tracking, UTM parameters, tracking codes, basic SEO.

Snapshots. Building, exporting, and deploying complete campaign snapshots.



If you're missing experience in any one of these four areas, this role is not the right fit.



WHO SUCCEEDS IN THIS ROLE



You think like a campaign architect, not just a page builder. You understand how tags, triggers, tracking, and integrations connect into one system.

You hit every deadline. No excuses, no surprises.

You track your hours honestly and give progress updates without being asked.

You ask questions the 
nt something is unclear instead of guessing and hoping.

You take pride in clean, professional-looking work. (I'm hiring a builder, not a designer, but your pages should look sharp.)

You want stability and growth, not just another gig.





WHAT YOU GET



20 hours per week, every week

Long-term role (years, not months)

Opportunity to increase hours and rate as we grow together

Clear communication, organized projects, structured feedback

A team that invests in your development





HOW TO APPLY (3 requirements, all mandatory)



I read every application personally. To be considered, you must do all three of the following:

1. Subject line: "I AM The Experienced GHL Expert You Seek!"

if you are NOT a true GHL expert... please do not apply. 

2. Show your GHL work. Include links or screenshots of funnels and campaigns you have recently built inside GoHighLevel. I do not need to see work from ClickFunnels, Kartra, ActiveCampaign, Kajabi, LeadPages, or any other platform. GoHighLevel examples only. 

No GHL portfolio, no interview.

3. Answer this question in your application: "What is the most profitable GHL campaign you've built, and what made it profitable?"

If your application is missing any of these three items, it will not be reviewed. Zero exceptions.



I'm looking forward to finding the right person for this role.

Travis, California

title: Virtual Assistant - Appointment Setter
description:
Our mission is to help busy Asian men lose stubborn belly fat and get lean without giving up cultural foods. We’ve built a thriving community and now need a world-class communicator to handle inbound/outbound DMs, qualify leads, and book as many sales calls as possible.





Pay:

- 40–50 hours per week

- Base Salary: $650 USD/month

- Commission: 3% revenue from every client you book that closes

- Total Earning Potential: $1,000–$1,500+ per month (top performers earn more)





About the Role:

- Starting conversations in the DMs with new followers, engagers, and leads (using proven scripts + frameworks we provide).

- Qualifying leads by asking natural, smart questions.

- Booking qualified prospects directly into sales calls with our closer/coach.

- Following up with warm leads daily until they book.

- Updating our CRM + tracking conversations for full accountability.

- Matching our tone/voice so every conversation feels personal and authentic.

- This is a performance-driven role. The more qualified calls you book, the more you earn.



REQUIREMENTS:



- Fluent English Skills: Excellent written + verbal communication. Must be able to type and respond FAST in perfect English.

- Prior Experience: 1–3+ years as an Instagram/FB DM appointment setter (fitness coaching industry preferred).

- Proven Track Record: Demonstrated success booking qualified calls that actually show.

- Modern Equipment: Reliable laptop + stable, high-speed internet.

- Social Media Savvy: Familiar with Instagram and
 
 platforms.

- Adaptability: Able to quickly pick up and follow a specific communication style.

- Discipline: Comfortable sending 80–100+ high-quality DMs per day.

- Flexibility: Willing to work mornings, evenings, and weekends if needed.

- Positive, coachable, and hungry to grow with a fast-moving team.





Why Join Us:



- Work directly with a fast-growing multi 6-figure fitness coaching business serving the Asian community.

- Be part of a fast-growing business that’s on track to become the #1 fitness coaching brand serving the Asian community.

- Clear systems, scripts, and training to set you up for success.

- Performance-based culture: high performers earn raises, bonuses, and leadership opportunities.

- Remote work + flexible schedule.

- Paid training and long-term growth potential





HOW TO APPLY:

- Reply directly to this job post with a brief message expressing your interest to apply.

- Book in for an interview using the following link: 

- Reply "BOOKED" to confirm that you booked in for your interview





Looking forward to speaking with you!

title: Placement Operations Specialist
description:
Role Mission



The Placement Operations Specialist is responsible for the precise execution and tracking of job applications on behalf of our executive-level clients. You will serve as the "engine" of their career transition, ensuring every application is tailored, every data point is tracked, and no opportunity falls through the cracks. This role requires an obsession with detail and a high degree of comfort managing sensitive personal information.



Key Responsibilities



Application Execution: Navigate various job boards (LinkedIn, Indeed, Otta, etc.) and company career portals to submit high-quality applications on behalf of clients.Data Management & Privacy: Securely manage client PII (Personally Identifiable Information), including resumes, social security numbers (where required for portals), and contact details, ensuring total confidentiality.Status Tracking: Maintain a real-time, master dashboard of all submitted applications, interview requests, and "rejection" notifications using tools like Airtable, Notion, or a specialized CRM.Process Optimization: Follow strict "Rules of Engagement" for each client (e.g., only applying to roles within specific salary bands or industries) and suggest improvements to the submission workflow.Quality Control: Audit resumes and cover letters for formatting consistency before submission to ensure they align with the specific job description requirements.

You understand that in this role, "close enough" is a failure.If you've read this, change the font color on your resume to Blue.Systemic Thinking: You love spreadsheets, color-coded statuses, and "If-This-Then-That" logic.Tech Fluency: High proficiency in data management tools (Airtable, Excel/Google Sheets) and the ability to quickly learn new ATS interfaces.Discretion: You will be handling the "keys" to a person’s professional life; integrity and security-mindedness are non-negotiable.



The "Why You?" (Candidate Profile)



You have experience in HR, Recruitment, or high-level Executive Assisting.You find satisfaction in "zeroing out" a list and keeping a database pristine.You understand that behind every data entry is a real person’s career and future.







Work Environment



This

 is a fully virtual position offering flexibility to work from anywhere 

while maintaining collaborative relationships with tea
mbers and 

clients across various time zones.

To be considered for this position, please visit: 



This

 position requires candidates to successfully complete our comprehensive

organizational culture.

title: High Expert Video Editor for Fast-Growing Skincare E-Commerce Brand (Multi 6-Figure DTC)

Hours: 25+ hours/week, flexible schedule

Project-based with potential for long-term



Performance Bonuses: Earn additional bonuses when your video edits become winning ad creatives that drive significant revenue. We reward editors whose work directly contributes to our growth. Top-performing creatives can earn you $50-$200+ in bonuses per winning ad. This means your actual earnings can be significantly higher than base rate when you consistently create high-converting content.



About Us

We are a rapidly scaling skincare e-commerce brand targeting women 45-65+. We're running paid ads on Meta, Youtube, and other platforms and need a skilled video editor to create high-converting ad content that drives conversions.



Your responsibilities include:

Content Types:

/Instagram ads (testimonial style, product demos, before/after transformations)

Requirements

- At least 1 year of experience in video editing, particularly for social media platforms 
, TikTok, Instagram)

- Demonstrated experience creating dynamic videos specifically designed for direct-response advertising

- Strong proficiency in video editing software (Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or DaVinci Resolve)

- Proven ability to optimize video content for maximum engagement and conversion

- Ability to source own content - B-roll, stock footage, graphics, and visual assets creatively

- Portfolio showing
/TikTok ad examples (REQUIRED to apply)

Bonus Skills (Not Required But Valued)

- Experience editing for beauty/skincare/health/wellness brands

- AI content generation skills - Using tools like Sora, Veo 3.1, Kling or other AI video/image tools

- Motion graphics and text animation skills

- Experience with hook testing and ad variation creation

- Understanding of Meta Ads Manager and TikTok Ads best practices

- Video Sales Letter (VSL) editing experience

Qualities We're Looking For:

- Quick responsiveness - Fast turnaround times and prompt communication

- Strong eagerness to learn - Stays current with trends and platform changes

Growth Opportunities

How to Apply

title: Administrative Assistant / SketchUp Shade Design Specialist
description:
Job Title: Administrative Assistant / SketchUp Shade Design Specialist

Company: Sun Valley Shades



Sun Valley Shades designs and installs high-quality shade solutions for residential and commercial clients. We are looking for a dependable, organized tea
mber who is also a high-level SketchUp designer to create shade structure designs for client proposals.



This position is a mix of office administration + design work, but SketchUp is the #1 priority and most important skill.



Position Overview



The primary responsibility of this role is producing professional SketchUp designs for shade structures and outdoor shade solutions that will be used in customer proposals and presentations.



When SketchUp work is lighter, this position will assist with inbox management and support the daily operations of the business.

s, responding when needed, flagging priorities)

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Strong organization and communication skills
