title: Short-Form Video Editor for US-Based Health Creator Part-Time to Full-Time
description:
Hi! I’m Dr. Eileen, an acupuncturist and content creator based in the USA. My 
 has 900K+ followers and I’m reviving a cold account/returning to consistent content creation. I need a reliable, skilled video editor to help me produce 3–5 short-form reels per week. I’ve been editing my own content up until now, but I am a full time new mom and clinician so I don't have a lot of time anymore. I know exactly what I want — I just need someone to execute faster than I can now.



I’m looking for someone long-term — not a one-off gig. If you’re reliable, creative, and understand pacing, we’ll work well together. 



Your responsibilities:

• Edit talking head reels (cuts, captions, music, pacing)

• Edit demo reels (acupressure/gua sha techniques — close-ups, zooms, text callouts)

• Create B-roll + voiceover reels (stitch clinic footage, demo with my narration)

• Create simple text-led reels (text overlay + trending audio)

• Design carousel slides in Canva



Must-haves:

• Experience editing short-form vertical video (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts). 

• Strong understanding of hook pacing and retention

• Clean caption/subtitle styling

• Good music/sound selection instincts

• Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

• Reliable communication via WhatsApp, Slack, or Google Chat

• Can deliver within 48–72 hours per reel

• Consistent internet and ability to upload/download large files



Nice-to-haves:

- Experience with health, wellness, or educational content creators

- Canva skills for carousels

- An understanding of IG/TikTok trends and algorithm

- Would also love to hire for long form content for Youtube when I get there!

-Familiarity with Notion or other task management platforms (Notion is where I script and brain dump)



Volume:

• Month 1: ~12+ reels/month (about x3-5 videos/week)

• Month 2+: ~20 reels/month (goal is to consistently landing at 5 videos/week)

• Potential to grow into full-time with additional platforms (YouTube long-form, etc.)



How to Apply/Please send me:

1. A link to 2–3 short-form reels you’ve edited (health/wellness preferred, but educational content works too)

2. Your monthly rate expectation (full transparency, I like to do a trial week before we scale)

3. Your editing software of choice (I mainly use capcut)

4. A brief note on why you’d be a good fit

5. A few suggestions on how you operate, where to land RAW files, and how I should film/organize so that it will help both of us to be efficient

6. How often are we communicating (I operate in real-time unless I'm with my family or with patients)

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) for Modern Media Agency
description:
We are Cropt, a high-end media agency helping businesses scale through elite promotional videos and creative ad carousels. We are looking for a hungry, persistent, and organized SDR to be the "engine" of our growth. You won't just be calling names on a list; you will be identifying the right businesses, finding the decision-makers, and booking high-value meetings.



What You’ll Do

Strategic Research: Build your own daily lead lists of businesses (gyms, real estate, retail) that are missing high-quality video content.



High-Volume Outreach: Make 40–60 outbound calls and send personalized follow-up
s/DMs daily.



Lead Qualification: Use our "Pain Point" checklist to ensure you are only booking meetings with businesses that have the budget and need for our services.



Pipeline Management: Maintain a clean CRM to track every conversation and follow-up.



Required Skills

Elite Communication: Near-native English with a confident, neutral accent.



Grit: You handle "No" with a smile and know that it takes an average of 5+ follow-ups to get a "Yes".



Self-Starter: You don't need a boss breathing down your neck to find leads and hit your numbers.



Experience: At least 1–2 years in outbound sales, cold calling, or appointment setting.



Why Join Cropt?

Competitive Base + Performance Bonuses: We reward results. If you book a meeting that closes, you get paid a significant success fee.



Modern Agency Vibe: We aren't a corporate dinosaur. We are fast-paced, creative, and value your input on our sales playbook.



Growth Potential: We are a startup. As we grow, the people who helped us get there will have opportunities to lead the sales team.



Send a voice recording (Vocaroo or Loom) introducing yourself and telling us about your biggest "win" in cold calling.

title: MEDIA BUYER LEAD GEN
description:
Performance Media Buyer - Medspa Lead Generation

Remote (Philippines-based) | $1,500-2,500/month base + performance bonuses

About the Role

We're scaling our medspa marketing agency to $100K/month and need a media buyer who understands that leads mean nothing if they don't book appointments.

You'll manage Meta ad campaigns for 5-8 medspa clients (starting with 2-3 during onboarding), working closely with our appointment-setting team to optimize the entire funnel from click to booked call.

What Success Looks Like



Month 1-2: Takeover existing campaigns, maintain current performance while learning client goals

Month 3-4: Improve booking rates by 15-20% through funnel optimization

Month 6+: Own 6-8 clients independently, contributing to agency growth targets



Core Responsibilities (70% of your time)



Launch and optimize Meta ad campaigns focused on appointment bookings, not just leads

Monitor daily performance: CPL, CPA, booking rates, and lead quality metrics

A/B test ad copy, creatives, audiences, and offers based on what actually converts downstream

Weekly collaboration with appointment setters to understand which leads book and why



Funnel Optimization (20% of your time)



Build and edit landing pages in GoHighLevel (we'll train you on our templates)

Set up tracking pixels and UTM parameters to measure full-funnel performance

Identify conversion bottlenecks between ad click ? landing page ? booked appointment



Creative Support (10% of your time)



Make basic edits to ad graphics in Canva

Trim/edit short-form video ads using simple tools (CapCut or similar)

Collaborate with our creative team on high-performing ad concepts



You're a Strong Fit If:



You've run Meta lead gen campaigns where you were accountable for appointment bookings or sales calls (not just e-commerce or brand awareness)

You understand why a $30 lead that books 50% is better than a $15 lead that ghosts

You're comfortable with GoHighLevel or similar funnel builders (or excited to learn)

You can set up
 Pixel tracking without needing a developer

You've worked with appointment setters or call centers and understand lead quality issues

You're available during 8am-12pm EST overlap for team collaboration



Bonus Points For:



Experience with local service businesses (medspa, dental, home services, med spas, aesthetics)

Background at a lead gen agency (not just in-house or freelance)

Familiarity with direct response marketing principles

Managed multiple clients simultaneously



What We Offer

Compensation:



Base: $1,500-2,500/month (based on experience)

Performance bonuses: uncapped based on client booking targets

Realistic total comp: $3,500-4,500/month



Growth Path:



Month 6: Senior Media Buyer ($3,500-4,500 base)

Month 12: Lead Media Buyer managing junior buyers ($5,000+ base)



Work Environment:



Remote-first team

Core hours: 8am-12pm EST overlap required, flexible otherwise

Monthly 1-on-1 career development calls

Access to premium training resources (we invest in your skills)



What We Don't Need



Someone who only knows how to duplicate campaigns without understanding the strategy

Media buyers who've only run e-commerce or brand awareness campaigns

People who think "I delivered leads" is enough without caring if they converted



Our Clients

We work exclusively with medspas and aesthetic clinics across the US, helping them fill their calendars with qualified consultation bookings for services like Botox, fillers, body contouring, and skin treatments.

Average client ad spend: $1,500-2,000/month

Current agency ad spend: ~$45,000/month across 30 clients

Your initial portfolio: 2-3 clients, scaling to 6-8 within 6 months



How to Apply



Visit: 
/mbs

title: Help Wanted: Easy Virtual Assistant Role

title: Video Editor – YouTube (Business Content) Part-Time
description:
Looking for a LONG TERM Editor. 



----> Key Responsibilities



Edit YouTube videos with basic editing. 



My content is talking head, education type of videos. So I do a mix of screensharing and speaking just myself in front of a camera. More demonstration/tutorial type of content. Specifically Amazon FBA Business related.



I am looking to grow my YouTube specifically for business. So all content will be purposeful and each video will target our Ideal audience for that type of content. Some videos will be tailored toward beginner's looking to get started, others tailor towards experienced sellers who need assistance scaling their company. 





Editing Responsibilities:





- Clean cuts



- Removing mistakes / dead space



- Basic pacing and flow



- Some graphical edits/transitions (very minimal)





Create thumbnails:





- Clear text



- Clean layout with background and my face in the thumbnail



- No advanced design required. I will provide examples if accepted.





Expectations:





- Deliver edits within a 24–48 hour turnaround.



- Communicate clearly and meet deadlines consistently.





As you grow, assist with:





- Increased video volume



- Repurposing content into short-form clips or creating new content via short form (later)













----> What We’re Looking For





- Coachable, reliable, and open to feedback.



- Strong attention to detail.



- Follows a clear process while expressing skill/creativity. 



- Basic familiarity with video editing software (ex. Capcut)



- Basic familiarity with Canva or another web design software. 



- Reliable internet and clear communication.





You do not need to be an advanced editor — this role is primarily execution-focused.









----> COMPENSATION





- $225 USD per month



- Covers a minimum of 3 YouTube videos per week. No more than 4 max. Additional videos will create increased pay opportunities. 



- Basic editing scope



- Opportunity to increase pay as output and responsibilities grow





This is a part-time, long-term role. You will be our go-to editor.







----> PERKS





- Flexible schedule within deadlines. I will notify ahead of time when I plan to create videos, to give you time to prepare. 



- Clear expectations and structured workflow.



- Paid training and feedback.



- Long-term opportunity as the channel grows.



- Future pay increases based on volume and performance.









----> How to Apply





- Video Intro (1–2 minutes):

 Introduce yourself and briefly explain:



Any editing experience you have. Short form, long form, etc. Also what type of content have you worked with.



Why this role interests you





- Resume: Attach your most recent resume.





- Editing Software:

 List the editing software you are most comfortable using at the end of your application.





- Favorite Color (Share at the end of Application)





!!! Only applicants who follow all four steps will be considered.

title: Business Manager
description:
Operations assistant — StressKnotNYC

Location: Remote (U.S. time zones preferred)

Schedule: 5days/week coverage (rotational shifts)

Compensation: Competitive base + performance incentives (details shared with finalists)



StressKnotNYC is not a “massage company.”

We are a premium, mobile wellness and recovery brand built in New York City, serving high-performing professionals, executives, hotels, and corporate clients who expect five-star experiences every time.



Our promise is simple but non-negotiable:

Right practitioner. Right time. Five-star execution. Zero excuses.



We operate in a fast-paced environment where:



Clients expect immediate responses

Same-day bookings are common

Therapist dispatch is mission-critical

Every lead matters

Every interaction reflects the brand



We are building systems that scale — and we are looking for an elite Operations Manager who can run the engine, convert leads, and own outcomes.



THIS IS NOT A “TASK” ROLE

This role is for someone who:



Thinks in systems and outcomes, not checklists

Understands that operations = revenue protection + revenue growth

Is calm under pressure, decisive, and proactive

Treats every inbound lead like money on the table

If you are someone who needs constant direction, avoids accountability, or is uncomfortable with urgency — this role is not for you.



CORE MISSION OF THE ROLE



The Operations Manager is responsible for ensuring that every inbound inquiry is handled quickly, professionally, and converted at the highest possible rate, while maintaining seamless day-to-day operations.



Your job is to:

Protect revenue

Increase conversion

Eliminate operational friction

Ensure five-star delivery every single day



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Lead Management & Conversion (Top Priority)

You are the first line of revenue defense.

Answer inbound calls, texts,
s, and website inquiries promptly

Respond with confidence, warmth, and authority

Qualify leads and guide them to booking — not just “answer questions”

Handle objections calmly (pricing, availability, same-day requests, therapist preferences)

Follow up relentlessly but professionally until a clear yes or no

Understand that speed + clarity + confidence = conversions

You are expected to think like a closer, even if a deal is escalated.



2. Scheduling, Dispatch & Fulfillment

Assign the right therapist or practitioner based on:

Client needs

Location

Availability

Gender preferences (when requested)

Handle same-day and last-minute bookings without panic

Communicate clearly with therapists and clients

Ensure sessions are confirmed, executed, and followed up properly

Anticipate issues before they become problems



3. Therapist & Practitioner Coordination

Support therapist onboarding and interview scheduling

Maintain therapist availability and responsiveness

Act as a professional point of contact for practitioners

Ensure therapists follow brand standards and protocols

Communicate expectations clearly and respectfully



4. Client Experience & Retention

Deliver white-glove customer service at every touchpoint

Manage reschedules, cancellations, refunds, and credits professionally

Proactively request 5-star reviews after positive experiences

Ensure post-session follow-ups are completed

Identify opportunities to upsell, rebook, or retain clients



5. Systems, SOPs & Accountability

Follow existing SOPs precisely

Help identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies

Track daily KPIs including:

Inbound leads

Bookings

Conversion rate

Missed calls

Reviews requested/received

Maintain clean records in CRM and internal tools

Operate with ownership — not excuses



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

A successful Operations Manager at StressKnotNYC:

Converts leads consistently and confidently

Keeps operations running smoothly even on busy days

Handles pressure without emotional reactivity

Communicates clearly, professionally, and proactively

Anticipates needs instead of reacting late

Treats the business as if it were their own



NON-NEGOTIABLE QUALITIES (READ CAREFULLY)

We are only interested in candidates who demonstrate:

Extreme ownership — no blame, no deflection

Strong communication skills (spoken & written English)

Sales-oriented mindset (you understand conversion)

High urgency + high standards

Emotional maturity under pressure

Ability to follow systems while improving them

Reliability — you show up, every day, without chasing





WHO THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR



This role is not for:

Task-takers who wait for instructions

People who avoid phone calls

Candidates who struggle with urgency or accountability

Anyone uncomfortable with sales-adjacent responsibilities

People who disappear, miss shifts, or need micromanagement



WHY JOIN STRESSKNOTNYC



You will work directly with the founder

You will have real ownership and impact

You will be part of a brand scaling toward national expansion

Your performance directly influences growth and opportunity

This is a long-term role for the right person



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)



To apply, you must submit:

A short voice or video intro explaining why you believe operations = revenue

Your resume



Candidates who do not follow instructions will not be considered.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
NOTE: Only applications that follow the instructions will be reviewed, so please make sure to include everything listed. 



Are you a creative strategist who lives and breathes social media and paid ads?

We’re looking for a Social Media Manager with at least 2 years of experience who can take our online presence and ad performance to the next level—from strategy to execution.



What You’ll Do:

1. Develop and implement social media strategies aligned with brand and business goals.

2. Create weekly content and ad plans that combine creativity, storytelling, and performance.

3, Set up, manage, and optimize Meta Ads 
 & Instagram) and Google Ads campaigns to drive leads, sales, and brand awareness.

4. Write strong ad copy and captions that convert, test variations, and improve CTR and conversions.

5. Design engaging visuals using Canva (bonus if you know Figma or Adobe tools).

6. Create engaging Reels and short-form video content for various platforms.

7. Track, interpret, and optimize social media and ad metrics to improve reach, engagement, and ROI.

8. Stay updated on the latest platform updates, ad policies, trends, and audience behavior.



What We’re Looking For:

- At least 2 years of experience managing social media and/or paid ads for brands or agencies.

- Hands-on experience running Meta Ads and Google Ads (campaign setup, audience targeting, budgeting, A/B testing, reporting).

- Strong understanding of
, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, and other major platforms.

- Excellent written and spoken English communication skills.

- Confident in content planning, ad copywriting, and basic design.

- Knowledgeable in social media and ads analytics and performance tracking (e.g., Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads, basic Google Analytics).

- Willing to work during US hours (PST) and maintain responsiveness during these times.

- Creative, proactive, and reliable team player with strong attention to detail.



Why Join Us:

- 100% remote work with a supportive and creative team.

- Opportunity to lead social and ad campaigns, experiment with new ideas, and grow your portfolio.



Application Process:

1. Send your resume, sample work, and portfolio to 
 with the subject line: “Social Media Manager – [Your Name]”

2. If you qualify, you’ll be invited to complete a trial task as part of the hiring process.



Note: This trial task is a generic test designed to evaluate your skills. It will not be used for any purpose aside from skill evaluation.

title: Talent Acquisition & Strategic Recruitment Manager
description:
The Talent Acquisition & Strategic Recruitment Manager is responsible for proactively identifying, recruiting, and securing top-tier talent across the business.



This is not a passive recruiting role.

You are expected to hunt, headhunt, and build pipelines for:

Licensed massage therapists (priority: female and senior practitioners)

Acupuncturists and recovery specialists

Key operational, sales, and growth roles as the company scales



You work closely with leadership to ensure talent never becomes the bottleneck to growth.



Core Responsibilities

Strategic Talent Acquisition

Proactively source and headhunt talent through outreach, referrals, and direct engagement

Build pipelines for current and future hiring needs

Recruit both practitioners and internal tea
mbers as required

Adapt recruiting strategy as business priorities evolve



Practitioner Recruitment (High Priority)

Recruit licensed massage therapists with an emphasis on reliability, professionalism, and client presence

Source female therapists and senior practitioners where demand requires

Recruit licensed acupuncturists and advanced recovery professionals

Verify licenses, credentials, and compliance requirements



Operational & Growth Hiring

Recruit for operations, dispatch, sales, and support roles as needed

Assist leadership in defining role requirements before hiring

Screen for communication skills, ownership, and execution ability



Vetting, Onboarding & Quality Control

Conduct screening calls and interviews

Ensure candidates align with StressKnotNYC’s standards and values

Support onboarding handoffs with Operations

Remove or replace underperforming talent when necessary



What Success Looks Like

Talent pipelines exist before demand spikes

Female therapist availability improves consistently

Acupuncturist and specialist coverage expands

Operations and sales roles are filled quickly with high-quality candidates

Hiring no longer slows growth



KPIs (Non-Negotiable)

Roles filled per month

Practitioner availability coverage

Time-to-hire

Retention of recruited talent

Hiring quality (measured by performance feedback)



Who This Role Is For

A proactive recruiter or headhunter

Someone who thrives on outreach and relationship-building

Comfortable recruiting across multiple disciplines

Able to pivot quickly as priorities change

Confident communicating with licensed professionals and executives



What This Role Is NOT

Not a job-posting-only recruiter

Not HR administration

Not volume hiring without standards



This is a strategic growth role.

Compensation

Contract-based with performance incentives

Pay tied to successful placements and outcomes

Long-term growth opportunity as the company scales



(Details discussed during interview.)



How to Apply

To apply, please submit:

Your resume 



A short written response explaining:

Your experience sourcing or headhunting talent

How you approach recruiting for hard-to-fill roles



A short voice recording (1–2 minutes) answering:

Introduce yourself

Describe how you would recruit high-quality practitioners or operators for a premium brand

Applications without a voice recording will not be considered.



Growth Path

This role can evolve into:

Head of Talent & Network Expansion

Director of People & Practitioner Strategy

title: Human Resources Officer
description:
Job Title: Human Resources (HR) Generalist

Shift: US Pacific Time (Flexible Workload)

No. hours per week: 30 hours per week (can be 40 if you're trustworthy)

Work Setup: Remote

Experience: 3+ years in Human Resources



PLEASE READ FIRST



We are hiring a strategic and adaptable HR Generalist who moves with workload cycles, not just scheduled hours online. Some shifts will be intense during recruitment peaks and payroll runs. Other shifts will be quiet. 



NOTE: WE DON'T US TIME TRACKERS



We don’t pay someone to idle or clock in like a security guard watching a post. We need someone who learns demand patterns and adjusts output flexibly. 



The last HR people we worked with were very rigid with their time. They refused to be flexible and insisted on a fixed 8-hour schedule, even when there were no tasks. Some of those hours were spent sleeping or idling instead of working, which didn’t align with how this role operates.



What You’ll Do

- Lead full-cycle recruitment for internal roles and Virtual Assistants

- Audit contractor logged hours and validate them before payroll and billing

- Process payroll cycles accurately and confidentially

- Conduct one-on-one check-ins focused on performance, accountability, and well-being

- Manage onboarding, orientation, and HR documentation for new hires and contractors

- Organize engagement and culture-building activities to boost morale and retention

- Cross-check schedules, tracked hours, and expected workload patterns for alignment

- Protect all confidential HR and payroll information with strict discretion



What We’re Looking For

- 3+ years of HR experience, with strong recruitment exposure

- Payroll processing and contractor hours auditing background

- Ability to adapt to fluctuating workloads and graveyard operations

- High ownership mindset and pattern-based scheduling awareness

- Strong confidentiality practices and secure data handling

- Independent execution without micromanagement



This Role Is NOT For

- Attendance-first workers who expect to be paid to idle

- Presence-based mindset professionals (we value output over online time)

- Guard-post mentality applicants



For interested applicants, please
: 
 will not entertain applicants who will not send
.

Please include your resume and use the subject: Human Resources Applicants

title: Executive Personal Assistant
description:
We're seeking an exceptional Executive Personal Assistant to support the CEO of two growing companies: a multi-office law firm and a SaaS software company. This is a high-trust, high-impact role for someone who thrives on variety, takes pride in flawless execution, and wants to grow alongside a dynamic leader.



You'll be the CEO's right hand across both businesses and personal matters—managing calendars, coordinating communications, supporting software testing, handling research, and tackling whatever comes next. No two days will look the same, and that's exactly what makes this role exciting.



This position is ideal for someone who is sharp, proactive, and genuinely enjoys making someone else's life easier while building real skills across legal operations, SaaS, and executive support.



What You'll Do

Executive & Administrative Support



Manage complex calendars with zero errors—scheduling, rescheduling, and anticipating conflicts before they happen

Handle
 correspondence, prioritize communications, and draft responses on behalf of the CEO

Coordinate travel, meetings, and personal appointments

Serve as a gatekeeper and liaison for internal teams and external contacts



Software & SaaS Operations



Learn and support the CEO's software company operations

Assist with product testing, including end-to-end QA testing

Help set up and manage testing tools (e.g., BugBug)

Troubleshoot issues, document bugs, and communicate with development teams

Navigate CRMs, dashboards, and project management tools with ease



General Support



Handle research projects across legal, software, and personal topics

Support marketing and administrative tasks as needed (Canva, Meta Suite, content scheduling)

Take on personal tasks to keep the CEO's life running smoothly

Represent the CEO professionally on video calls when required





Who You Are



Polished & Professional — How you appear and sound on camera matters a great deal as you are a reflection of your employer. The greater your appeal and clarity, the more likely you are a good fit for this role. 

Obsessively Detail-Oriented — You catch what others miss. Errors aren't in your vocabulary

Trustworthy & Discreet — You'll have access to sensitive information across a law firm, a tech company, and personal matters. Confidentiality is non-negotiable

A Quick Study — You pick things up fast. Whether it's a new tool, a new process, or a new industry, you figure it out

Proactive & Resourceful — You solve problems before they become problems. You don't wait to be told what to do

Reliable to the Core — You show up. Every day. Every task. No excuses

Emotionally Intelligent — You navigate complex interactions with grace and know how to read a room (even a virtual one)





Requirements



Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or Executive Assistant supporting entrepreneurs, executives, or high-profile clients

Strong English communication skills—written and verbal (you'll be drafting
s, joining calls, and representing the CEO)

Experience with or strong interest in SaaS products and software operations

Technical fluency: Google Workspace, CRMs, project management tools, Canva, analytics dashboards

Reliable high-speed internet and a professional home office setup

Availability during agreed-upon hours via Slack and WhatsApp

Webcam-ready setup for video calls





Nice to Have



Experience in legal operations, law firms, or legal tech

Familiarity with QA testing, bug tracking, or software development workflows

Background supporting founders or CEOs of multiple businesses





How to Apply

If you're serious about this position, create a short Loom video (1–3 minutes) introducing yourself. In your video, explain:



Why you're a strong fit for this role

How you'd contribute to this position

How this role fits into your long-term career plans



Applications without a Loom video will not be considered.



This is a role for someone who wants to be indispensable. If that's you, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Senior Local SEO Specialist
description:
Senior SEO Specialist – Full-Time + Remote



$1,300-1,800/month base + $100-$500/month performance bonus



About Us



We're a fast-growing SEO agency helping local service businesses dominate search results. Our team is small, sharp, and results-driven. We value clear communication and extreme ownership. We stay ahead of our industry with heavy investment in AI systems. We're US-based, serving US clients exclusively.



About the Role



We're hiring a full-time contract SEO specialist (4–5+ years of experience) to own 6-12 local SEO client campaigns end to end. You'll manage strategy (alongside the team lead), execution, reporting, and client deliverables - with autonomy over how you manage your time and make decisions.



This isn't just a task-completion role. Our clients are real business owners whose livelihoods depend on results. We need someone who feels the weight of that and operates accordingly: flagging issues early, bringing solutions, and keeping campaigns moving forward without being asked. You'll earn performance bonuses tied directly to problem solving and client retention.



What You'll Do



- Manage the full SEO lifecycle for 6–12 clients

- Run comprehensive audits: technical, local, content, backlink, etc

- Conduct keyword research and execute on-page, technical, local, and content SEO strategies

- Optimize Google Business Profiles

- Configure and manage GA4, GSC, and GTM

- Track performance, send weekly internal updates, and build monthly client reports

- Use AI tools to streamline workflows, solve problems independently, and contribute to internal automation projects



Required Qualifications



- 4-5+ years managing local SEO campaigns with proven results

- Experience managing multiple client accounts simultaneously

- Strong knowledge of local SEO (Map Pack, GBP optimization) and organic SEO

- Comfortable with basic HTML/CSS and writing technical SEO guidelines

- Hands-on experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) for research, content, troubleshooting, and/or automation

- Familiarity with core SEO tools: GA4, GSC, GTM, Ahrefs or SEMrush, Screaming Frog, and local SEO tools (Local Dominator, Local Falcon, or similar)

- Native English proficiency

- Reliable high-speed internet



Who You Are



- Accountable - You see tasks through and own the outcome, good or bad

- Self-managed - You deliver quality work consistently without needing oversight

- Proactive - You surface updates, flag risks, and solve problems before they escalate

- Results-focused - You care about what the work produces, not just checking boxes

- AI-forward - You already use AI in your daily work and are excited to push further

- Collaborative - You share knowledge openly, take feedback well, and leave ego at the door



What We Offer



- Compensation: $1,300–$1,800/month USD base (based on experience) + $100-$500/month performance bonuses tied to campaign health and client retention

- Employment type: Full-time independent contractor

- Schedule: CST business hours

- Location: 100% remote

- Growth: Clear path to Senior Lead or Team Manager as we scale

- Learning: Paid access to training resources and industry consultants



How to Apply



Submit the following to 



- Resume

- 2-3 case studies with specific metrics (map rankings, organic traffic, leads generated, etc.)

- A 2 minute video (YouTube, Loom, or similar) answering:

---> What's your name?

---> What motivates you in your life? (Be honest)

---> What's the coolest result you've driven with SEO?

---> Why are you a good fit for this role?



Do NOT just read off of AI please.



No video = automatic pass. We use this to assess communication skills and personality fit — keep it casual.

title: AI Automation Specialist (WhatsApp & Chat Automation)
description:
About the Role



We are hiring a solid AI Automation Specialist to own and maintain our AI-powered WhatsApp and chat automation system.



This role focuses on designing, maintaining, and optimising AI-assisted chat workflows that handle customer enquiries, bookings, and routing — replacing and supporting human customer service operations.



This is not a software engineering role and not AI research.

It is a logic-driven automation and operations role.



What You Will Do



You will be the primary owner of our AI chat automation.



Core Responsibilities



Design and maintain chat automation workflows



Configure AI responses, prompts, and guardrails



Build multi-step logic for enquiries, bookings, and routing



Handle intent detection and escalation to human agents



Test edge cases (unclear intent, wrong info, user changes mind)



Monitor live conversations and optimise performance



Maintain clear documentation of workflows and rules



You Will NOT



Write backend or frontend code



Train AI models



Build websites or mobile apps



Do machine learning or data science



Required Skills (Must-Have)



We are looking for someone solid and experienced, not entry-level.



You should have experience in some of the following:



WhatsApp or chat automation platforms



Chatbot or CRM automation workflows



Designing logic-based conversation flows



Prompt writing with clear rules and boundaries



Handling human handover and exception cases



Strong logical thinking and attention to detail



Good documentation habits



Nice to Have (Not Mandatory)



Experience with automation tools (Zapier, Make, etc.)



Basic understanding of webhooks or APIs



Experience supporting or replacing customer service teams



Operations or process-improvement background



What We Care About (Very Important)



We care more about thinking and reliability than buzzwords.



You should be able to explain:



What an AI chat should do when it is unsure



When automation should stop and escalate to a human



How to prevent wrong replies or wrong bookings



Salary & Work Arrangement



Salary: USD 800– 1,000 / month (based on experience)



Location: Philippines (remote, home-based)



Working hours: Aligned with Singapore time (GMT+8)



Employment: Full-time, long-term



Why This Role Is Different



You own the automation logic



Your work directly impacts operations and revenue



Stable, long-term role (not freelance or project-based)



Clear scope — no random tech tasks



Application Instructions (Mandatory)



To apply, please include:



A short description of your experience with chat or workflow automation



ONE example of a workflow you built

(describe the logic and decision flow, no screenshots needed)



Answer this question:

“What should an AI chat do when it does not fully understand the user’s intent?”



Applications that do not follow the above will not be considered.



Final Note (Filters the Right Candidates)



This role is not for beginners and not for programmers.

It is for someone who enjoys building reliable automation systems and thinking through real-world customer scenarios.

title: AI Image & Video Generation Expert
description:
We are seeking a visionary architect of the digital age—someone whose imagination outpaces the tools they use. You don't just execute on a brief; you expand it, bringing a rare blend of creative intuition and conceptual depth to every frame



We can start you as part-time, then transition to a full-time role in our growing Company. 



1. Next-Gen Visual Production

Hyper-Realistic Mastery: Elevate AI beyond the uncanny valley. You’ll craft product imagery so crisp and textured it rivals $50k studio shoots, with an obsessive eye for light physics and material depth.



Cinematic Motion: Defy the "AI look." Using Veo 3.1, you’ll produce organic, human-centric video—from high-fashion lifestyle spots to high-converting UGC—where every frame feels intentional and cinematic.



The Power Stack: Command a sophisticated workflow centered on Nano Banana Pro, pushing the limits of the model to squeeze out every drop of fidelity and realism.



2. Brand Logic & Aesthetic Continuity

The Style Chameleon: Master the art of the "visual echo." You can reverse-engineer any aesthetic—be it moody noir or airy luxury—and replicate it with 100% precision across entire campaigns.



Luxury Stewardship: Act as the ultimate gatekeeper of brand DNA. You ensure every pixel breathes "premium," maintaining a seamless visual flow that builds deep consumer trust.



AI Art Direction: You aren't just a prompt engineer; you’re a digital auteur. You apply high-level art direction to ensure AI outputs meet the rigorous standards of global luxury brands.



3. Viral Innovation & UGC Strategy

Concept to Conversion: Transform raw ideas into scroll-stopping visual narratives. You don’t just "make content"; you build visual experiences that align with strategic business goals.



The UGC Edge: Bridge the gap between "polished" and "authentic." You’ll engineer high-performing UGC that feels raw and relatable but remains sophisticated enough for a premium brand’s feed.



4. Elite Post-Production & Scalability

The Final Polish: Use a master’s touch in post-production to scrub away artifacts and add that final 5% of "magic" that makes AI content indistinguishable from reality.



Future-Proof Workflows: Design the blueprints for scale. You’ll build repeatable, high-velocity pipelines that maintain rigorous quality control without sacrificing creative soul.

title: CRO Specialist
description:
About LUCYD:

At LUCYD, we’re transforming the world of digital advertising with a focus on wellness, sustainability, and social responsibility. We specialize in compliant advertising for CBD, cannabis, and DTC wellness brands, and we're not just selling products—we're creating positive impact through Conscious Compounds™.



We’re looking for a Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist, with a specific focus on landing pages, to join our marketing team. Your main role will be to design, optimize, and analyze landing pages that drive paid social ad performance and increase eCommerce conversions. Add the word "expedition" on your subject line to let us know you read the whole post.



Responsibilities:

Lead Landing Page Strategy: Own the landing page process—from wireframing to writing compelling copy and gathering visual assets

Collaborate with Designers & Developers: Ensure every page is visually stunning and built for high conversion

A/B Testing & Performance Analysis: Analyze data to continuously test and refine landing pages

Funnel Optimization: Audit the full eCommerce funnel and recommend improvements to boost performance



You MUST have the following qualifications:

3+ years of experience in CRO with focus on landing pages & eCommerce funnels

Proficient in Shopify, wireframing tools, and platforms like Unbounce, Leadpages, or similar

Strong analytical skills using Google Analytics, Hotjar, or similar tools

Excellent English communication skills (C1 Advanced level or Native)

Highly collaborative and detail-oriented

Must be available to work Eastern Time (EST/EDT) hours



If you believe you’re the right fit for this role, we’d love to hear from you. Send your portfolio, resume, and a short note about why you’re a great fit. Only applicants who follow all instructions and meet the qualifications will be considered.

We look forward to working with you!

title: Junior Creative Strategist For eCom Jewelry Brand
description:
Join the team building the world’s best Cuban Link chain for everyday life. 



We’re looking for people who take ownership, move fast, and want their work to actually mean something.



At BALANZI, you’ll help build the #1 destination for Cuban Links by turning ideas into execution; supporting the systems, creatives, and processes that power our growth. 



Start here (required): 
 



Watch this short video from the founders about BALANZI, our mission, and how we work. 



Role Overview 



- Role: Creative Executor (Junior) 

- Location: Fully remote

- Schedule: You pick the hours where you perform best

- Compensation: Determined after trial



We’re looking for a Creative Executor who owns the full day-to-day flow of creative execution, from raw footage intake to editor-ready assets.



You’ll work closely with one of our co-founders to break down footage, organize assets, prepare editor requests, manage revisions, and keep creative production moving fast and clean.



This is an execution-first role by design. You learn strategy by doing the work, spotting patterns, and understanding what actually performs, not by sitting on the sidelines.



If you consistently execute with speed, attention to detail, and sound judgment, this role is the foundation for growing into a 

Creative Strategist position.



Who This Is Really For



- You thrive in high standards

- You take REAL ownership 

- You learn fast and figure things out

- You perform best when the stakes are real 

- You care about building something meaningful 

- You’re willing to get your hands dirty to move the mission forward



Our Core Values



The right person for this role will connect deeply with our values, live them daily, and understand why they’re essential for building something great.



1. No Compromises – You never compromise on anything, from product to customer experience.

2. Ultimate Perseverance – You don’t stop. The challenge doesn’t matter; there’s always a solution to a problem. 

3. Extreme Ownership – You take full ownership. You care about the details and deliver work you’re proud to put your name on.



If these values don’t feel like a natural fit, please do not apply. 



Main Responsibilities: 



- Own the full intake, review, and breakdown of all raw creative assets across customers, creators, partners, and internal shoots, ensuring no footage is wasted 



- Break down every raw file into deployable components including hooks, talking heads, B-roll, and standalone raw ads, with full timestamping and context tagging 



- Maintain and update shared B-roll, hooks, and talking-head banks, ensuring assets are categorized by format, intent, tone, and use case 



- Assign the best-fit assets to scripts and angles provided by the Creative Strategist, flagging gaps where new footage is required 



- Act as the single point of contact for editors by preparing precise editor requests with timestamps, clip order, notes, and clear do/don’t rules 



- Manage first-pass quality control on all edited assets, blocking anything that creates doubt, feels salesy, or breaks BALANZI’s calm, confident tone 



- Organize and maintain a clean creative asset library so footage is reusable across ads, cutdowns, and future campaigns without reshoots 



- Ensure editors are never blocked, creative velocity stays high, and strategy can be executed without friction or delays 



- Offload execution-heavy creative work from the founders and strategist so they can focus on direction, growth, and decision-making  



Prior Experience / Skills



- No experience required

- We're hiring for potential, not experience

- Your performance during the trial is all that matters



About Us 



BALANZI exists to build the world’s best Cuban Link chain for everyday life - so that men can move through life feeling confident, without ever needing to take off their chain or change who they are.



Founded in 2020, we didn’t start with a big mission. We chased money, sold products we didn’t believe in, and eventually realized we hated what we were building. So we scrapped everything and kept only one thing: Cuban Links - the only product our customers truly loved.



Over the last 12 months, we’ve rebuilt BALANZI from the ground up: redesigned products, raised our quality standards, refined our positioning, and committed fully to becoming the #1 destination for Cuban Links.



Today, we’re a small, passionate team focused on excellence, long-term thinking, and building a brand we’re truly proud of; never compromising on product, customer experience, or our team.



Why Work For BALANZI? 



- Your work has real impact, and it will directly shape BALANZI and its future

- You work directly with the founders, not buried under layers of management

- You’ll have real ownership, autonomy, and the ability to move the needle fast

- You’ll grow faster here than in any traditional environment 

- You’ll join a team with high standards, no bureaucracy, and a clear mission we believe in



If this gets you fired up, then click below and apply now.

Thank you for reading and good luck! Sending lots of love! Irish #Believe

title: Digital Operations Manager / Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
ABOUT US



We are a US-based commerce company, the American arm of an established European e-commerce and trading group operating across 29 countries with 650,000+ products across multiple brands in construction, home improvement, sustainability, and premium bath & kitchen.



We are also a US distributor of a European contactless QR-payment solution for churches, nonprofits, and venues.



Our motto: "Do it with Passion or don't do it at all."



We are building a Commerce 4.0 infrastructure with AI-driven automation, and we need a sharp, resourceful person to become the CEO's digital right hand.





THIS IS NOT A TYPICAL VA ROLE



We are looking for someone who thinks like an entrepreneur, not just an assistant. You will co-build operations across the USA and Southeast Asia, manage teams, drive sales, and grow with us into a leadership position. If you want to be part of building something big - this is your opportunity.





YOUR ROLE - SIX KEY AREAS



1. US FINTECH PRODUCT - Sales & Distribution Support

We distribute a European contactless QR-payment solution for churches, zoos, museums, and nonprofits in the US market. We're building the sales infrastructure from scratch - so tell us what tools you've worked with and we'll set it up together.

- Build and maintain lead lists (churches, zoos, museums, nonprofits across the US)

- Set up and manage a CRM pipeline from zero (you recommend the tool, we d
 together)

- Coordinate
 campaigns and follow-ups with our US Managing Partner

- Prepare sales materials, proposals, and demo scheduling

- Research target markets and verticals

As this grows, you'll hire sales support and manage them - so you need to understand the full sales cycle yourself first.



2. VIETNAM & SOUTHEAST ASIA - Team Building

We are building a remote operations team in Southeast Asia (Vietnam and Philippines). You will help recruit, onboard, and coordinate.

- Post job openings on local platforms (VietnamWorks, TopCV, TopDev, OnlineJobs.ph)

- Screen candidates, conduct initial interviews, coordinate with CEO for final decisions

- Set up daily standups, reporting, and project tracking (Slack, Notion, GitHub)

- Act as the bridge between Austrian HQ and the Southeast Asian team

- Help evaluate EOR providers and manage contractor compliance

You'll eventually hand off daily coordination to a local team lead - but first you need to build the processes and understand what good looks like.



3. E-COMMERCE BACKOFFICE & OPERATIONS

Our European parent company operates multiple brands and marketplaces (Amazon, eBay, ManoMano, own webshops). A core priority from Day 1 is launching (or relaunching) our US marketplace channels - Amazon USA, eBay USA, and later Walmart.

- Build, optimize, and launch product listings on Amazon, eBay, and Walmart US

- Develop pricing strategies, fulfillment setup (FBA/FBM), and shipping logistics for the US market

- Marketplace ticket management and customer communication

- Order processing, supplier coordination, shipping tracking

- EPR compliance tracking across European jurisdictions

- Product data management and listing optimization

Once the channels run smoothly, you'll hire dedicated marketplace managers - but you need to have done it yourself to know what "smooth" looks like.



4. AUTOMATION & DIGITAL TOOLS

We automate everything we can. You should be comfortable with modern tools.

- Help build and maintain workflows in n8n (our automation platform)

- Create reports, dashboards, and data summaries

- Manage content calendars for LinkedIn and social media

- Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude) productively for content, research, and analysis

- Document processes and create SOPs for repeatable tasks



5. FINANCE & ACCOUNTING

You take ownership of the financial back office and make sure everything is clean, organized, and transparent.

- Restructure and maintain the bookkeeping system across multiple entities (US and Europe)

- Prepare and track invoices, credit notes, and payment reminders

- Monitor incoming and outgoing payments, reconcile bank accounts

- Coordinate with the external accountant and tax advisor (monthly closings, VAT filings, annual statements)

- Prepare financial summaries and reports for the CEO

- Track expenses, budgets, and profitability per channel and brand

- Ensure compliance with local tax requirements across jurisdictions



6. DIGITAL MARKETING & SOCIAL COMMERCE

Modern e-commerce doesn't work without strong digital presence. You'll build and manage our marketing channels.

- LinkedIn content strategy and posting (for the CEO and company profiles)

- TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube for product marketing and brand building

- AI-generated content creation (using tools like ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney for posts, videos, and ads)

- Influencer marketing and AI influencer strategies

-
 and Instagram Shopping integration

-
 marketing and newsletter campaigns

- SEO basics and performance tracking

- Paid ads coordination (Google Ads, Meta Ads - working with specialists)

You don't need to be a full-time content creator - but you need to understand what works, set the strategy, and eventually hire specialists (content creators, video editors, ad managers) that you can properly manage and evaluate.





WHO YOU ARE



Your Personality:

You are the kind of person who opens their laptop in the morning and already knows what needs to happen today - without being told. You learn new tools over a weekend, not in a training program. When something breaks, you don't wait for instructions - you find a fix, implement it, and then report what you did. You thrive in fast-paced environments where no two days look the same.



You're comfortable making decisions on your own in day-to-day operations (backoffice, tickets, scheduling), but you also know when to check in with the CEO on strategic calls (hiring decisions, client communication, new processes). You're not looking for a 9-to-5 routine - you want to build something and grow with it.



IMPORTANT: THE COORDINATOR MINDSET



Let's be clear about what this role really is. We don't expect you to be a world-class expert in every single area listed below. What we DO expect is that you've done enough of it yourself to truly understand how it works - the pain points, the shortcuts, the quality standards. Why? Because your real job is to build a team around you that handles the specialist work, and you need to be able to tell the difference between great work and garbage. You can only control what you understand. If you've never run an ad campaign, you can't evaluate someone who does it for you. If you've never reconciled a bank account, you won't catch mistakes. We need someone who has been in the trenches, understands the work, and can then hire, train, and manage the people who do it day-to-day. You don't need to be the best at everything - but you need to have done everything at least once.



The Skills That Matter Most:



1. Fast Learner & Tech-Native (Most Important)

This is non-negotiable. Our stack changes, our tools evolve, and we move fast. You pick up a new platform in hours, not weeks. If someone shows you n8n or a new CRM, you're productive within days.



2. High Capacity & Multitasking Under Pressure

You'll manage sales leads in the morning, screen a developer candidate in Southeast Asia before lunch, handle marketplace tickets in the afternoon, and prepare a report for the CEO by evening. You need to context-switch cleanly and keep quality high across all areas.



3. Professional Communication

You write
s that clients and partners take seriously. Your English is flawless - not just grammatically correct, but professional, clear, and appropriate for business contexts in the US and Europe.



4. Initiative & Problem-Solving

When you see a gap, you flag it - or better, you close it. You don't wait to be micromanaged. You suggest improvements, find better ways to do things, and take ownership of outcomes, not just tasks.





HARD SKILLS BY AREA



US Fintech Product / Sales Support:

- CRM setup and management (tell us what you've used - we're building from scratch together) - Required

-
 campaign setup and coordination - Required

- Lead research and list building - Required

- Sales material preparation (decks, proposals) - Nice to have

- Understanding of payment processing / fintech - Nice to have



Southeast Asia Team Building:

- Experience posting jobs and screening candidates (Upwork, OnlineJobs.ph, VietnamWorks) - Required

- Remote team coordination (Slack, Notion, daily standups) - Required

- Experience managing or leading a remote team of 3+ people - Strongly preferred

- Knowledge of EOR/contractor compliance in Southeast Asia - Nice to have



E-Commerce Backoffice:

- Marketplace operations (Amazon Seller Central, eBay) - Required

- Experience launching or building marketplace channels from scratch - Strongly preferred

- Fulfillment knowledge (FBA, FBM, 3PL) - Strongly preferred

- Order management and customer service - Required

- Product data management and listing optimization - Nice to have



Automation & Digital Tools:

- Google Workspace power user (Sheets, Docs, Drive) - Required

- Experience with at least one automation tool (n8n, Zapier, Make) - Strongly preferred

- Comfortable using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude) for content and automation - Required

- Marketing automation 
 sequences, social scheduling) - Nice to have



Digital Marketing & Social Commerce:

- Experience managing social media accounts (LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok, or YouTube) - Required

- Content creation or coordination (posts, short videos, newsletters) - Required

- Understanding of AI content tools (ChatGPT, Midjourney, Canva AI, etc.) - Strongly preferred

- Paid ads experience (Google Ads, Meta Ads) - Nice to have, can hire specialists

- SEO basics and analytics (Google Analytics, Search Console) - Nice to have

- Influencer outreach or partnership management - Nice to have



Finance & Accounting:

- Bookkeeping experience (invoicing, payment tracking, bank reconciliation) - Required

- Experience coordinating with external accountants / tax advisors - Required

- Understanding of multi-entity or multi-country financial structures - Strongly preferred

- Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets for financial reporting - Required

- Knowledge of US and/or European VAT/sales tax basics - Nice to have





YOUR IDEAL BACKGROUND



You're the right person if you come from one of these paths:

- Senior VA / Executive Assistant who managed operations for an e-commerce founder and is ready for a leadership role

- E-commerce Operations Manager from a marketplace seller or D2C brand

- BPO Team Lead / Project Manager who coordinated multiple clients or workstreams

- Startup Operations Generalist who wore many hats and loved it





NON-NEGOTIABLE REQUIREMENTS

- Excellent English (written and spoken) - C1/C2 level

- 3+ years of relevant professional experience

- Available for 4+ hours daily overlap with Central European Time (CET / UTC+1)

- Reliable high-speed internet and professional home office setup

- Based in the Philippines or Vietnam





YOUR GROWTH PATH



Phase 1 - Build the Foundation (Month 1-3)

You and the CEO launch (or relaunch) the US marketplace channels: Amazon USA and eBay USA go live with optimized listings, pricing, and fulfillment. A major priority in this phase is restructuring the entire bookkeeping and financial operations: cleaning up accounts, establishing clear processes for invoicing, payment tracking, and reporting, and setting up a reliable monthly closing workflow with the external accountant. By the end of month 3, the US channels are generating revenue and the financial back office is fully organized and transparent.



Phase 2 - Delegate & Expand (Month 3-6)

With the core channels running, you hire one or more tea
mbers to take over daily marketplace operations and customer service. You expand into additional channels (Walmart, Shopify US) and oversee the new hires. You and the CEO begin building automation workflows together using AI tools and a dedicated developer.



Phase 3 - Launch, Hand Off, Repeat (Month 6-12)

You operate on a 2-month launch cycle: identify a new project, build it, stabilize it, hand it off to your growing team, and move to the next one. You oversee all tea
mbers, ensure quality, and keep the machine running while pushing into new territory. The company begins offering its proven launch and operations expertise as a service to other brands.



Phase 4 - Leadership (Year 2+)

You've built a team, launched multiple projects, and proven you can run operations independently. The conversation shifts to COO, Country Manager, or equity participation.



WHAT WE OFFER

- Competitive base salary (discussed during interview)

- Performance-based bonus structure tied to company revenue and project success

- Clear growth path from Operations Manager to leadership (COO / Country Manager)

- Direct access to the CEO - no middle management, no bureaucracy

- The opportunity to build something real from the ground up





HOW TO APPLY



Send us:

1. Your CV/Resume (English)

2. A short cover letter (max 1 page): Why this role? What's your superpower?

3. Links to relevant work: LinkedIn profile, portfolio, or references

4. Your earliest start date

5. Bonus: A 2-minute video introducing yourself (not required, but it helps!)



US-European Commerce Group | Tampa, FL

Operating across 29 countries | USA - Europe - Southeast Asia

title: Freelance Graphic Designer with WordPress, Elementor, Go High Level, and AI Expertise
description:
**Job Title: Freelance Graphic Designer with WordPress, Elementor, Go High Level, and AI Expertise**



**Location:** Remote  

**Job Type:** Part-Time (Potential for Full-Time)



**Introduction:**  

We are a dynamic company managing multiple websites, both on WordPress with Elementor and on the Go High Level platform. We are looking for a highly skilled freelance graphic designer who can bring a blend of design expertise and technical knowledge to help us enhance our online presence. If you are passionate about design, have a strong background in UX/UI, and are proficient with WordPress, Elementor, and Go High Level, we would love to hear from you.



**Key Responsibilities:**  

- Design and build visually stunning and user-friendly WordPress websites using Elementor.  

- Craft engaging and responsive pages on the Go High Level platform.  

- Utilize AI tools to optimize design processes and outcomes.  

- Enhance website UX/UI for optimal user engagement.  

- Collaborate and communicate effectively with our team.  

- Stay updated with industry trends and integrate innovative solutions.



**Qualifications:**  

- Proven experience in graphic design with a portfolio showcasing your work.  

- Proficiency in WordPress, Elementor, and Go High Level.  

- Familiarity with AI tools and platforms like Base44 or Lovable.  

- Strong understanding of UX/UI principles and best practices.  

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects.  

- Excellent communication skills to articulate design concepts and collaborate with the team.



**Preferred Skills:**  

- Experience with AI-driven design tools.  

- Knowledge of SEO best practices for WordPress.  

- Familiarity with other design software such as Adobe Creative Suite.



**Why Join Us?**  

- Flexible working hours with the potential for a long-term engagement.  

- Opportunity to work on diverse projects for small businesses.  

- Collaborative and supportive team environment.  

- Potential to transition into a more tenured role based on performance.



**Application Process:**  

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, a cover letter detailing their experience and skills, and a portfolio of relevant work. Please ensure you answer the following questions:  

1. Describe your experience with WordPress, Elementor, and Go High Level.  

2. Share examples of websites or pages you've designed and built using these tools.  

3. Provide insights into your UX/UI design process.  

4. Highlight any experience with AI tools, particularly in design.  

5. Explain how you manage project timelines and ensure deadlines are met.



***Attention to detail matters. Please don't send blank responses without these details as they won't be considered.



We look forward to discovering how your expertise can contribute to our company's growth and success.

title: Medical Virtual Assistant
description:
Medical Virtual Assistant (Remote, 20 hrs/week) Pharmacy Order Coordinator

Position Summary



We are hiring a Remote Medical Virtual Assistant to support clinical operations, with a primary focus on placing and tracking pharmacy orders. You will work closely with providers and the internal team to ensure prescriptions, compounded medications, and related orders are submitted correctly, followed through to completion, and documented in the EMR.



This is a part time role, 20 hours per week to start, and must align with Eastern Time business hours.



Key Responsibilities



Place pharmacy orders accurately based on provider direction and established protocols



Coordinate with partner pharmacies on order status, clarification requests, refills, and shipping updates



Track orders from submission through delivery and resolution using internal trackers



Maintain clean documentation in the EMR and ensure all order related notes are complete



Verify patient demographics and required intake items needed for pharmacy processing



Escalate time sensitive issues to the appropriate tea
mber promptly



Support light administrative tasks as needed depending on workload



Required Qualifications



Licensed Physician (MD/DO) or Licensed Pharmacist (PharmD or equivalent) with relevant degrees and ability to verify licensure



Experience with medication ordering workflows (pharmacy coordination, refills, compounded orders, prior authorization support, or similar)



Experience using EMRs (Cerbo experience is a bonus)



Fluent in English with strong written communication



Able to work reliably on Eastern Time and meet turnaround expectations



Detail oriented, organized, and comfortable following SOPs precisely



Preferred Qualifications



Experience with compounded medications, peptides, and hormone therapy related pharmacy workflows



Experience in functional medicine or cash pay clinic environments



Familiarity with HIPAA compliant documentation and communication



Schedule and Hours



Remote



20 hours per week to start



Availability required during Eastern Time business hours (consistent blocks strongly preferred)



What Success Looks Like



Orders are placed correctly the first time with minimal back and forth



Pharmacies receive fast responses and patients receive medications on time



EMR documentation is complete, clear, and easy to audit



Providers feel unblocked and patient experience improves



How to Apply



Please submit:



Resume or CV



Proof of licensure and degrees (MD/DO or Pharmacist)



Brief summary of relevant pharmacy ordering experience



EMR experience (Cerbo if applicable)



Weekly availability in Eastern Time

title: Marketing & Fractional CMO Agreement
description:
Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) – Full-Service Marketing

Role Overview



The Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) is responsible for developing and executing an integrated marketing strategy that drives sustainable patient growth, brand visibility, and long-term market positioning for the practice. This role goes beyond individual marketing tactics and provides strategic leadership across brand, website, advertising, reputation management, and digital visibility.



Rather than a piecemeal or à la carte approach, the Fractional CMO oversees a cohesive, full-service marketing ecosystem, ensuring that all components work together to produce measurable results.



This role provides access to a full marketing team—including strategy, design, execution, and technology—at a fraction of the cost of hiring an internal marketing department.



Core Responsibilities

Marketing Strategy & Leadership



Develop and manage a comprehensive, integrated marketing strategy aligned with practice growth goals



Serve as the strategic marketing lead and advisor to practice leadership



Ensure consistency across brand messaging, visuals, and patient experience



Identify growth opportunities tied to market conditions, competition, and expansion plans



Brand & Website Oversight



Lead website strategy, structure, messaging, and conversion optimization



Ensure the website supports visibility, credibility, and patient acquisition—not just aesthetics



Align brand identity across website, digital platforms, and patient touchpoints



Digital Visibility & Patient Acquisition



Oversee SEO, local search visibility, and online presence



Manage paid advertising strategies (Google, social, or other channels as appropriate)



Implement systems to consistently attract and convert new patients



Monitor and optimize campaigns based on performance and ROI



Reputation & Review Management



Develop and oversee review generation and reputation strategies



Ensure consistent patient feedback collection and online credibility growth



Protect and enhance the practice’s digital reputation



Execution & Team Management



Coordinate strategy, design, implementation, and technology through a dedicated marketing team



Ensure all initiatives are executed on time, on brand, and aligned with goals



Remove the burden of managing multiple vendors or internal hires



Measurement & Performance Tracking



Track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as:



New patient acquisition



Cost per lead



Conversion rates



Online visibility and engagement



Provide clear reporting and insights to leadership



Continuously refine strategy based on results



Scalable support aligned with practice growth stages



Expected Outcomes



Increased online visibility and market presence



Consistent flow of qualified new patients



Stronger brand positioning ahead of practice expansion or relocation



Timing & Strategic Importance



This role is especially critical during periods of transition or growth, such as a relocation or expansion. Addressing visibility and brand positioning early prevents lost 
ntum and avoids the challenge of playing catch-up later.



While a website alone establishes a foundation, the Fractional CMO model accelerates results by activating all growth levers simultaneously.

title: Conversion Tracking Specialist
description:
We are looking for an experienced Tracking & Analytics Expert to help us properly track, measure, and optimize conversions across multiple websites and ad platforms.



This role is critical. You will be responsible for ensuring our data is accurate, reliable, and actionable so marketing decisions are based on real performance—not guesses.



You’ll work closely with our marketing team to audit existing tracking, fix broken setups, and implement best-practice tracking moving forward.



?



Responsibilities

 • Audit existing tracking setups across websites and funnels

 • Properly configure Google Tag Manager (GTM)

 • Set up and maintain GA4 (events, conversions, custom definitions)

 • Configure conversion tracking for:

 • Google Ads

 • Meta/Facebook Ads

 • Other ad platforms as needed

 • Track form submissions, phone calls, button clicks, page events, and purchases

 • Troubleshoot broken or inaccurate tracking

 • Implement clean, scalable tracking structures for multiple clients/sites

 • Provide clear documentation and explanations (non-technical friendly)



?



Required Skills & Experience

 • Proven experience with Google Tag Manager (GTM)

 • Strong understanding of GA4 (events, conversions, reports)

 • Experience setting up Google Ads & Meta conversion tracking

 • Experience tracking form fills, calls, and custom events

 • Ability to diagnose tracking issues quickly

 • Strong attention to detail (data accuracy matters)

 • Good communication skills (English)



?



Nice to Have (Not Required)

 • Experience with CRM integrations (HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.)

 • Experience with call tracking platforms

 • Agency or multi-client experience

 • Basic understanding of CRO and funnel optimization



?



Work Details

 • Type: This position I am looking for someone who wants stable work. You must be willing to take initiative and responsibility for your work. 

 • Hours: Flexible

 • Work From: Remote

 • Pay: Competitive (based on experience)



Please include:

 • Your experience with GTM and GA4

 • Examples of tracking setups you’ve worked on





?



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



To avoid spam applications, please start your application with the word “TRACKING” and briefly explain:

 • Your experience with GA4 + GTM

 • A tracking problem you’ve solved recently



Must use 15 apply points. 



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.

title: Join the 'Disney' of Short-Stays as a Concierge Team Member
description:
We are the Disney of the short-stay industry.



Every stay is designed, choreographed, and delivered with the same intention you’d expect from a world-class global brand — where emotion matters, details matter, and the experience is remembered long after check-out.



This role is not customer support.

It is not a script-reading position.

It is not a place to hide behind automation.



We are looking for real brand ambassadors, people who understand that how something is said matters just as much as what is said.



--------------------



The Role

As a Concierge, you are the living expression of the brand.



You are the voice guests trust.

You are the tone they remember.

You are the reason a stay feels thoughtful, intentional, and human.



Guests are not interacting with software or templates.

They are interacting with you, and through you, the brand.



--------------------



What You’ll Be Responsible For

1. Serve as the primary point of contact for guests before, during, and after their stay

2. Deliver warm, confident, articulate communication across booking platforms, phone,
, and SMS

3. Represent the brand’s values, tone, and standards in every interaction

4. Ensure each guest experience feels seamless, considered, and personal

5. Resolve guest issues (A/C, Wi-Fi, access, appliances, etc.) calmly and decisively

6. Coordinate solutions with cleaning, maintenance, and building teams

7. Communicate disruptions or building notices with clarity and professionalism

8. Take ownership of outcomes, not just messages

9. Maintain a deep understanding of each property’s layout, features, and nuances

10. Coordinate with housekeeping teams to ensure spaces are guest-ready at all times

11. Speak confidently and accurately about each space and its surroundings

12. Maintain clear guest notes, handovers, and internal updates

13. Work in rhythm with the wider team to deliver consistency at scale



-----------------------



Non-Negotiables



1. Fluent English is essential.

You must communicate clearly, confidently, and naturally — both written and spoken.



2. No AI-generated guest communication.

ChatGPT or similar tools are not permitted for guest interactions.

This brand is built on real conversations with real people.



3. You represent something bigger than yourself.

This role requires pride, presence, and care in how you show up every day.



4. This is a role in a brand.

We are selective because every person in this position shapes how the world experiences us.



------------------------



Video Application (Required)



All applicants must submit a short video answering:



1. Who you are and how you present yourself

2. Your experience in hospitality or short-term stays (if any)

3. What being a brand ambassador means to you

4. If you were told you were joining the Disney of the short-stay industry, how would that change the way you approach your work?

Help create tracking systems for shipments and supplier costs

Keep shipment tracking sheets fully updated



???? Required Skills

MUST HAVE (Non-Negotiable)

? Shopify

???? Not Suitable If

???? Pay



Competitive based on experience

Performance bonuses available for high accuracy and reliability



???? Growth Opportunity



Potential future roles:



Senior Inventory Planner



Operations Analyst



Operations Manager



We build long-term teams and promote from within.



???? Application Instructions



Please include:



1?? Your experience with inventory, data, or reporting

2?? Example spreadsheet or report you built

3?? Your favourite Excel or Google Sheets formula and why

4?? Include the word “STOCKCONTROL” in your application



???? Work Culture



We value:



Accuracy over speed



Ownership over excuses



Long term loyalty



Clear communication



If you are detail-focused, analytical, and want to be part of a serious long-term team, we would love to hear from you.
