title: [Quick Placement] Reliable VA Receptionist Full Time Remote
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
Virtual Assistant – Operations & Reporting (Part-Time / Remote)



About the Role

We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support the operational and administrative needs of a growing consulting business. This role focuses on managing recurring weekly and monthly tasks—especially reporting, data organization, account management, and keeping internal processes running smoothly.



If you’re someone who thrives on routine, loves structure, and has strong systems thinking, this is a great fit.



Key Responsibilities



Weekly Tasks

 • Generate and organize weekly performance reports

 • Update internal tracking dashboards (KPIs, metrics, client progress, invoices, etc.)

 • Review and reconcile accounts or client files for accuracy

 • Ensure all automated systems (CRM, reporting tools, project trackers) are functioning and notify of any issues

 • Prepare weekly summaries for management



Monthly Tasks

 • Prepare monthly performance, financial, and operational reports

 • Reconcile accounts and ensure accuracy across platforms

 • Update client billing summaries or retainer usage where applicable

 • Organize monthly data exports and backups

 • Maintain updated SOPs for recurring tasks



General Administrative Support

 • Maintain internal databases and client records

 • Assist with account management and follow-ups

 • Document new processes as they are added

 • Support ad hoc tasks related to operations and reporting

 • Proactively identify inefficiencies and suggest improvements



Required Skills & Experience

 • Strong organizational and administrative abilities

 • Experience with spreadsheets (Google Sheets / Excel)

 • Comfortable with reporting, dashboards, and basic data summarization

 • Excellent attention to detail

 • Strong communication skills

 • Ability to handle recurring deadlines reliably

 • Self-directed with good problem-solving skills

 • Experience with CRM systems, automation tools, or project management platforms is an asset



Nice-to-Have Experience

 • Familiarity with automation platforms (Make.com, Zapier)

 • Experience in consulting, operations, or sales support

 • Knowledge of invoice management or bookkeeping basics

 • Ability to produce simple templates or SOPs



Working Style

 • Remote

 • Part-time, flexible hours

 • Must be responsive and consistent with weekly and monthly deadlines

 • Comfortable working autonomously with minimal oversight

title: VIRTUAL ASSISTANT WITH EXPERTISE IN GOOGLE SHEETS NEEDED
description:
We are a Texas based roofing company looking for a virtual assistant that can perform basic administrative tasks in Mojo Dialer and JobNimbus, and needs to be an expert at using Google Sheets to track data and pull information for us.



Additional time may be spent cold calling, if you have a good American accent. 



SCHEDULE:

Hours: 40+ hrs/week, Monday-Friday 8AM–11AM CST, a 4 hour break and then again 3PM-8PM CST.



The pay is $4/hour + $150 commission on sold jobs for the extra time that you will have to cold call. 



WE ARE ONLY HIRING COLD CALLERS THAT HAVE A PERFECT ENGLISH ACCENT AND ABLE TO COMMUNICATE WELL.

WE WILL ONLY INTERVIEW APPLICANTS THAT SEND IN A 30 SECOND VIDEO INTRODUCING THEMSELVES FIRST.



Requirements:

Experience using Mojo, JobNimbus and Google Sheets. 



Daily tasks will include updating and maintaining information in Mojo (our dialing software), JobNimbus (our CRM) and being an expert at managing data and providing insights into our Google Sheets data that we keep track of. 



We are conducting interviews on a regular basis and looking for people that can start immediately if they are accepted through the interview process.



-Graham

Veteran Roofing

title: AI Video Content Producer & Social Media Manager
description:
Role Summary

We are seeking an experienced offshore virtual assistant to support a growing Legal Nurse Consulting education and services business. You will function as a multi-skilled creator and operator—owning content production, social media management, graphics, AI-assisted video creation (faceless and/or using approved likeness assets), marketing/media execution, website management, and light software development/automation.



This role supports:

Legal Nurse Consultant training courses (education products)

Medical record review services for attorneys

Building a subcontracting network of legal nurse consultants



Key Responsibilities

A) Content Creation (Core)

Create and repurpose content from long-form sources (webinars, trainings, blog posts, case-based lessons) into:

Short-form posts, carousels, reels/shorts,
 snippets, blog articles, lead magnets

Write in a professional, credible tone suitable for legal/medical audiences

Develop and manage a content calendar (weekly/monthly), including campaigns and launches

Ensure brand consistency: voice, messaging pillars, disclaimers, and calls-to-action



B) Social Media Management (Core)

Manage posting schedule across platforms (e.g., Instagram,
, LinkedIn, TikTok, YouTube Shorts)

Community management: respond to comments/DMs using approved guidelines

Social analytics and reporting: track KPIs, identify what’s working, optimize content

Manage collaborations, podcast outreach, guest appearances, and basic PR follow-up



C) Graphic Design & Creative Production (Core)

Design branded templates and assets: carousels, thumbnails, banners, lead magnets, course visuals

Produce consistent brand look/feel (fonts, colors, layouts) across platforms

Basic photo editing and visual cleanup for professional presentation

D) AI Video Creation (Core + Specialized)



You will create AI-assisted videos that may be:

Faceless videos (voiceover + b-roll, captions, stock footage, animations)

Videos using approved likeness assets (e.g., talking-head overlays, image-driven video, avatar-driven video, or “video with content behind the speaker”)

Important: Any use of the business owner’s likeness must be done only with explicit permission and using approved assets and platform-compliant methods.

Script short-form videos optimized for retention (hooks, structure, CTA)

Create storyboards and shot lists for consistent weekly production

Edit videos with captions, on-screen text, b-roll, and brand elements

Maintain a reusable workflow (templates, presets, file naming, asset library)



E) Marketing, Funnels, and Media Support

Build/maintain lead magnets, landing pages, opt-in flows, and
 sequences

Support course launches: promotional calendars, announcements, countdown sequences

Basic SEO tasks (blog formatting, keyword optimization, internal linking, metadata)

Coordinate basic ads support (creative versions, UTM links, tracking—if applicable)



F) Website Management & Buildout

Create and manage website pages: home, about, services, courses, blog, contact, booking

Maintain website updates, plugin/app updates, backups, basic troubleshooting

Improve speed, mobile responsiveness, accessibility basics, and UX flow

Implement tracking pixels/analytics and conversion events as needed



G) Operations Support (Nice-to-have but Valuable)

Organize files, SOPs, templates, content library, and brand assets

Set up project management boards and keep work moving

Support building a subcontractor network:

outreach systems, onboarding packets, scheduling interviews, maintaining a roster



H) Light Software Development / Automation (Preferred)

Build simple automations to reduce manual work (e.g., lead intake, content workflows, CRM updates)

Integrate tools via Zapier/Make/API connections

Basic scripting (Python/JavaScript) for small internal tools, data cleanup, reporting, or simple web features



Required Skills & Qualifications (Must Have)

Proven experience as a VA supporting content + social media + marketing execution

Strong English writing and editing (professional, clear, accurate)

Experience creating short-form video content (Reels/Shorts/TikTok)

Familiarity with AI-assisted content workflows (ChatGPT-style tools, captioning, repurposing)

Graphic design competence (brand-consistent social graphics, thumbnails, carousels)

Website editing/management experience (WordPress, Squarespace, Wix, or similar)

Excellent organization, initiative, and ability to work independently

Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and professionalism

Preferred Skills (Nice to Have)

Experience in healthcare, legal services, or professional education markets

 marketing + funnels (ConvertKit/Mailchimp/Klaviyo, etc.)

SEO and blog strategy

Basic paid ads creative/testing understanding

Automation tools (Zapier/Make) + basic API familiarity

Basic software development skills (HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Python, or similar)

Video AI tools experience (avatar/voiceover/video generation) using approved and ethical workflows

Tools You Should Be Comfortable With (or willing to learn quickly)

Project Management: Trello/Asana/ClickUp/Notion

Design: Canva (required), Adobe/other tools (bonus)

Video Editing: CapCut, Descript, Premiere, or similar

AI Tools: ChatGPT-style writing tools; captioning/transcription tools

Social Scheduling: Metricool/Later/Buffer/Hootsuite (any)

Web: WordPress/Squarespace/Wix + basic plugins/apps

/Funnels: ConvertKit/Mailchimp/Kajabi/Teachable (any)

Automation: Zapier/Make (preferred)



Work Style & Expectations

Offshore/remote role; consistent weekly availability

Reliable internet, ability to attend occasional meetings as needed

Proactive: brings ideas, identifies improvements, suggests new content angles

Ability to create, revise, and finalize work based on feedback quickly

Maintain confidentiality and sign NDA + IP assignment agreement

Deliverables & Success Metrics (Examples)

4–7 short videos/week (faceless and/or approved likeness workflow)

3–5 posts/week (mix of carousels, single-image, thought leadership, promotional)

Monthly content calendar planned in advance

Website kept current; landing pages built as needed

Growth in leads,
 opt-ins, consultation bookings, and course inquiries

Clear reporting: what was posted, performance, next actions



To Apply

Please provide:

A brief summary of your experience in content + social + video + web

Portfolio links (social graphics, short-form videos, any websites)

Tools you use (design/video/social/web/automation)

Your weekly availability and time zone

Your expected monthly rate or hourly rate

mbers who are motivated, reliable, and eager to contribute to our company’s growth. There is significant room for advancement for those who consistently provide excellent work and represent our brand with professionalism and dedication.

s regarding refunds, tracking numbers, and FAQs.

title: Customer Service Representative (English/Spanish)
description:
*** Client Care Coordinator (English/Spanish)

Full-Time | Long-Term | U.S.-Based Company

Idaho Elite Inspection Team



*** This Is NOT a Typical Virtual Assistant Job

If you’re looking for a role where you’re treated like a real tea
mber—not a faceless voice behind a screen—this may be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for.



At Idaho Elite Inspection Team, our Client Care Coordinators are trusted professionals who play a key role in how our company operates, serves clients, and grows revenue.

You’ll be trained, supported, and valued—not micromanaged or ignored.



***  About Us

Idaho Elite Inspection Team is the highest-rated home inspection company in Southeast Idaho.

We’re known for professionalism, attention to detail, and outstanding customer service.

Our Client Care Coordinators are the first voice our clients hear and the people who turn inquiries into confident, well-served customers.



*** What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be responsible for helping clients from their very first call through a successfully scheduled inspection.

That includes:

???? Client Communication

Answering inbound calls and returning missed calls

Speaking confidently, clearly, and professionally

Creating a calm, positive experience for every caller



*** Scheduling & Coordination

Scheduling inspections accurately using our systems

Confirming appointments with clients and agents

Handling reschedules and special cases correctly



*** Systems & Admin

Working inside our scheduling and CRM systems

Following clear scripts, processes, and procedures

Keeping records accurate and up to date



*** Revenue Support (Ethical Sales)

Explaining inspection packages and upgrade options

Recommending additional services when appropriate

Understanding how your conversations impact company revenue

You won’t be guessing—we provide clear scripts, training, and expectations.



*** Why This Role Is Different

? You’re part of the core operations team

? Full training with a structured 90-day onboarding plan

? Stable, full-time, long-term position

? Performance bonuses tied to company success

? Weekly check-ins and real support

? Clear systems—no chaos, no guessing

The better you do, the more you earn—and the more opportunities you’ll have to grow.



*** Compensation & Benefits

Base Pay: $700 USD per month (full-time, salaried)

Bonuses: Monthly performance bonuses tied to results

* Strong performers earn an additional $500–$1,000+ per month

* Year-End Performance Bonus $400-$1,000

Paid Time Off:

1 paid day off per month after 90 days

7 paid Philippine holidays per year



Paid bi-weekly (Venmo)



***  Who We’re Looking For

You’ll be a great fit if you:

Speak excellent English (Spanish is a bonus)

Have prior customer service, call center, or client-facing experience

Are comfortable on the phone

Pay close attention to details

Can follow scripts and systems consistently

Are reliable, professional, and growth-minded

Want a long-term role, not short-term gigs

Must work Mountain Time (USA) working hours



Bonus points if you have:

Experience with U.S. clients

Sales or “upgrading” experience

Scheduling or admin background

CRM or booking system experience



***  How to Apply (all 3 are REQUIRED)

Please submit:

1. Your resume

2. A short cover letter

3. Visit this link to fill out the questionnaire:

title: Social Media Manager (Instagram-First) – B2B Cocoa Export Business
description:
Morta Produce Ltd is a West Africa–based cocoa producer and exporter, working directly with smallholder farmers to supply high-quality fermented and dried cocoa beans to international buyers.

We operate across:



Cocoa collection & processing (fermentation & drying); Farmer networks and traceability; 

Export-ready cocoa for global B2B buyers; 



Our audience is:

Chocolate makers, Cocoa buyers & traders, Ethical sourcing managers, Importers & distributors



Instagram is used as a credibility and visibility tool to support B2B relationships and inbound enquiries.

Position Morta Produce Ltd as a credible, professional cocoa exporter that international buyers trust.

This role is about Authority; Transparency; Consistency; Storytelling around sourcing, quality, and ethics; Not hype. 

Not influencer content.

Not entertainment-first posting.



KEY RESPONSBILITIES Instagram Strategy (B2B-Led)



Develop a clear Instagram content strategy for a cocoa export business

Align content with buyer trust, quality assurance, and ethical sourcing

Focus on educational, behind-the-scenes, and process-led content

Content Planning & Posting

Plan and schedule weekly content:

Reels (farm, fermentation, drying, export prep)

Carousels (process, quality standards, traceability)

Static posts (announcements, milestones)

Stories (ongoing farm activity, shipping updates)

Write professional, clear captions suitable for international buyers

Brand Positioning

Maintain a consistent, premium, export-ready brand image

Ensure tone reflects professionalism, reliability, and transparency

Highlight farmer networks, origin, and sustainability (without greenwashing)

Engagement & Visibility



Engage with relevant B2B accounts:  Chocolate brands; Cocoa buyers; Ethical sourcing organisations; Support inbound DMs and enquiries (scripts provided); Reporting; Weekly performance summary including: 

Content posted

Reach & saves

Profile visits

Buyer enquiries / meaningful conversations



Ideal Candidate Profile



You’re a strong fit if you:

Have experience managing Instagram for B2B or export-focused businesses

Understand commodities, agriculture, or supply-chain storytelling

Can write clear, professional English

Are comfortable working with process-based content

Are organised, proactive, and consistent



Bonus (not required):

Experience with agriculture, cocoa, coffee, or commodities

Familiarity with ethical sourcing or sustainability messaging

Experience working with UK or European businesses



HOW TO APPLY (Important)



Please include:



A brief introduction and relevant experience



Links to Instagram accounts you’ve managed



A short answer to this question:

“How would you use Instagram to build trust with international cocoa buyers?”



Applications without examples will not be considered.

title: Business operations
description:
Operations & Growth Coordinator

StressKnotNYC — Remote | Full-Time



This is not a typical admin role.

We’re looking for a high-ownership operator who can manage fulfillment AND help grow the business when things are quiet.



You will be the bridge between clients, therapists, and revenue.

When bookings are active, you focus on fulfillment.

When things slow down,  you switch into growth mode.



About StressKnotNYC

StressKnotNYC is a premium in-home massage and wellness company serving New York City and surrounding areas. We connect high-quality clients with elite licensed massage therapists, acupuncturists. We are building a strong operations engine and need someone who can help us run daily operations while also helping us grow.



Your job is simple:

Make sure every client gets taken care of

Make sure therapists are supported

Help bring in more therapists + more clients when things are slow



Primary Responsibilities

1) Fulfillment (Top Priority)

When bookings are active, this comes first.

Answer calls, texts, and
s from clients

Coordinate and schedule massage sessions

Match clients with available therapists

Confirm appointments

Send reminders to clients and therapists

Handle reschedules and cancellations

Support therapists during the day

Follow up with clients after sessions

Request reviews and referrals

You are the control center of daily operations.



2) Therapist Recruitment (When Fulfillment Is Slow)

When inquiries are quiet, switch to building the therapist pipeline.

Source licensed massage therapists on Indeed.

Screen candidates

Schedule interviews

Follow up with applicants

Track candidate pipeline

Help onboard new therapists



Goal: Always keep the therapist bench growing.



3) Business Outreach (When Fulfillment Is Slow)

Help bring in corporate and local business opportunities.

Reach out to local businesses

Reach out to hotels, offices, gyms, studios, etc.

Send
 proposals and make outreach calls

Track responses

Set meetings for leadership



Goal: Build relationships that turn into revenue.



4) Client Reactivation (When Fulfillment Is Slow)

Help generate income from past clients.

Reach out to past clients

Send follow-up
s/texts

Check in and encourage rebooking

Promote new services and availability



Goal: Turn old clients into repeat clients.



You might be a great fit if you:

Take ownership

Stay organized without being told

Communicate clearly and professionally

Are comfortable speaking on the phone

Can switch between tasks quickly

Care about results, not just checking boxes

Think like an operator AND a problem-solver

This role requires someone who can work independently and stay productive and organized.



You help the company by:

Making sure no client inquiry is missed

Keeping therapists scheduled and supported

Bringing in new therapist candidates

Helping create new business opportunities

Re-engaging past clients

You are helping the business run AND grow.



Required Skills

Strong English communication

Customer service experience

Comfortable on phone calls

Organized and detail-oriented

Able to multitask

Reliable and responsive



Bonus if you have experience with:

Scheduling/dispatching

Recruiting

Cold outreach

CRM systems

WE OFFER COMMISSION for every deal due to your outreach efforts.





Please submit a short video introduction (1–2 minutes) answering the following:



Why are you interested in working with StressKnotNYC?

Have you handled scheduling or dispatching before? If yes, briefly explain your experience.

Are you comfortable speaking with clients and therapists on the phone daily?



This video helps us understand your communication skills, confidence, and professionalism, which are essential for this role. Applications without a video introduction will not be considered.

title: Operational Ecommerce Technical Team Lead
description:

We are seeking a tech-savvy, highly organized Operations Senior Team Lead who can manage complex workflows, optimize SEO performance, and lead our design and operations teams to success.

title: Closer/SDR Appt Setter for Ebay Coaching Academy
description:
This role is for ecommerce academy that offers high ticket coaching programs for beginners to exceed on selling on ebay or amazon. PLEASE READ THE JOB POST TILL THE END



This position is becoming a sales phone dialer for the company where you will be calling people who opted in to our free materials and booking them into calls where we will close them into high ticket programs. As well as following up with previous clients to cross sell them into more packages. 



If you do not fit these requirements below please do not bother applying.

Requirements:

-Previous sales and calling experience

-Collected or contributed at least $100k into company sales

-No accent

-Work USA hours 10am-7pm EST

-Have at least 3 sales call recordings to send

-Disciplined and can dial at least 100 to 200 leads a day

-Experience with gohighlevel, 
 and ecommerce preferred



Roles:

-Calling lead opt ins within 5 minutes of opt in and booking them into calls

- Following and calling leads who did not pickup the first time for 7 consecutive days

-Reaching out to already booked calls a few hours before appointment to make sure they will show up, hype for the call and presold for the closers.

-Calling and sending consecutive follow up SMS's for leads that joined the call but did not close and had a few objections

-Following up leads that no showed or canceled calls. Rebooking them into new days

-Updating our CRM system (Gohighlevel) and maintaining organized lead tracking

-Communicating clearly with the sales and marketing team to ensure smooth handoffs

- Updating google sheets with lead info and tracking



Salary is $2k to $5k/month



Please send a message with a intro video of your previous experience and sales call recordings! If you do not have sales call recordings send a mock roleplay call for you dialing a lead who opted into a free ebay training and your goal is to do a progress check, discover pain points, financial qualify and set them into a longer call with manager on how we can help them in detail.



If you do not send these in the initial message you will get ignored. This is a high paying job with lots of rewards and we are hiring urgently.

title: Senior GoHighLevel Architect (Insurance & Consulting Funnels) - US Time Zone
description:
THE ROLE:

We are a US-based group launching three distinct brands (Insurance Agency, Lead Gen, and B2B Consulting). We need a GoHighLevel Architect to build our marketing "engine." This is a high-level role responsible for designing websites, building complex automation workflows, and ensuring our paid ads (FB/Google) sync perfectly with our CRM.



We need an Insurance Marketing Expert who understands the difference between a "warm transfer" and a "web lead" and knows how to build a GHL system that helps our team strike while the iron is hot.



THE PROJECTS

  
 & Ash Mill Insurance: High-volume insurance funnels (Paid Ads -> Landing Page -> SMS Nurture).

  - Bind Bros LLC: A B2B consulting funnel selling "Business-in-a-Box" setups. You will build Master Snapshots of our insurance funnels that we can "one-click" deploy for consulting clients using Custom Values and automated onboarding.



WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  - Architecture & Productization: Set up 3 Sub-Accounts and build "template-ready" Snapshots. You must ensure logos, links, and phone numbers update automatically via Custom Values when we deploy a new client.

  - Funnel & Automation Mastery: Build high-converting, premium-looking landing pages (CSS knowledge is a plus). Configure complex "Speed-to-Lead" workflows (Missed Call Text Back, Fast-Five Nurtures).

  - Technical Stack: Handle A2P 10DLC registration (Critical), configure Power Dialers, and integrate Stripe for automated service delivery.

  - Ad Tracking: Connect
 Lead Forms and Google Conversion API (CAPI) to ensure 1:1 attribution for our ad spend.



REQUIREMENTS (MUST HAVE):

  - 3+ Years Deep GHL Experience: You have built Snapshots from scratch and mastered the Workflow builder.

  - Insurance Industry Expertise: You speak the language (Quotes, Bind, Dec Pages, X-Dates).

  - Compliance & Tracking: Proven success with A2P 10DLC registration and UTM/CAPI ad attribution.

  - SaaS/Consulting Logic: You understand the B2B user journey, from booking an appointment to automated contract delivery.



BENEFITS AND PAY:

- Salary: 100,000 PHP - 120,000 PHP / Month (Depending on experience).

- Schedule: Full-Time, US Business Hours (EST).

- Long-term contract or position.



HOW TO APPLY

To be considered, submit your Portfolio/CV and a link to short video (Loom or similar, 3-5 minutes)



In your video, please include:

  - Show us the "Under the Hood" logic of a complex Insurance Funnel or Workflow you built.

  - Explain your "X-Date" strategy: How do you automate a re-engagement workflow for a prospect whose policy expires in 6 months?

  - Explain your "Friction" strategy: How do you capture a phone number before asking deep underwriting questions (like VINs)? Mention if you have used Canopy Connect.



In the text of your application, please provide:

  - What is one "hidden" reason A2P 10DLC Brand Registration gets rejected for insurance agencies, and how do you prevent it?

- Put the word 'ARCHITECT' at the very top of your application so I know you read this entire post.

title: YouTube Video Editor – Documentary / Silent Vlog Style (Long-Term)
description:
Position: YouTube Video Editor

Type: Long-term, remote

Platform: OnlineJobs.ph

Start: Immediate (trial first, then ongoing)



About the Project



I’m launching a YouTube channel called Life of a DJ/Promoter — a documentary-style series that captures the real day-to-day life behind electronic music and rave culture.



The channel focuses on:

- process over performance

- documentation over narration

- real 
nts, not hype

- There is little to no talking on camera (mostly background noise)

- The story is told through editing, pacing, visuals, sound design, and subtitles.



This is not influencer content. It’s a grounded, cinematic, process-driven documentary series.



What You’ll Be Editing

Each episode includes:



1 long-form YouTube video (8–15 minutes)



3–7 vertical Shorts (YouTube Shorts / IG Reels / TikTok)



Subtitles (clean, intentional, well-paced) - I will provide the copy for each video for you to edit



Light music and sound design - I will send you tracks



Occasional b-roll (from provided assets or stock)



Your Responsibilities:

- Edit documentary-style YouTube videos

- Shape story without voice-over

- Select strong 
nts from raw footage

- Guide me in shooting better raw footage as needed 



Add subtitles that enhance the narrative



- Create Shorts from long-form edits

- Maintain a consistent visual and pacing style

- Deliver organized project files and exports



What I’m Looking For:

- Strong sense of storytelling and pacing

- Experience editing YouTube videos (documentary, vlog, or cinematic style)

- Excellent English comprehension (for subtitles)

- Comfortable editing without heavy narration

- Reliable, timely, organized, and detail-oriented



Proficient in Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve



Nice to have (not required):

- Experience with silent vlogs

- Familiarity with music, nightlife, or creative culture

- Experience using AI tools for captions, transcripts, or rough cuts



Work Structure & Output:

Phase 1 – Initial Batch

Edit 5 full episodes to build a content buffer



Timeline: 2–4 weeks (quality > speed)

Phase 2 – Ongoing

Edit 1–2 episodes per week



Maintain a rolling content buffer



Long-term collaboration if it’s a good fit



Compensation



Per episode: $150–$220 USD (roughly 600+ a month)

(Includes long-form video + 3–7 Shorts)



or



Monthly retainer: $600–$1,800 USD

(Depending on weekly output)



A paid test project ($40–$60) is required before final selection.



How to Apply



Please include:



A short introduction about yourself



Links to 2–3 relevant editing samples



Your preferred rate (per episode or monthly)



Your weekly availability



Applicants without samples will not be considered

title: Medical Insurance Billing & Patient Communications VA (Optometry Practice – USA)

title: HEAD OF OPERATIONS  - Build & Run EU Talent Recruitment Marketplace
description:
We are building a new self-service recruitment platform that connects high-quality international talent (Philippines, LATAM, Eastern Europe) with companies in Germany and Europe.



We are looking for a hands-on, highly organized Head of Operations (Founding Role) who can fully own and run this project end-to-end. The founder’s involvement should be minimal (“hands-off”).



BIG BONUS: You have worked at a remote staffing / recruiting company similar to 
 / Support Shepherd (or a comparable recruitment agency) and understand how to build trust with European clients while maintaining high candidate quality.







ABOUT THE MISSION (WIN-WIN)

Our goal is to create a true win-win:

 • A win for talented people from the Philippines and other regions: access to stable, full-time EU jobs

 • A win for EU companies: access to reliable, high-quality talent in a simple and transparent way

We do not want to position this as “cheap labor.” We focus on quality, reliability, and trust.







WHAT YOU WILL FULLY OWN (END-TO-END)

 1. BUILD THE PRE-LAUNCH TALENT POOL (SUPPLY)



 • Build and manage a curated talent pool across multiple categories (quality over quantity)

 • Source candidates (OnlineJobs.ph, LinkedIn, Upwork, communities, referrals)

 • Ensure each candidate profile is complete and professional:

 • Professional photo

 • Short intro video (Loom)

 • CV + portfolio / proof of work

 • English level (tested or verified)

 • Tools/skills

 • Salary expectations (full-time / part-time)

 • Availability date

 • Organize everything cleanly in:

 • Google Sheets (main database)

 • Google Drive (photos, videos, documents)

 • Manage candidate statuses: Applied / Screened / Vetted / Approved / Ready



 2. BUILD & RUN EU CLIENT ACQUISITION (DEMAND) – BASIC BUT EFFECTIVE



 • Build lists of target EU companies (Germany/EU focus)

 • Run outbound outreach 
 + LinkedIn) in professional English

 • Qualify companies and collect hiring requirements

 • Coordinate introductions (company ? candidate)

 • Track a simple pipeline and conversion metrics



 3. DEFINE THE OPERATING SYSTEM (PROCESSES + QUALITY + TRUST)



 • Create SOPs (step-by-step processes) for:

 • sourcing and screening

 • candidate onboarding and profile preparation

 • client qualification and requirement gathering

 • matching + intro process + follow-ups

 • replacement / guarantee process (trust building)

 • Set up and manage simple tools and dashboards:

 • Notion or ClickUp (task management)

 • Google Sheets (KPIs and reporting)

 • Provide a short weekly report: KPIs, wins, blockers, next steps



 4. PREPARE PLATFORM LAUNCH (HANDOVER TO THE WEB APP)



 • Prepare candidate data so it can later be imported into the platform (Bubble)

 • Coordinate with the developer when needed (requirements, QA, testing feedback)

 • Ensure we launch with strong trust and quality from day one



 5. BUILD AND MANAGE A SMALL REMOTE TEAM (IF NEEDED)



 • Hire and manage 1–2 sourcers and/or a coordinator as needed

 • Train them using SOPs and quality standards

Goal: a lean operation that runs without daily founder involvement.







ROLE CATEGORIES (EXAMPLES)

We focus on roles that European companies can manage in English:

 • Amazon & Marketplace (PPC, listing, account management)

 • E-commerce Operations (Shopify ops, catalog, CX)

 • Performance Marketing (Google/YouTube, SEO,
/CRM)

 • Creative (video editing, design, Amazon creatives)

 • AI & Automation (Make/Zapier, AI agents, workflows)

 • Web Dev / UX/UI / QA

 • Sales/Lead Gen, Ops/EA, Data/BI, Finance Ops







REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

 • Strong experience in recruitment / talent sourcing / HR operations / staffing

 • Proven ability to deliver quality candidates (not mass recruiting)

 • Excellent English communication (written + spoken)

 • Very organized, process-driven, and reliable

 • Strong judgment: you can evaluate real skill and professionalism

 • Able to work independently and take full ownership



BONUS



 • Experience at 
 / Support Shepherd or similar remote staffing/recruiting agency

 • Experience working with European clients and understanding EU expectations

 • Experience building SOPs, hiring workflows, and managing small remote teams







SUCCESS METRICS (CLEAR EXPECTATIONS)



First 30 days:

 • Operating system in place (SOPs + dashboards + process)

 • 5–7 priority categories started

 • 100+ vetted candidates in the database

 • EU outreach started (target list + messaging + pipeline)



First 60 days:

 • 200–300 vetted candidates across priority categories

 • Regular company interest and introductions happening

 • Trust / replacement process defined



First 90 days:

 • Operation runs with minimal founder involvement

 • Consistent placement 
ntum (goal: building toward 2–3 hires per week)

 • A small team can support the process if needed



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)

Please include ALL of the following:

 1. Short introduction + relevant experience

 2. Any experience in remote staffing / recruitment agencies (especially Somewhere/Support Shepherd-like)

 3. Your exact 30-day plan (step-by-step):

 • how you will source candidates

 • how you will vet and onboard them

 • how you will approach Germany/EU company acquisition

 4. Realistic weekly numbers:

 • how many vetted candidates you can deliver per week

 • how many EU companies you can outreach per week

 5. Examples of SOPs, systems, or dashboards you built (if available)



Applications without a clear 30-day plan will not be considered.



If this sounds like a strong fit, I’d love to hear your plan and how you would run this operation end-to-end



Thank You :)!!

title: Grant Writer
description:
Grant Writer – Job Description

Position Overview

We are seeking a passionate, detail-oriented, and mission-driven Grant Writer to join our small but growing nonprofit team. The Grant Writer will play a pivotal role in building the organization’s financial sustainability by researching and securing funding opportunities from foundations, corporations, and government agencies.



The ideal candidate has strong writing and analytical skills, with a preference for those who have an interest in community-based organizations, K–12 education, higher education, and workforce development.



This is a part-time or contract position (10–15 hours per week) with the potential to expand as the organization grows.

Key Responsibilities

• Grant Research & Prospecting

• Identify grant opportunities that align with the organization’s mission and programs.

• Maintain and update a calendar of deadlines for applications and reporting.

• Proposal Development

• Write clear, persuasive, and mission-aligned proposals, letters of inquiry, and concept papers.

• Develop budgets and financial narratives in collaboration with leadership.

• Tailor applications to meet the specific guidelines and priorities of each funder.

• Grant Management & Reporting

• Track grant submissions, awards, and reporting requirements.

• Draft and submit interim and final reports in a timely manner.

• Ensure compliance with all grant and funder requirements.

• Relationship Building

• Support leadership in cultivating and maintaining strong relationships with foundation officers and donors.

• Prepare briefing materials for meetings with current and prospective funders.

Qualifications

• Exceptional writing, editing, and storytelling skills with keen attention to detail.

• Ability to synthesize complex information into compelling narratives.

• Familiarity with nonprofit program design and budget development.

• Strong organizational and time management skills; able to manage multiple deadlines.

• Prior experience in grant writing or fundraising (professional, internship, or volunteer).

• Passion for the mission and a willingness to grow with a small nonprofit.

Additional Information

Reports To: Executive Director/Board Chair

Type: Part-time (10–15 hours per week, with potential for growth as funding increases).

Location: Remote

title: UX / Product Designer (Healthcare App Demo – Figma Prototype)
description:
Overview



We’re building a partner-ready demo for a new healthcare-focused app. This is not a full build at this stage. We need a UX/Product Designer who can take a concept, shape the user journey, and produce a high-quality clickable prototype that clearly communicates value to partners.



You’ll work closely with the founder to define the MVP scope, design core flows, and deliver a prototype we can use in stakeholder conversations.



Project Goal



Create a polished, partner-ready demo (primarily in Figma) including user flows, screens, and a clickable prototype. The outcome should feel like a real product, even if it uses mocked data.



Responsibilities



Turn early-stage requirements into clear user journeys and MVP scope



Create user flows for key scenarios (e.g., onboarding, key task completion, dashboard, messaging/updates, basic admin if needed)



Produce wireframes and then high-fidelity UI for mobile (and web if required)



Build a clickable Figma prototype suitable for partner demos



Create a simple design system (components, typography, spacing, UI patterns) to keep screens consistent



Write basic UX copy for key screens (clear, calm, human)



Ensure designs consider privacy and sensitive health context (no dark patterns, sensible consent points)



Collaborate asynchronously, iterate quickly based on feedback, and document decisions



Deliverables (What “done” looks like)



MVP scope and key assumptions captured (1–2 pages)



User flows (Figma/FigJam)



Wireframes for core screens



High-fidelity UI for core screens



Clickable prototype covering the end-to-end demo journey



Component library / mini design system



Handoff notes for a developer (if we move to build)



Required Skills & Experience



Strong portfolio showing mobile app UX and product thinking



Excellent Figma skills (Auto Layout, components, variants, prototyping)



Ability to simplify complex workflows into intuitive steps



Experience designing for sensitive, high-trust domains (healthcare, fintech, insurance, gov, etc.) is a plus



Comfortable working from rough briefs and shaping clarity



Strong communication and ability to explain design rationale



Nice to Have



Experience with healthcare UX, accessibility, consent patterns



Knowledge of iOS/Android design conventions



Ability to produce a lightweight demo script/storyboard for stakeholder presentations



Basic understanding of developer handoff and feasibility constraints



Working Style



Remote, async-friendly



Regular check-ins via WhatsApp/Slack + Loom walkthroughs



Quick iterations and practical decision-making



Time & Budget



Initial engagement: [2–4 weeks] (can extend)



Hours: [10–20 hrs/week] or fixed-price by milestone



Please include your rate and availability



How to Apply (Important)



Please send:



Portfolio link (must include mobile app work)



2–3 relevant examples and what your role was



Your Figma proficiency level



Availability in the next 2 weeks



A short note: how you would approach creating a partner demo prototype from a rough idea

title: Animated Video Editor – YouTube & Shorts/Reels
description:
About Viral Vault Studios:

Viral Vault Studios is a digital content creation company dedicated to producing educational and entertaining videos on YouTube. Our mission is to make online learning fun and engaging by creating content that captivates and informs global audiences. We focus on high-quality faceless YouTube videos across niches like anime recaps, celebrity health, and more.



About the Role:

We are looking for a creative and detail-oriented Animated Video Editor who can produce engaging animated content for YouTube and short-form platforms such as Shorts, Reels, and TikTok. You will transform scripts and voiceovers into visually compelling videos using motion graphics, text animation, and visual storytelling techniques.



What You’ll Do:

- Edit and produce animated videos for YouTube long-form and short-form vertical content

- Turn scripts and voiceovers into dynamic visual stories

- Create motion graphics, character or 2D animations, text animations, transitions, and visual effects

- Design engaging hooks and fast-paced intros optimized for viewer retention

- Adapt content into multiple formats (16:9, 9:16, 1:1)

- Collaborate with scriptwriters and content managers on creative direction

- Source royalty-free assets (images, music, SFX) when needed

- Meet production deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously

- Stay updated with editing trends used by top YouTube and short-form creators



Qualifications:

- Proven experience as an animated video editor or motion graphics editor

- Strong familiarity with YouTube content style and Shorts/Reels editing

- Proficiency in tools such as: After Effects, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, DaVinci Resolve or animation tools such as Blender, Toon Boom, Moho, CapCut, etc.

- Ability to create fast-paced, high-retention edits

- Strong sense of timing, pacing, and visual storytelling

- Ability to work with AI or human voiceovers

- Portfolio or demo reel required



Nice to Have:

- Experience editing faceless YouTube channels

- Knowledge of kinetic typography

- Basic illustration or graphic design skills

- Familiarity with YouTube analytics and audience retention trends

- Experience with templates and asset libraries



If interested in applying, please submit a sample video reel on any sport-related topic and also attach an accessible link to your resume in the
. Please put as subject title "Applying for Animated Video Editor"

title: Sports Scriptwriter for YouTube
description:
About Viral Vault Studios:

Viral Vault Studios is a digital content creation company dedicated to producing educational and entertaining videos on YouTube. Our mission is to make online learning fun and engaging by creating content that captivates and informs global audiences. We focus on high-quality faceless YouTube videos across niches like anime recaps, celebrity health, and more.



About the Role:

We are seeking a YouTube Sports Scriptwriter who can research, conceptualize, and write engaging scripts specifically designed for YouTube videos. You will turn sports stories, breaking news, player profiles, game recaps, and list-style content into compelling scripts that keep viewers watching until the end.



What You’ll Do:

- Write high-retention scripts tailored for YouTube formats (9–12 minutes typical length)

- Create engaging hooks, storytelling arcs, and strong closings

- Research players, teams, leagues, rivalries, and trending sports topics

- Break down complex sports information into entertaining, easy-to-follow narratives

- Develop listicles, “Top 10,” story breakdowns, and documentary-style scripts

- Adapt tone for voiceover narration style content

- Ensure pacing, structure, and viewer engagement techniques are applied

- Collaborate with video editors and thumbnail/title teams

- Revise scripts based on feedback and performance metrics (CTR, AVD, retention)

- Ensure accuracy and original content (no plagiarism)



Topics May Include:

- Basketball, Football/Soccer, American Football

- Boxing/MMA/UFC

- Athlete scandals, comeback stories, and biographies

- Game analyses and highlights

- Sports history deep-dives

- “What happened to…” style content



Qualifications:

- Proven experience writing for YouTube channels (sports niche highly preferred)

- Strong storytelling and conversational writing style

- Ability to write engaging hooks and cliffhangers

- Understanding of YouTube metrics such as watch time, retention, and CTR

- Strong research skills and fact-checking discipline

- Ability to meet deadlines and work with a content calendar

- Portfolio or samples required (sports scripts highly preferred)



Nice to Have:

- Familiarity with narration writing

- Knowledge of YouTube SEO (titles, keywords, audience targeting)

- Passion for sports culture and trends

- Experience working with remote teams



If interested to apply, please submit a sample script of any sports-related topic. Note we will be screening your output for any AI written output. If its 75% AI, you will be disqualified in the process. Put on subject " Applying for Sports Scriptwriter"

title: Male Voice Actor (Anime / General Voice Acting)
description:
About Viral Vault Studios:

Viral Vault Studios is a digital content creation company dedicated to producing educational and entertaining videos on YouTube. Our mission is to make online learning fun and engaging by creating content that captivates and informs global audiences. We focus on high-quality faceless YouTube videos across niches like anime recaps, celebrity health, and more.



Job Overview:

We are looking for a Male Voice Actor with strong skills in anime voice acting, character dubbing, and general voice over work. The ideal candidate can deliver expressive, dynamic, and high-quality audio for anime-style projects, digital media, and storytelling content. This role is perfect for someone passionate about anime characters, voice performance, and remote voice acting.



Key Responsibilities:

- Perform anime-style voices, character voices, and general voice overs based on script direction

- Record clean and high-quality audio using your home studio setup

- Interpret scripts, portray emotions accurately, and follow creative instructions

- Adjust performance based on feedback from the creative team

- Submit recordings on time and communicate any delays

- Maintain consistent audio quality and proper file labeling



Qualifications:

- Preferably female speaking fluent in English

- Experience in voice acting, voice over, anime dubbing, or character narration especially in YouTube

- Ability to perform a range of female anime voices—youthful, mature, energetic, soft, dramatic, comedic, etc

- Clear diction, strong emotion delivery, and acting capabilities.

- Must have a quiet recording environment and quality microphone

- Able to basic audio editing skills (Audacity, Adobe Audition, Reaper)

- Ability to follow directions and adapt quickly

- Reliable and responsive remote worker



How to Apply!

Please submit your resume plus a Vocaroo link using the anime script below.



Anime Script (Frieren-Inspired)

[Scene: A quiet forest at dusk. Soft wind. The female mage walks alone, speaking as if remembering someone important.]



I’ve walked this path more times than I can count… but it still feels different every time. The trees change, the wind shifts, even the scent of the air reminds me of how long it’s been. Mortals live their lives so quickly… and yet, somehow, their memories stay with me longer than they ever stayed in this world.



(soft laugh, bittersweet)

Funny, isn’t it? I used to think time was something endless—something only I had to worry about. But now… now I finally understand why they cherished every sunrise. Every conversation. Every simple 
nt.



(pauses, voice softening)

I can still hear them. Their footsteps, their laughter, the way they argued over the smallest things. I thought those days would last forever. But forever… was only a blink for them.



(more emotional, gentle)

I wish I had said it earlier. “Thank you.” “Don’t leave so quickly.” “Stay just a little longer.” But I said nothing. I thought there would always be another day… another road to walk together. I was wrong.



(looks up at the sky)

But even now, even after all these years… I’m still searching. Not for them—no. Their journey is long over. I’m searching for the meaning behind the time we shared. For the reason their short lives touched mine so deeply.



(light smile)

Maybe that’s what it means to live among humans. To learn, little by little, how precious each fleeting 
nt truly is. And to carry those 
nts with you, no matter how far you travel… or how long you remain.



(whispers)

I’m still walking, you know. And I hope… wherever you are… you’re watching the path ahead of me.

title: PowerPoint / Prezi Pitch Deck Designer (Healthcare App Partner Pitch)
description:
Overview



I’m preparing a high-impact pitch for a healthcare app (early-stage) to bring on partners. I need an experienced PowerPoint and/or Prezi specialist who can help research, shape the story, and design a polished, credible final pitch.



This is not a generic “make it pretty” job. I need someone who understands pitch structure, evidence, and narrative flow, and can turn rough content into a deck that lands with senior stakeholders.



Key Outputs



A final pitch deck in PowerPoint or Prezi (your recommendation based on the story and audience)



A clear storyline with strong structure: problem ? opportunity ? solution ? why now ? traction/validation ? partner ask



Visually consistent design (templates, typography, icons, charts)



Optional: short “talk track” notes per slide and a 1-page executive summary



Responsibilities



Gather and organise inputs (notes, rough slides, product concept, target users, partner types)



Light research to strengthen the pitch (market context, credible stats, competitor positioning, relevant trends)



Create a recommended deck outline and slide-by-slide storyboard



Design the deck with strong visual hierarchy, simple diagrams, and clear messaging



Build clean charts/graphics and “how it works” visuals (user journey, workflow, architecture at a high level)



Iterate quickly based on feedback, keeping version control clean



Ensure the deck feels appropriate for a healthcare context (trust, safety, privacy-aware messaging)



Required Skills



Proven experience designing partner/investor pitch decks



Advanced PowerPoint skills (master slides, layouts, animations/transitions used appropriately) and/or Prezi (zoomable canvas storytelling)



Strong information design: simplifying complexity without dumbing it down



Excellent written English and ability to tighten copy



Ability to work from ambiguous inputs and create clarity



Nice to Have



Experience in healthcare, healthtech, or regulated industries



Ability to create simple product/UI mock screens (or polish existing screenshots/Figma exports)



Experience with data storytelling and sourcing credible references



Engagement Details



Timeline: [e.g., 1–2 weeks] to first full draft, then refinements



Estimated effort: [e.g., 15–30 hours total]



Working style: async + [2] short calls (kick-off + final rehearsal)



Please share your rate (hourly or fixed price) and availability



What to Send When Applying



Portfolio link (must include decks you’ve designed)



1–2 examples of a pitch deck you’ve led end-to-end (story + design)



Which tool you recommend for this pitch (PowerPoint vs Prezi) and why



Your availability over the next two weeks



Paid Trial

Shortlisted candidates may be invited to complete a paid mini-task: propose a deck outline + redesign one slide to confirm fit.

title: E-Commerce Traffic & Growth Specialist (Full-Time)
description:
The Mission: Drive Revenue, Not Just Traffic



We’re not hiring someone to “run ads” or “do tasks.”



We’re hiring a growth partner to own the traffic, sales, and conversion strategy across three actively selling e-commerce stores.



You must bring proof of scaling brands — from six to multiple six and seven figures — and have clear strategies that align with both paid traffic (Google, Meta, YouTube, etc.) and organic growth (SEO, content strategy, and conversion optimization).



We are not your average Shopify store. We’re a fast-moving wellness brand with a signature product stack, a proven customer base, and a bold goal to hit $100K+/month revenue in the next 90 days.



You will be given full strategic control of all inbound growth. This includes traffic generation, offer testing, sales tracking, landing page structure, funnel optimization, ad creative input, and ongoing reporting.



There will be no hand-holding. This is a leadership role, not an assistant role.



? Top 3 Skills you must have:

SEO Strategy & Organic Revenue Growth

Google Search Console & Technical SEO Analysis

GEO / AI Search Optimization (SGE, AI Overviews, Entity SEO)



???? You Must Be:

A proven growth hacker for e-commerce, not just a media buyer

Strategic and analytical, but not afraid to roll up your sleeves

Obsessed with conversions, ROAS, LTV, CPA, and testing offers

Focused on what moves revenue, not vanity metrics

Able to build and scale offers across multiple platforms

Comfortable running Meta Ads, Google Ads, and YouTube Ads

Knowledgeable in
 flows, SEO, and funnel optimization

Highly independent, reliable, and resourceful



???? Requirements:

4+ years of direct e-commerce growth experience (show proof)

Case study or 2-minute Loom video showing e-commerce store(s) you've scaled (revenue results + backend data)

Strong understanding of eCom KPIs: CAC, ROAS, LTV, CTR, CVR

Familiarity with Shopify/WooCommerce, Klaviyo, Meta Ads, Google Ads, and landing page builders

Solid experience driving traffic organically + through paid campaigns

Understanding of upsells, AOV, bundling, and offer strategy



IMPORTANT: Read Before Applying



Sovereign Spirits Inc. operates in the peptide, health optimization, and weight release space, which often overlaps with gray market products. This includes research-use-only compounds, novel ingredients, and niche wellness products not broadly understood or accepted by mainstrea
dia and ad platforms.



As a result, our marketing requires advanced knowledge of compliance-safe copywriting, funnel strategy, platform-specific ad policies, and indirect persuasion tactics. If you're not already familiar with working around restricted ad categories, gray-area supplements, or platform workarounds (e.g., running native,
, SEO, or third-party traffic instead of Meta/Google ads alone), this is NOT the right fit.



We do not promote illegal or unsafe products. But due to public and regulatory misunderstanding of peptides and gray-market wellness compounds, we often face restrictions and ad rejections. Our success depends on clever, strategic, and ethical marketing that respects platform policies while still converting.



Please do not apply unless:



You are comfortable working in non-mainstream wellness spaces



You’ve navigated compliance-heavy industries (CBD, crypto, nootropics, hormone support, biohacking, etc.)



You’re resourceful, creative, and okay with testing stealthy but ethical strategies



You have a solid understanding of conversion psychology and customer journey building outside of standard ad platforms



Monthly Retainer + Performance Bonus Opportunity

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time (Contract-to-Hire)

title: Part-Time Real Estate Cold Caller (Acquisitions) - $6/hr + $250 Commissions
description:
About Us



We’re a U.S.-based real estate investing company that buys properties directly from homeowners. Our business runs on integrity, speed, and strong communication. We’re building a small, elite team and we’re looking for a reliable, experienced real estate cold caller who wants consistent work and performance-based upside.



If you are honest, detail-oriented, hungry to win, and actually do what you say you will do — you’ll fit in perfectly here.





Position Overview



We are hiring a part-time Real Estate Cold Caller to call homeowners, check if they are interested in selling their house, collect basic property information, and schedule callbacks or appointments with our acquisitions (purchase) manager.



This is NOT a beginner role. You must already have successful real estate cold calling experience.





Responsibilities



• Call lists of homeowners using provided data and script

• Ask if they are interested in selling their property

• Build quick rapport and keep the conversation natural

• Ask basic qualifying questions and take accurate notes

• Tag and update call results correctly

• Schedule follow-up calls or appointments for interested sellers

• Communicate clearly with me and the team

• Be consistent, reliable, and professional every shift





Requirements (Please Read Carefully)



• Proven experience in real estate cold calling (acquisitions or lead gen)

• Confident, calm, and clear English speaking voice

• Fast, stable, and reliable internet connection

• Must be detail-oriented, honest, and organized

• Must be coach-able, positive, and have a can-do attitude

• Must be reliable and show up on time, every time

• Must be able to start by Tuesday at 3:00 PM U.S. EST

• Must have NO conflicting job or schedule during working hours

• Must be comfortable scheduling follow-ups and appointments

• Must communicate well and respond quickly





Work Schedule (U.S. EST)



• Monday – Thursday: 3:00 PM – 7:00 PM EST

• Friday: 2:00 PM – 6:00 PM EST

• Part-time, consistent weekly schedule





Compensation



• $6/hour + $250 commission per closed deal

• Paid regularly via Wise or PayPal

• Long-term opportunity for the right person

• Training and scripts provided





How to Apply (IMPORTANT – Follow Exactly)



To apply, you must:

 1. Send a message with the subject line:

“Real Estate Cold Caller – [Your Name]”

 2. Record a short voice sample of you saying this exact script:



“Hi, is this the owner of 123 Main Street? I was calling to see if you might be interested in selling your property there.”



 3. In your message, include:

• Your real estate cold calling experience (what you called, for who, and results if possible)

• What dialer/CRM you’ve used (Mojo, CallTools, Batch, Podio, etc.)

• Confirm you can work the exact schedule listed above

• Confirm you can start by Tuesday at 3 PM EST

• Confirm you are happy with $6/hr + commission

• Your internet speed and reliability



Applications without a voice recording will be ignored.





Who We’re Looking For



We want someone who is:

• Trustworthy

• Detail-oriented

• Fast learner

• Positive and hungry

• Calm, confident, and easy to talk to

• Coachable and consistent

• Actually does what they say they will do



If you’re just “trying” cold calling, this is not for you.

If you’re a real real estate cold caller who wants steady work + upside — we want you.

title: AI Video Production Specialist — YouTube Channel Builder | Reverse Engineering Successful Channels | Python | AI Coding
description:
# AI Video Production Specialist — YouTube Channel Builder | Channel Research & Replication | Python/AI Coding | Thumbnails | Automation



---



## Job Description



We run a growing network of YouTube channels producing AI-assisted video content at scale. We're looking for someone with an obsessive eye for detail who can take any successful YouTube channel as a reference and recreate everything about it — the thumbnail style, title format, video structure, pacing, transitions, fonts, colors, music choices, subtitle style, description format, tags, upload schedule — down to the last pixel. Then put it into production and move on to the next one.



This is a programming-heavy role. Our videos are built programmatically — Python scripts, FFmpeg, AI APIs, TTS engines, image generation pipelines, subtitle generators, and automated assembly. You're not dragging clips around in a timeline. You're writing and modifying code that produces videos. If you can't work in a terminal, read Python, and debug errors, this isn't for you.



---



## The Core Job



1. You actively research and find successful YouTube channels — both channels already using AI production and channels that aren't but could be replicated at scale using AI tools and automation. You identify opportunities and bring them to us.

2. I also send you YouTube channel or video references to replicate.

3. You study every single detail: thumbnail layout, font choices, color palette, text positioning, background style, title patterns, video length, intro style, pacing, music, voice tone, subtitle font/size/color/position, description template, tags, upload frequency, end screens, pinned comments — EVERYTHING.

4. You assess what can be automated vs what needs manual work, and determine if the channel format can be profitably produced at scale.

5. You document it all in a clear spec sheet.

6. You configure and code our production pipeline to replicate that exact style — using Python, Claude Code, and AI tools to build or modify scripts for thumbnails, TTS voiceovers, subtitle formatting, and video assembly.

7. You produce test videos and compare them side-by-side with the reference until they're indistinguishable in style and quality.

8. You launch the channel into production.

9. Repeat for the next channel.



---



## What You'll Be Doing Day-to-Day



- Researching and identifying successful YouTube channels that are either fully AI-produced or could be replicated at scale using AI — analyzing their niche, content format, view counts, growth trajectory, and production style to determine if they're viable targets

- Analyzing successful YouTube channels and breaking down exactly what makes them work (visual style, content structure, production quality, metadata strategy)

- Writing and modifying Python scripts using AI coding assistants (Claude Code, Cursor, etc.) to customize production pipelines for each channel's unique style

- Recreating thumbnail templates that match reference channels precisely (fonts, colors, layouts, image styles, text effects)

- Configuring TTS voice settings, subtitle styles, video pacing, and assembly parameters to match reference content

- Debugging and troubleshooting production code — reading error logs, fixing broken scripts, improving existing automation

- Quality-checking every output against the reference — catching details others would miss (wrong font weight, subtitle position off by a few pixels, color slightly wrong, pacing too fast)

- Managing video uploads, metadata, descriptions, tags, and scheduling across multiple channels

- Building new automation features and tools as needed

- Testing new AI tools and techniques to improve output quality



---



## Must-Haves



- Proven experience with AI video production — you have actually used AI tools AND code to produce video content at scale, not just plugged prompts into websites. You must be able to show examples.

- Experience programmatically creating video content or livestreams — using Python, FFmpeg, automation scripts, APIs, or similar tools to generate videos through code, not manual editing. If you've only ever used Premiere or CapCut by hand, this isn't the role.

- Python programming ability — you will be writing, reading, modifying, and debugging Python scripts daily. This includes working with APIs (TTS, image generation, AI models), FFmpeg commands, file processing, and automation logic. AI coding assistants like Claude Code will help you, but you still need to understand what the code is doing.

- Comfortable working in a terminal / command line (running scripts, SSH into servers, navigating folders, reading error logs, managing processes)

- Obsessive attention to detail — if you're the kind of person who notices when a font is 1px too large or a color is slightly off, you're our person. If you think "close enough" is good enough, this role isn't for you.

- Strong visual eye — you can look at a thumbnail and immediately identify the font, layout technique, color values, and effects used

- Understanding of YouTube (what makes channels successful, how the algorithm works, metadata optimization)

- Strong English communication skills

- Self-starter who figures things out independently

- Willing to use their own Claude Pro account for AI coding (we reimburse the $20/month subscription cost)



---



## Big Pluses



- Experience researching YouTube niches, analyzing channel performance, and identifying content opportunities

- Experience managing or growing YouTube channels

- Graphic design skills (Photoshop, Canva, Figma)

- FFmpeg knowledge

- Experience with TTS tools (ElevenLabs, Edge TTS, Kokoro, etc.)

- Linux servers / SSH / VPS management

- AI image generation experience (Stable Diffusion, Flux, Midjourney, DALL-E)

- Video editing in any NLE (Premiere, DaVinci Resolve, CapCut)

- Experience with subtitle/caption styling

- Git / version control basics

- Experience building or working with automation pipelines



---



## Work Details



- Position: Part-time (20 hours/week)

- Rate: $10 - $15 USD/hour depending on experience and skills

- Hours: Flexible schedule, must overlap with North American hours for communication

- Location: Remote (Philippines-based preferred)

- Start: Immediately

- Tools provided: Access to our servers, dashboards, and production systems. Claude Pro subscription reimbursed monthly.



---



## How to Apply



IMPORTANT: Applications that don't follow these instructions will be ignored.



Start your application message with the word KOKORO and include the phrase "blue dog" somewhere in your application to confirm you've read the entire posting.



Then answer these questions:



1. What is your experience with AI video production or programmatically creating video content? Describe the specific tools, scripts, or pipelines you've used. What did you build? How many videos were you producing? What was automated vs manual?



2. Go to this YouTube channel:
