title: Android or iOS App Developer
description:
[Caution]

If you are a meticulous developer who is passionate about creating smooth, high-performance mobile experiences and takes pride in writing clean, scalable code, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires a deep understanding of both front-end and back-end mobile development, a keen eye for UI/UX implementation, and the ability to think strategically about the product's architecture and future growth.

If you view app development as simply translating designs into code mostly relying on AI without considering response to errors or bugs, security, and the end-user experience, this role may be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about building a robust, engaging, and seamless mobile extension for a thriving online community (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Android/iOS App Developer (synced with our Community Website)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Project



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $700–$1,400(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to key project milestones, such as a successful app launch and achieving performance metrics. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills.



[What You’ll Be Doing]

Your role is to be the technical architect and builder of our community website. You will be responsible for creating a high-quality, full-featured platform that provides a seamless and engaging experience for our users. 

Your main tasks will include ONE or MULTIPLE of:



a) API Integration & Data Synchronization: You will be responsible for integrating with our website's backend via APIs to ensure all data (user profiles, content, messages) is perfectly synchronized in real-time between the app and the website, providing a single, unified experience for our users.



b) Native Community Feature Development: You will build the core interactive features of our community—such as content feeds, user profiles, and forums—within the app. This involves creating an intuitive, mobile-first interface for user-generated content submission and ensuring all features have a native look and feel on both iOS and Android.



c) In-App Messaging & Support Systems: You will develop a secure and reliable private messaging system for our users. This includes implementing push notifications to ensure timely communication and integrating a streamlined way for users to access our support channels directly from the app.



d) UI/UX Implementation & Performance Optimization: You will translate UI/UX designs into a pixel-perfect, functional application. Your focus will be on creating a fast, fluid, and responsive user experience, optimizing code and interactions to eliminate lag and ensure consistency across all devices and screen sizes.



e) Comprehensive Testing & Quality Assurance: You will be responsible for rigorously testing the app to identify and fix bugs before launch. This includes creating detailed test cases for all features, covering edge cases, and testing for compatibility across multiple physical devices and OS versions.



f) App Store Deployment & Management: You will manage the entire process of submitting and launching the application on the Google Play Store and Apple App Store. This requires a deep understanding of each store's guidelines to ensure a smooth approval process and optimizing the listings for discoverability.



g) Long-Term Maintenance & Scalability: After launch, you will provide ongoing maintenance, fix bugs, and release updates to ensure compatibility with new iOS and Android versions. You will build the app on a scalable architecture to make it easy to add new features and handle a growing user base in the future





[A Typical Week May Look Like This]



During Development: Writing clean, scalable code for new features. Collaborating with the team on API specifications. Implementing UI designs and animations. Debugging and testing builds on various devices. Committing code to our Git repository.



Post-Launch: Monitoring app performance and crash reports. Planning and developing new features based on community feedback. Releasing updates to ensure compatibility with new iOS and Android versions.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to create a fast, reliable, and intuitive mobile app that serves as a seamless extension of our online community. By building a high-quality application, you will empower our members to connect and share on the go, significantly boosting user engagement and making our community an essential part of their daily lives.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has a Strong Portfolio: You have verifiable experience building and launching native mobile applications. Not necessary, but it's best if you have live examples in the Apple App Store and/or Google Play Store. Experience with community or social media apps is a huge plus.



b) Is Technically Proficient: You are an expert in your chosen mobile development stack (e.g., Swift/Kotlin, React Native, Flutter) and have deep experience working with REST APIs. You follow best practices and write clean, maintainable code.



c) Is a Natural Problem-Solver: When faced with a technical challenge like a performance bottleneck, you have a logical process for diagnosing the root cause and implementing an effective solution.



d) Is a Clear & Proactive Communicator: You can explain complex technical concepts simply.



e) Is Product-Minded: You care about the end-user experience. You think critically about features and can offer valuable insights to help make the product better.



f) Communicates Effectively and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and understand the importance of clear communication within a remote team.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean? Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



-Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.

-The opportunity to own a project and build an exciting product from the ground up.

-Long-term growth opportunities as our community and app scale.

-A supportive environment where your technical expertise is valued and your impact is visible.



[About Us]

We are building a vibrant online community for content creators. Our mission is to provide a space where members can connect, learn, and grow. Your role in building our mobile app is essential in taking that mission to the next level.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “iOS App Developer” or "Android App Developer" whichever best identifies you, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Please indicate which items (a–f) from the [What You’ll Be Doing] section above you can handle professionally and confidently.



2) Work History: Based on your response to Question 1, please describe your experience for each item (a–f).



3) Portfolio: Include direct links to your two best live web applications you’ve built. Do not include all your projects. Time is very limited. Briefly describe your specific role and the tech stack used in those two projects.



4) Technical Challenge: Imagine our users are reporting that the app feels slow and "janky" when they scroll through the main content feed. What are the first five steps you would take to diagnose and fix this performance issue?



5) Architectural Scenario: You are tasked with building the in-app private messaging feature. Briefly describe the high-level architecture you would choose to ensure messages are delivered in real-time and that the system is both reliable and secure. Mention any key patterns or technologies you might use.



6) Behind the Scenes. What is a popular trend, library, framework, or 'best practice' in mobile development that you believe is overrated or a poor choice in most situations? Justify your position with a specific example from a past project where you either used it and regretted it, or successfully argued against using it.



7) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to languages, frameworks, libraries, and tools for mobile app development? Please mention why you prefer them.



8) AI in Your Workflow: Although AI-generated code can save time, it may include subtle bugs or security issues that less experienced developers might miss. Explain where and how you use AI to improve your development productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI. (We expect you aren't using AI to answer these questions, as they will be discussed in the interview.)



9) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



10) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer a long-term collaboration.



11) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Video Editor(YouTube Long-form)
description:
[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract

You may choose either Part-time(+3hrs/day) or Full-time



[Caution]

You’ll be using plugins in After Effects for motion and transitions, so please continue only if you’re already comfortable and experienced working in After Effects.



[Salary]

-$100 USD per project

-$300 USD commitment bonus after completing 10 projects (you will be paid $100+$300 for every 10th project you complete)

-You don't have to search for the visual elements such as video clips, images, talking-heads since all the elements will be provided.

-I can provide 1~2 projects each week as long as you can manage (our current editor says he can consistently handle around 1.5–2 projects per week after being fully aligned with the workflow and preferred style).

-Expect the first project will take longer as we need to adjust to the desired working style. But as we get on to the 2nd, 3rd, ... it will take less time as there will be less corrections to make.



[What You’ll Do]

IMPORTANT-> Here's a sample video(you must watch it before applying): youtu.be/GCzZE6iEp1I?si=4eywqeaoGPkUoPFp

-All the ingredients(images, video clips, voice-over, talking-head, BGM and script) for the video will be provided.

-You will select images that best match the context from the provided asset folder, place them at the appropriate timestamps, and add motion, transitions, sound effects, and background music.

-Use After Effect plugins such as Mister Horse and Flow to add dynamic motions.

-The images or video clips must match with what's being spoken by the voice-over.

-Collaborate with me or our team to ensure the visuals meet aesthetic and desired output.



*In the beginning, your edits will get a few rounds of feedback for refinement while adjusting to the preferred video style. But as you're aligned and become familiar, you won't need my feedback and refinement as much.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:

-Communicates effectively and values mutual respect.

-Has a creative editing skill for visually appealing videos; to avoid viewer's boredom.

-Has strong time management skills to meet deadlines.

-Is accountable and committed to the role.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. 

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your schedule. (You’re welcome to work at night and submit your draft. While you’re asleep, it will be reviewed and feedback will be ready within 12 hours.)

-Long-term growth opportunities as the channel expands.

-A supportive environment that values creativity and contributions.



[About Us]

We help YouTube creators master storytelling techniques to captivate audiences and achieve viral success. Your role will play a key part in bringing our vision to life and empowering creators worldwide.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “VIDEO EDIT”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:

1. Portfolio: Share 2-3 of your best projects involving video editing with motion graphic.

2. Work History: Explain any experience or projects involving motion graphics or After Effects.

3. After Effects Skill: Please rate your After Effects skill level on a 5-star scale.

4. Available Hours: Let us know when you are available for our work each day of the week(For example:Monday: 11:00AM - 2:00PM, Tuesday: 3:30PM - 8:00PM, Wednesday: ..., etc)

5. Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 3 months with additional projects forward.

6. Whether or not you're willing to be on a Zoo
eting: We prefer Zoo
eting because this shows your accountability as well as it drives our team to the same goal together.



I will respond to your application in 7 days all at once.

title: Proofreading | Content Enhancer
description:
[Caution]

If you are a slow reader, this job may become a torture for you, so I'd like you to beware.

But if you're a fast reader with keen eyes for the details, this can be a fun part time job for you.



Also, if you were going to use AI for this task, please step out. I discovered that you cannot use AI tools for this particular task, as you'd need to pick the best sentence among the 5 versions of the same context for each sentence one by one. I've tried this task with AI myself, and trust me it's my current best friend, but it cannot give me the result at the human level that I'd like. So, no AIs period.



So, only read further if you are confident in your ability to consistently select the most effective phrasing to build a high-quality, engaging video script.



This role requires a keen eye for detail and a strong sense of narrative flow. If you have a passion for reading long scripts and enjoy learning about storytelling techniques while phrasing impactful sentences, this position will be a great fit.



This job relies on your human judgment to discern which sentence best serves the story and engages the viewer. The goal is to create a script that is clear, compelling, and flows seamlessly from one idea to the next.





[Job Title]

Proofreading - selecting best sentences among 5 variations





[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract





[Base Payment]

You’ll receive $100 USD per 10 project.

Currently, the other assistant gets each project done in 3-4 hours.

I can provide 3-7 projects per week, depending on your speed.

Each project involves working on a script for my video (each project = around 5000 words in English).





[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus through revenue sharing, depending on how well the long-form YouTube video performs in terms of views. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.





[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your primary task is to assemble the best possible version of a video script by choosing the most effective sentence from a set of options.



For a script of approximately 5000 words, each sentence will be presented with five different variations. Your job is to read through all five options and select the one that works best in the context of the paragraph and the overall script. You will repeat this process for every sentence until the entire script is complete.



Here’s a step-by-step process for clarity:



Step 1. Understand the Context - You will receive a complete script where each sentence is accompanied by five alternative versions.



Step 2. Select the Best Sentences - Choose the option that offers the best clarity, flow, and impact. Your selection should contribute to a cohesive and engaging narrative.



Step 3. Double Check - Once you have made a selection for every sentence, read through the completed script one last time to ensure it is coherent and polished.



Step 4. Submit the final script.



*Note:

-The first project may take a bit longer as we align on tone and style with feedback and revisions. I’ll provide detailed feedback on your first completed script to help guide that alignment.



-I intend to reduce the revisions down to 1, but initially we may need more.



-With each run, you will become more familiar with the content style, and the selection process will become faster and more intuitive on your end.





[Goal]



The goal is to craft a highly engaging and easy-to-follow script by meticulously selecting the best version of every sentence. This process ensures the final script is polished and holds the audience's attention from start to finish.



This method is designed to be more efficient than rewriting from scratch. Instead of spending time guessing my intended tone, you can focus entirely on choosing the strongest lines from pre-written options, which keeps the process focused and effective.





[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



-Has an advanced or native level of written English and a strong grasp of grammar, idioms, and slang. This is crucial for quickly and accurately judging which phrases are most effective.



-Is coachable and eager to grow with the channel.



-Communicates effectively and values mutual respect.



-Has strong time management skills to meet deadlines.



-Is accountable and committed to the role.



-Can collaborate with me or our team to ensure the content’s vibe aligns with our creative vision.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. If you need to step away, just let me or your manager know when. Your feedback also helps us improve. We understand life happens, even if you need to leave tomorrow, but ghosting causes confusion and delays. Our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.





[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.

-Long-term growth opportunities as the channel scales.

-A supportive environment that celebrates creativity and input.





[About Us]

We help YouTube creators master storytelling techniques to captivate audiences and achieve viral success. Your role will be key in polishing our content and empowering creators worldwide.





[MUST READ]

In your application, include:

1. Start your response with the following word at the top: "IREADFAST"

2. Experience or Work History: Share any relevant experience in proofreading, editing, or writing.

3. Why you’re Interested: Tell us why you’re excited about this opportunity.

4. Available Hours: Let us know your general availability each day of the week (For example: Monday: 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM, Tuesday: 3:30 PM - 8:00 PM, etc.).

5. Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to be available for this job. We prefer a commitment of at least 3 months.

6. Your Internet Availability: Let us know your monthly internet data limit (e.g., GBs or Unlimited).

7. Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm if you are willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings to align on goals and build team synergy.



I will respond to all applications within 7-15 days.



-----Job Posting Ends here-----









[Sample of what the task will look like]

*2025_11_28 Note:

This is the proofreading task we worked on earlier, which has already been turned into a video.

The proofreader was asked to choose the best version among the 4 on their judgement.



((Script begins here))



### **[Body Section 1 - on T&T - with humorous lines]**



[Original phrase]: Section Title: The Attention Bomb: Engineering a Title & Thumbnail That Commands the Click

[Refined phrase v1]: Section Title: The Scientific Click: Engineering a Title & Thumbnail That’s Impossible to Ignore

[Refined phrase v2]: Section Title: The Authority Formula: How to Engineer a Title & Thumbnail That Gets the Click Without Selling Your Soul

[Refined phrase v3]: Section Title: The Ethical Clickbait: How to Engineer a Title & Thumbnail That's Both Irresistible and Honest



***



[Original phrase]: On YouTube, you don't get a second chance to make a first impression.

[Refined phrase v1]: On YouTube, your first impression is your only impression.

[Refined phrase v2]: On YouTube, the viewer judges your video’s cover in about 0.3 seconds. No pressure.

[Refined phrase v3]: On YouTube, your thumbnail is on trial and the viewer is the judge, jury, and executioner.



***



[Original phrase]: Your title and thumbnail are your digital handshake, your movie poster, and your opening line all rolled into one.

[Refined phrase v1]: Your title and thumbnail are your video's entire resume, and the viewer is the hiring manager with a zero-second attention span.

[Refined phrase v2]: Your title and thumbnail are your video’s dating profile. The viewer is swiping, and they will judge you based on one photo and the bio.

[Refined phrase v3]: Your title and thumbnail are the book cover. And everyone, absolutely everyone, judges a book by its cover.



***



[Original phrase]: Most creators get it wrong.

[Refined phrase v1]: And most creators fail the interview.

[Refined phrase v2]: And most creators get swiped left.

[Refined phrase v3]: And most creators stay on the shelf.



And most creators get it wrong.





***



[Original phrase]: They either scream for attention with hyperbolic clickbait ("MY INSANE TRANSFORMATION!") or they're so boring they become invisible ("My Fitness Journey").

[Refined phrase v1]: They either scream for attention with exaggerated clickbait ("30 DAYS TO EXPLODE MY BICEP!") or they're so boring they become invisible ("Leg Day Vlog #72").

[Refined phrase v2]: They’re either the person at the party yelling “LOOK AT ME!” or the person in the corner who is so quiet they get mistaken for a coat rack.

[Refined phrase v3]: They're either dressed in a neon-yellow suit lighting fireworks, or they're wearing camouflage.



***



[Original phrase]: But in his viral video, “How Much Muscle Did I Gain In 365 Days? (Scientific Experiment)”, Jeff Nippard doesn't shout, and he isn't boring.

[Refined phrase v1]: But Jeff Nippard doesn't use hype, and he isn't boring.

[Refined phrase v2]: But Jeff Nippard doesn't yell, and he isn't a coat rack. He’s the interesting person in the middle that everyone wants to talk to.

[Refined phrase v3]: Jeff isn't wearing a neon suit or camouflage. He's wearing a perfectly tailored suit.



***



[Original phrase]: He engineers a question so compelling that clicking becomes an impulse.

[Refined phrase v1]: He engineers a question so interesting that clicking on it feels like a reflex.

[Refined phrase v2]: He crafts a question so magnetic that your mouse cursor starts moving towards it.

[Refined phrase v3]: He creates a question so good it feels like your brain has an allergy to not knowing the answer.



***



[Original phrase]: This is his first strategy, and it’s a masterclass: Don’t make a claim, create a contract.

[Refined phrase v1]: This is his first strategy: Don’t be a salesman making a pitch. Be a scientist proposing an experiment the viewer can't help but want to see the results of.

[Refined phrase v2]: This is his first move, and it's brilliant: Don't make a claim that can be dismissed. Ask a question that must be answered.

[Refined phrase v3]: This is the core of it: Don't write an advertisement. Write a summons.



***



[Original phrase]: Let's break down the two elements of this contract.

[Refined phrase v1]: Let's analyze the two parts of this contract.

[Refined phrase v2]: Let's pop the hood and look at the two key parts of this engine.

[Refined phrase v3]: Let's look at the two key ingredients in this recipe.



***



[Original phrase]: Part 1: The Title - A Testable Promise

[Refined phrase v1]: Part 1: The Title, which acts as a The Official Research Question

[Refined phrase v2]: Part 1: The Title, which acts as the 'Research Question'.

[Refined phrase v3]: Part 1: The Title, which is the Central Mystery.



***



[Original phrase]: Jeff's title isn't a statement; it's a hypothesis. Let's dissect it:

[Refined phrase v1]: Jeff's title isn't a statement; it's a hypothesis. Let's dissect it.

[Refined phrase v2]: Jeff’s title isn’t a statement; it’s the setup to a mystery. Let’s look for clues.

[Refined phrase v3]: Jeff's title isn't a statement; it's the opening line of a cliffhanger. Let's see how the episode ends.



***



[Original phrase]: The Core Question: "How Much Muscle Did I Gain..."

[Refined phrase v1]: First, the Core Question: "How Much Muscle Did I Gain..."

[Refined phrase v2]: First, the Mystery Itself: "How Much Muscle Did I Gain..."

[Refined phrase v3]: First, The Unanswered Variable: "How Much Muscle Did I Gain..."



***

((continues this way until the end of the script)).

title: Paraplanner
description:
Job Title: Paraplanner



Company Overview:



We’re a team of hard-working, enthusiastic professionals who strive to help as many Australians as possible improve their financial position by reviewing, researching, and executing quality financial advice with only you in mind.



Job Description:



We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Paraplanner to join our dynamic financial planning team. As a Paraplanner, you will play a crucial role in supporting our financial advisors by preparing comprehensive financial plans and assisting in providing exceptional service to our clients. Your meticulous attention to detail and analytical expertise will be instrumental in ensuring the accuracy and effectiveness of our financial advice.



Responsibilities:



1. Financial Analysis: Conduct an in-depth analysis of clients' financial situations, including their assets, liabilities, income, and expenses. Utilize various financial planning tools and software to assess their current financial status accurately.



2. Preparation of Financial Plans: Collaborate with financial advisors to create comprehensive financial plans tailored to each client's specific goals and objectives. Assist in developing strategies to achieve short-term and long-term financial objectives.



3. Investment Research: Conduct research on investment options, market trends, and financial products to assist in recommending appropriate investment strategies aligned with clients' risk tolerance and financial goals.



4. Compliance and Documentation: Ensure all regulatory and compliance requirements are met when preparing financial plans. Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records and documentation.



5. Report Generation: Prepare clear and concise reports summarizing financial plans, investment proposals, and recommendations for clients. Present complex financial information in an understandable manner.



6. Client Interaction: Collaborate closely with financial advisors to support client meetings. Participate in client discussions to gather relevant information and address any inquiries related to the financial planning process.



7. Portfolio Analysis: Analyze and monitor client investment portfolios to ensure alignment with their financial goals and risk preferences. Provide recommendations for portfolio rebalancing as necessary.



8. Market Research: Stay updated with industry trends, economic developments, and changes in financial regulations. Use this knowledge to enhance the quality of financial planning services.



9. Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the ongoing improvement of the financial planning process and recommend enhancements to increase efficiency and productivity.



Requirements:



1. Education: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. Additional certifications such as Certified Financial Planner (CFP) or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) are desirable.



2. Experience: Proven experience as a Paraplanner or in a similar role within the financial planning industry is preferred.



3. Financial Knowledge: A strong understanding of financial planning concepts, investment strategies, and tax considerations.



4. Analytical Skills: Proficient in financial analysis, with the ability to interpret complex financial data and develop practical solutions.



5. Software Proficiency: Familiarity with financial planning software, portfolio management tools, and Microsoft Office suite.



6. Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with tea
mbers and clients.



7. Organizational Skills: Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks while adhering to deadlines.



8. Ethics: Demonstrated commitment to maintaining the highest ethical standards and client confidentiality.



This is an excellent opportunity for a talented Paraplanner to join our reputable financial planning firm. We offer a supportive work environment, ongoing professional development, and the chance to make a positive impact on our clients' financial well-being. If you possess the required skills and passion for financial planning, we encourage you to apply and become a valued member of our team.

title: (Part Time) Senior QA Engineer
description:
Location: Fully Remote

Type: Part-time (approximately 20 hours per week)



About the Role

We are looking for a skilled and experienced QA Engineer to help ensure the quality and reliability of our Next.js and Node.js applications and APIs. You will work closely with our engineering and product teams to test features, identify issues early, and help deliver a high-quality product to our users.



This is a fully remote, part-time role suited for someone who is hands-on, detail-oriented, and comfortable testing both frontend and backend systems.



Responsibilities

Design, execute, and maintain manual and automated tests for a Next.js frontend and Node.js backend

Test RESTful APIs for correctness, performance, and edge cases

Collaborate with developers throughout the development lifecycle to prevent defects

Create and maintain test plans, test cases, and QA documentation

Identify, document, and track bugs through resolution

Perform regression, smoke, integration, and exploratory testing

Validate releases across multiple environments

Advocate for quality, usability, and reliability across the product



Requirements

5+ years of experience in QA or software testing

Strong experience testing JavaScript-based web applications

Hands-on experience testing Next.js, Node.js, and backend APIs

Solid understanding of HTTP, REST, and JSON

Experience with API testing tools such as Postman or similar

Experience with test automation tools such as Playwright, Cypress, Jest, or Selenium

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines

Strong analytical, debugging, and communication skills



Nice to Have

Experience with performance or load testing

Experience working with cloud platforms 

Experience testing authentication, authorization, or security-sensitive systems

Experience working in agile development environments

title: Content Writing VA (Audience Engagement)
description:
[Caution]

We are continuously expanding our brand's reach and are looking for a writer who can build genuine connections with our audience.



If you believe that great content is about building trust, fostering community, and providing immense value, this role will be a great fit. This position requires deep empathy, exceptional storytelling skills, and a genuine interest in helping our audience solve their problems. You will be responsible for shaping our brand's voice and authority from the ground up.



If you view content as simply a numbers game of ranking keywords and driving quick sales, this role may be a challenge for you. Only read further if you’re passionate about creating content that educates, inspires, and builds lasting relationships with an audience that trusts what we say and believes in what we do.



[Job Title]

Content Writing VA (Trust-Building & Audience Engagement)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is $
USD (for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to the quality of your content and its impact on audience trust. Metrics could include audience engagement, content-driven community growth, and positive feedback. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the voice of our brand, building a bridge of trust between us and our audience. You will be responsible for the end-to-end content creation process, ensuring every piece is valuable, credible, and engaging. Your main tasks will include:



a) Empathetic & In-Depth Research: Going beyond surface-level data to deeply understand our audience's pain points, desires, and values, and sourcing credible, authoritative information to build a foundation of trust in every piece of content.



b) Strategic & Trust-Focused Content Planning: Brainstorming and developing content ideas and narratives that prioritize educating and helping the audience over direct selling. You will help create a content plan that ensures a consistent and reliable brand voice.



c) Rhetorical & Persuasive Content Creation: Weaving compelling stories and using rhetorical skills to create memorable, relatable content that fosters a strong emotional connection with our audience. Your writing will be clear, concise, and accurate to project professionalism and build credibility.



d) Human-Centric SEO Optimization: Creating content that genuinely answers the questions people are searching for. You'll use your expertise in on-page SEO (headlines, meta descriptions, internal linking) to help our valuable content get discovered by the right people.



e) Meticulous Editing & Proofreading: Polishing every piece of content to eliminate any errors that could undermine our credibility. You will adhere to our style guide to maintain a unified and trustworthy brand voice.



f) Insightful Performance Analysis: Focusing on engagement metrics that truly matter (like time on page, comment quality, and share rates) to understand what resonates with our audience and using that data to make our content strategy even better.



g) Authentic Community Engagement: Interacting with our audience in comments and on social media in a helpful and genuine way. You will listen to their feedback and questions to inform future content, showing them their voice is heard and valued.



[Goal]

As we grow, our ultimate goal is to build a loyal community that trusts our brand implicitly. By creating a foundation of exceptionally valuable, empathetic, and credible content, you will not only attract an audience but also turn them into advocates. Your work will be critical in establishing our brand as a leading authority in our field.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Proven Content Writing Experience: You have a strong portfolio of work (blog posts, video scripts, etc.) that demonstrates your ability to research topics thoroughly, write persuasively, and build a connection with an audience.



b) Possesses High Emotional Intelligence: You are empathetic and can easily put yourself in the audience's shoes. You understand how to use tone and language to create content that resonates on a personal level.



c) Is an Exceptional Storyteller & Communicator: You are meticulous in your research and can transform complex information into clear, compelling, and easy-to-read content. You are proactive and professional in your communications.



d) Has a Trust-First Mentality: You believe that the primary goal of content is to provide value and build a relationship. You are passionate about creating content that helps people and represents our company's values authentically.



e) Is Proficient with Content & SEO Tools: You are skilled in using tools for research, writing, and basic SEO (e.g., Google Docs, Grammarly, keyword research tools).



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can articulate your thoughts in a clear, logical manner.



Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean? Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.



The opportunity to be a foundational builder of our brand’s voice and authority.



Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.



A supportive environment where your creativity and writing skills are highly valued.



[About Us]

We are a growing team dedicated to achieving our goals through a culture of collaboration and mutual support. We believe that our success is a direct result of our team's well-being and that a positive environment is essential for creating outstanding work. Your role is absolutely critical to building a trusted relationship with the people we serve.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with either "Content Writing VA", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Please share ONLY one or two works you’re most proud of RATHER THAN including all past project, as time is limited.



2) Trust-Building Showcase: Walk me through a piece of content you've written that you feel was particularly successful in building trust with its audience. What was your thought process from ideation to the final draft, and how did you measure its impact beyond simple metrics?



3) Handling Criticism & Growth: Describe a time you received significant negative feedback on a piece of content you wrote. How did you handle the feedback, what did you learn from it, and how did it influence your approach to writing moving forward?



4) Strategic Challenge: Imagine our brand is facing some skepticism in the market about a new product or service. How would you develop a content strategy to address this skepticism and rebuild trust with our audience? What are the key ethical considerations you would keep in mind?



5) Ethical Persuasion: How would you explain the difference between 'persuasion' and 'manipulation' in copywriting? Can you provide an example from your own work where you consciously chose a persuasive, rather than manipulative, approach?



6) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to tools for research, writing, editing, and SEO? Please mention why you prefer them.



7) AI in Your Workflow: Explain where and how you use AI to improve your content creation productivity (e.g., for research, brainstorming, editing), and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI to preserve authenticity and trust. (We expect you aren't using AI to answer these questions, as they will be discussed further in an interview.)



8) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



9) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with us. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.

title: Paid Social Creative Strategist
description:
About Us



We are a rapidly growing direct-to-consumer electronics brand specializing in protective earbuds. Launched just three months ago, we've achieved exceptional growth through strategic Meta advertising campaigns. Our current team includes two video editors, one customer service representative, and partnership with specialized agencies for
 marketing and Google Ads.



Position Overview



We're seeking an experienced Paid Social Creative Strategist to drive our next phase of growth on Meta platforms. This role will take full ownership of creative strategy as we scale our Meta advertising spend from $120,000/month to a minimum of $500,000/month. We believe exceptional creative is the key lever that will unlock this growth trajectory.



Key Responsibilities



* Creative Strategy Development: Develop and execute comprehensive creative strategies aligned with scaling objectives on Meta platforms

* Video Brief Production: Produce 15-20 detailed video creative briefs per week (1-2 minutes in length each)

* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with our in-house video editing team to refine creative output through detailed feedback, revisions, and quality control

* Creator Management: Coordinate with content creators to source, direct, and optimize video content production

* Performance Analysis: Monitor creative performance metrics and iterate strategies based on data-driven insights

* Trend Identification: Stay current on Meta advertising best practices, platform updates, and creative trends within the e-commerce and consumer electronics space



Requirements



* Proven Experience: Extensive hands-on experience managing creative strategy for high-performing Meta advertising campaigns

* Scale Experience: Demonstrated track record of scaling Meta ad accounts, preferably from six figures to seven figures monthly in spend

* Direct-Response Expertise: Deep understanding of direct-response creative principles and what drives performance in e-commerce

* Production Knowledge: Strong understanding of video production workflows and effective collaboration with editors and creators

* Data-Driven Approach: Ability to analyze creative performance data and translate insights into actionable strategy

* Portfolio Required: Must provide portfolio demonstrating relevant experience with Meta ad creative



What We Offer



*High-Impact Role: Direct influence on company growth during a critical scaling phase

*Collaborative Environment: Work with a lean, focused team of specialists

*Growth Opportunity: Potential to transition to full-time as we scale

*Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere

*Creative Autonomy: Ownership over creative strategy direction

title: Video Editor (YouTube Long-form)
description:
[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract

You may choose either Part-time(+3hrs/day) or Full-time



[Caution]

You’ll be using plugins in After Effects for motion and transitions, so please continue only if you’re already comfortable and experienced working in After Effects.



[Salary]

-$100 per project

-$300 USD commitment bonus after completing 10 projects (you will be paid $100+$300 for every 10th project you complete)

-You don't have to search for the visual elements such as video clips, images, talking-heads since all the elements will be provided.

-I can provide 1~2 projects each week as long as you can manage (our current editor says he can consistently handle around 1.5–2 projects per week after being fully aligned with the workflow and preferred style).

-Expect the first project will take longer as we need to adjust to the desired working style. But as we get on to the 2nd, 3rd, ... it will take less time as there will be less corrections to make.



[What You’ll Do]

IMPORTANT-> Here's a sample video(you must watch it before applying): 

-All the ingredients(images, video clips, voice-over, talking-head, BGM and script) for the video will be provided.

-You will select images that best match the context from the provided asset folder, place them at the appropriate timestamps, and add motion, transitions, sound effects, and background music.

-Use After Effect plugins such as Mister Horse and Flow to add dynamic motions.

-The images or video clips must match with what's being spoken by the voice-over.

-Collaborate with me or our team to ensure the visuals meet aesthetic and desired output.



*In the beginning, your edits will get a few rounds of feedback for refinement while adjusting to the preferred video style. But as you're aligned and become familiar, you won't need my feedback and refinement as much.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:

-Communicates effectively and values mutual respect.

-Has a creative editing skill for visually appealing videos; to avoid viewer's boredom.

-Has strong time management skills to meet deadlines.

-Is accountable and committed to the role.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. 

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your schedule. (You’re welcome to work at night and submit your draft. While you’re asleep, it will be reviewed and feedback will be ready within 12 hours.)

-Long-term growth opportunities as the channel expands.

-A supportive environment that values creativity and contributions.



[About Us]

We help YouTube creators master storytelling techniques to captivate audiences and achieve viral success. Your role will play a key part in bringing our vision to life and empowering creators worldwide.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “VIDEO EDIT”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:

1. Portfolio: Share 2-3 of your best projects involving video editing with motion graphic.

2. Work History: Explain any experience or projects involving motion graphics or After Effects.

3. After Effects Skill: Please rate your After Effects skill level on a 5-star scale.

4. Available Hours: Let us know when you are available for our work each day of the week(For example:Monday: 11:00AM - 2:00PM, Tuesday: 3:30PM - 8:00PM, Wednesday: ..., etc)

5. Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 3 months with additional projects forward.

6. Whether or not you're willing to be on a Zoo
eting: We prefer Zoo
eting because this shows your accountability as well as it drives our team to the same goal together.



I will respond to your application in 7 days all at once.

title: ## **Virtual Assistant – Architectural Drafting & Estimating (AutoCAD | Los Angeles Experience Required)**
description:
## **Virtual Assistant – Architectural Drafting & Estimating (AutoCAD | Los Angeles Experience Required)**



We are seeking an experienced **Virtual Assistant** with a strong background in **AutoCAD drafting and architectural estimating**, who has **previously worked for a U.S.-based company on projects located in the City of Los Angeles**.



This role supports **residential and commercial construction projects**, with a focus on producing accurate **working drawings** and reliable cost estimates that align with U.S. and Los Angeles standards.



### **Responsibilities**



* Produce and revise **architectural working drawings** using **AutoCAD**

* Assist in developing permit-ready and construction-level drawings

* Perform quantity takeoffs and cost estimates for architectural finishes, including:



  * Drywall

  * Framing

  * Flooring

  * Painting



* Review plans, details, and specifications for accuracy, scope completeness, and constructability

* Support bid preparation, scope reviews, and project coordination



### **Mandatory Requirements**



* Proven experience **working for a U.S. company based in Los Angeles**

* Direct experience on **City of Los Angeles projects**

* Strong proficiency in **AutoCAD**

* Demonstrated experience producing **working drawings** (not conceptual only)

* Working knowledge of **U.S. construction codes and standards**

* Familiarity with LADBS drawings, plan sets, and common review comments

* Experience with residential and/or commercial construction projects



### **Preferred Qualifications**



* Experience working with architects, engineers, or general contractors

* Familiarity with AUTOCAD

* Ability to identify scope gaps, conflicts, and coordination issues early

* Undertanding of Structural Systems (ie Simpson Ties, and Hardware)



### **Compensation**

Experienced level (Mean): Monthly: approximately $925.00 - $1,135.00 per month (?52,800 - ?64,600 per month) | Hourly: approximately $5.98 per hour (?341 per hour)



* **Wages are negotiable** and will be discussed **after vetting and skills assessment**

* Position is **remote**

* Flexible hours (part-time or project-based to start)



### **What We Value**



* Accuracy, consistency, and accountability

* Clear communication

* Ability to translate drawings into buildable construction documents

title: Operations Agent || Australian Asset and Personal Finance
description:
Hi there, 



I am currently looking for an additional operations specialist/executive (preferably but not necessarily with Asset Finance/Mortgage Finance experience), to help with our day to day operations, loan administration and pipeline management. 



Experience: 

Worked in the financial services industry for over 2 years.

Worked in another related industry (insurance, real estate, financial planning, accounting for) 5 + years.

Is familiar with basic Australian Laws and Governance. 



Skills: 

Very High Attention to Detail!

Adaptable and can quickly pick up new tasks!

Highly trustworthy!

Excellent written and verbal communication skills!



About the company: 



Swyft Finance is an award winning smaller ticket finance brokerage situated in Sydney Australia, that has now been operating for the last 4+ years. We are one of Australia’s largest independent and individual loan writers, and pride ourselves on helping clients achieve market-leading, highly accurate, predictable, stress-free, price competitive and swift financial services. 



Our main area of speciality includes

Commercial Asset Finance (Trucks, Machines, Vans, Cars, Robotics)

Consumer Asset Finance (Cars, Bikes, Recreational Assets)

Commercial Unsecured Finance (Line of credits, business term loans, Invoice Finance)

Consumer Unsecured Finance (Personal Loans)



Pay: Between ?40, 000 to  ?60, 000 per month. 



Unlike most brokerages that work with 8 - 10 lenders, our panel currently has over 60 lenders. Our business is positioned as a support service to mainly three professional groups which includes: 



Mortgage Brokers

Accountants

Financial Planners



These professionals refer their clients to us, and we have arranged a commission agreement for them when they refer a successful customer. 



About the job: 



Your role in the company will include wearing multiple hats at the same time, and you will be an integral part of the team. 



Data Entry of customer details into the Mercury Platform 

Proofreading and ensuring loan documents are correctly executed 

Assessing bank statements and business financials 

Submitting loan applications across multiple lender platforms 

Creating and improving/suggesting new Standard Operating Procedures 

Writing invoices and Recipient Created Tax Invoices 

Understands the requirements of making a loan submission 





The characteristics we look for in a successful candidate: 



Strong attention to detail. 

Is focussed on understanding the whole picture, learning the business and asking questions (instead of just completing tasks blindly). 

Is trustworthy as they will be handling sensitive information. 

Is independent, and picks up new skills quickly. 

Is hard working, and will always make sure the job is done correctly. 



Benefits of working with Swyft Finance: 



Bonuses and rewards structure in place for long term employees. 

Open minded employer, who wants to learn from their VA and take their advice on board. 

Daily interaction with employer 

7am - 3:30pm will be your working hours

Work from home 

Strong career progression and learning opportunities. 

Flexible Vacation (just ask me if you need time off and we can organize) 

Likes to go on video calls, and albeit you will be working remote, you like a strong sense of belonging and community at work. 

Top earners that started in your job make over ?100, 000 per month.



How to apply for this job: 



Send me an
 to 

Subject will have to be “I want to work with you [First Name and Last Name] from [https://(the website address for Swyft Finance)]” [This will require you to search me and find me on Linkedin And research the company]

Copy and paste the Swyft Finance Logo in the

At the top of your message write 2-3 sentences on why you would like this position, and why you are a good fit. Do not write more than that or else your application will be deleted.

Under that name 5 lenders in Australia that are not a big bank.

Inside of that
 attach your Resume, but do it as a Google Drive link please!







What is the recruitment process: 



If we are happy with your above submission, you will be directed to a small assignment and can schedule your own interview with us. 

The deadline for the submission will be the 2400 (AEST) before the day of your interview. 

We will do an interview and take you through a typical day in the life of working at Swyft Finance

If successful we will organize your start date. 



We look forward to hearing from you, 



Kind regards, 

Saura

mber who's been with me for 9 months and we work well together.

1. Examples of LinkedIn posts, newsletters, or related content you’ve written

2. List any writing experience or English writing qualifications 

3. Explain your process for how you turn ideas into content

4. Share an example from the internet of a LinkedIn post or business article you think is exceptionally well written. Include the link and explain what you like about the writing.



Optional:

- Send a short selfie-style video (no AI, no script, no editing) explaining who you are and why you’d be a good fit.

title: Video Editor
description:
Video Editor & Social Media Manager — Wilmington Strength

Job Type: Part-Time / Ongoing

Budget: $300–$500/month (depending on experience)

Hours: Flexible, roughly 10–15 hours/week



About Us

Wilmington Strength is a private strength and speed training gym in Wilmington, NC. We specialize in making team sport athletes faster through sprint training, plyometrics, change of direction work, and Olympic lifting. We have 100+ athletes and are growing fast. We need someone to help us turn raw training footage into content that gets attention.

What You'll Be Doing

Video Editing (Primary)



Edit 1 long-form YouTube video per week (training tutorials, educational content — think: how to clean, hamstring injury prevention, sprint mechanics). These are mostly talking-head + training footage with simple cuts, text overlays, and light graphics.

Edit short-form reels/clips from raw training footage. Most reels are simple — a kid hitting a PR on a lift or a fast sprint time, set to music with a caption. Occasionally we'll do something with a bit more production value.

Repurpose long-form YouTube content into short-form clips for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and
.



Social Media Posting & Scheduling



Write captions (or refine drafts I provide) for all posts.

Schedule and post content across Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, and
.

Maintain a consistent posting schedule (we'll work together on frequency — likely 3–5 reels/week + 1 YouTube upload).



What We're Looking For



Experience editing fitness, sports, or coaching content (show me examples)

Ability to create engaging short-form content with text overlays, captions, and music

YouTube thumbnail creation — this is important, not optional

Familiarity with posting and scheduling tools for Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, and

Reliable, communicative, and able to meet deadlines

Understanding of what performs well on each platform (vertical for IG/TikTok, horizontal for YouTube, etc.)



Bonus (Not Required)



Basic graphic design skills

Knowledge of strength training, sports performance, or athletics



How to Apply

Send me:



A brief intro about yourself and your experience

Links to 2–3 examples of short-form or long-form content you've edited (fitness/sports preferred but not required)

A YouTube thumbnail you've created

Your availability and timezone



Paid Test Edit: Top applicants will be given access to a Google Drive folder with raw training footage (a 10-minute tutorial on how to do a clean, plus some short clips of athletes performing the lift). Your task will be to produce one edited long-form YouTube video, one short-form reel, and a thumbnail. This is a paid test — we want to see your actual work with our content before making a final hire.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: customer service/ funding expert
description:
Funding & Credit Specialist (Personal & Business Funding)



Location:



Remote / Hybrid (U.S.-Based Preferred)



Job Type:



Full-Time or Part-Time (Flexible)



Compensation:



Base Pay + Commission (High Earning Potential)

Performance bonuses available



?



Job Description



We are seeking a motivated, professional, and results-driven Funding & Credit Specialist to join our growing team. This role requires clear, confident, and professional English communication, as you will be speaking directly with clients regarding personal and business funding opportunities.



This position is ideal for individuals who are confident on the phone, detail-oriented, and able to clearly explain financial information to clients.



?



Responsibilities

    •    Communicate clearly and professionally in English with clients via phone, text, and online platforms

    •    Pre-qualify clients for personal and business funding

    •    Explain credit and funding requirements in a simple, understandable way

    •    Guide clients through the funding application process from start to finish

    •    Follow up with leads and maintain strong client relationships

    •    Maintain accurate records and documentation

    •    Meet weekly and monthly performance goals

    •    Follow all company policies and compliance guidelines



?



Required Qualifications

    •    Fluent, clear, and professional English speaking skills (REQUIRED)

    •    Strong verbal and written communication skills

    •    Sales or customer service experience (preferred, not required)

    •    Ability to confidently speak with clients on the phone

    •    Self-motivated and disciplined

    •    Reliable internet and phone/computer access



?



Preferred Qualifications

    •    Experience in funding, credit repair, or financial services

    •    Social media or CRM experience

    •    Goal-driven mindset



?



What We Offer

    •    Flexible schedule

    •    Competitive commission structure with no income cap

    •    Training and ongoing support

    •    Opportunity for growth and leadership

    •    Bonuses and incentives for top performers



?



How to Apply



To apply, please submit:

    •    Full Name

    •    Brief work background

    •    Confirmation that you are fluent in spoken and written English



Only serious and professional applicants will be considered.
